loans.name: Walter Antonio

texts.es:
Walter, de 39 años de edad, estudio segundo año de bachillerato general, está acompañado y su pareja le ayuda en los trabajos agrícolas, tienen cuatro hijos que viven junto a ellos y tres de ellos estudian.

Walter, trabaja como agente de vigilancia en una hidroeléctrica desde hace dos años, pero antes trabajaba en otra cuidad; ahora cuando tiene días libres se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura.

Walter, necesita el préstamo para comprar 50 libras de frijoles, abono y fertilizantes para la milpa, con la ayuda del préstamo su necesidad será satisfecha y podrá sembrar los granos básicos para obtener una buena cosecha.

Su sueño es darle todo lo necesario para su familia y darle a sus hijos el estudio hasta que ellos puedan obtener un titulo universitario y que tengan oportunidades de desarrollo mucho mejores.
texts.en:
Walter, 39 years old, studied up to grade eight.  He lives common law and his partner helps him with his agricultural work.  They have four children who live with them and three of them are in school.

Walter has been working as a security guard in a hydroelectric power plant for two years, but previously worked in another city.  Currently, when he gets days off he works in agriculture.

Walter needs the loan to purchase 50 pounds of beans, compost and fertilizer for the corn fields.  With the help of the loan his need will be met and he will be able to plant basic grains for a good harvest.

His dream is to give his family everything they need and to give his children an education where they can obtain a university degree and have much better development opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase 50 pounds of beans, compost and fertilizer for the corn.

loans.name: By Pass Nursery & Day Care School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Willy. He is the director of By Pass Nursery & Day Care School, a mixed school in the urban area of Kyebando in Kampala with 350 students.

By Pass Nursery & Day Care School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent, clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term as the cost of firewood will be reduced.

The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

By Pass Nursery & Day Care School will repay the loan from its school fees, which it collects each term. Willy ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children who fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increasing the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

borrowers.first_name: By Pass Nursery & Day Care School

loans.name: Emanuel Group

texts.es:
Patricia es una mujer de 26 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 7 años, y su negocio es la panadería.
Ella es buena madre, optimista y muy sincera. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘el torno’ área rural que acopia gran parte de la producción agrícola del lugar.
Patricia es morena de cabello negro largo y baja estatura, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español (al centro viste polera y jean azul). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de madera que cuenta sólo con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo. La necesidad de mejorar su negocio por el bien de su familia la llevó a liderar la banca de emprendimiento, los negocios de los participantes son; llantería, venta de refrescos, venta de comida, venta de ropa de segunda mano, artesanía en cuero, elaboración de sombreros de sao y taller de electricidad. Su negocio es la panadería, ella hornea pan y masitas tradicionales como; cuñapé (a base de harina de yuca y queso), roscas de maíz, arepas y otros, “horneamos todo tipo de masas tradicionales porque es lo que la gente consume…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que los panes se venden a diario, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar harina. Su sueño es estabilizar su negocio, ella desea comprar harina de yuca, maíz y trigo por quintal. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Patricia solicita un préstamo para comprar diferentes tipos de harina por quintal.
texts.en:
Patricia is a 26 year old woman who lives with her partner and has two children, aged five and. Her business is a bakery.

She is a good mother, optimistic and very sincere. Her business takes place in ‘El Torno’ a rural area where the main part of the local agricultural product is gathered.

Patricia is dark-skinned with long black hair and is short in stature. Her native language is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish. (She is in the center in the photo wearing a blue shirt and blue jeans). She shares her life with her partner who works in construction and her children who study in school. They live in their own house made of wood that has electric energy and well water. The need to improve her business for the good of her family led her to head a communal bank. The businesses of the members are: a tire shop, selling soft drinks, selling food, selling second-hand clothing, leather handicrafts, making straw hats and an electric workshop.

Her business is a bakery. She bakes bread and traditional pastries like cuñapé (made from yucca flour and cheese), roscas de maíz, arepas and others. "I bake all kinds of traditional dough because it is what the people eat" she commented. The advantage of her business is that the breads sell every day, the disadvantage is the lack of money to buy flour. Her dream is to stabilize her business. She wants to buy yucca, corn and wheat flour by the quintal. This is her first loan in the year she has run this business.

It is for these reasons that Patricia is requesting a loan to buy different kinds of flour by quintal.

loans.use: to buy different types of flour by the quintal.

loans.name: Jaymer

texts.en:
Jaymer is a 42-year-old man from Valencia, Bohol. His place is 20 minutes away from the only city of the province. His wife works as a saleslady to help him in raising their four children, ages 9 to 18. Jaymer, on the other hand, works on his farm growing vegetables like squash and eggplants.

He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and more quality seeds to grow. He hope to have an abundant harvest so he can better support the needs of his children. Jaymer plans to manage his farm well for better revenue.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Mạnh

texts.en:
Mr Mạnh is 28 years old and he is married. Mạnh lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. He has had a service business laying bricks for eight years.

His family is a low-income household in village, moreover this region often suffers with natural disasters, such as storms, because it is near the sea.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns him is not having a hygienic latrine. He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

This is Mạnh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. He hopes this loan could make his little dream come true.

In the future, Mạnh hopes to build a new house, for his family to be healthy and happy, and to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Hồng's Group

texts.en:
Hồng is 46 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives in Dong Son district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Mrs. Hồng has been working in agriculture raising cattle for more than 10 years.

Her family is a low income household in village, moreover the income from this business is unstable because when some disease on cattle happens, they could die, which left her nothing to sell. And she will be in financial trouble.

The main hardship that Hồng faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

This is Hồng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. Her group consists of three members. She hopes that this loan could improve her living standards.

In the future, Hồng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Grace works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Grace is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell for her buy-and-sell vegetable business.

Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Mercy works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Mercy is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, spices, vegetables, can goods, etc for her restaurant business.

Mercy has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, spices, vegetables, can goods, etc

loans.name: Sherlene

texts.en:
Sherlene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of fishing net for her fishing business. She has been in this business for 10 years. Sherlene also earns more income from raising pigs.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of fishing net.

loans.name: Bertha Yolanda

texts.en:
Bertha, 55, is married. Her husband is a bricklayer and had go to an area far away from home to try and find work since there were no jobs close by. They have three children, Jenny, Erika, and William, who are trying to be successful and take advantage of the support their parents provide.

For three years, Bertha has had a business raising chickens, which is a source of basic income for her and her children and her 85-year-old father, Alfredo, whom she takes care of.

Bertha needs the loan to build two chicken coops, and buy medicines, chickens and chicken feed so she can increase her earnings and provide for herself, her children and her elderly father.

loans.use: to buy chickens, chicken feed, and vitamins, and to build two coops.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadijah is a repeat client who deals in poultry (chicken). She has been able to support her family from the funds received from UGAFODE by selling eggs and mature birds previously. Her challenge is that the birds are sick, and livestock doctors are scarce in her area of locality.

She wishes to get more money from Kiva through UGAFODE Microfinance Limited. She will use the loan to pay for more poultry that will boost her sales and profit.

Pictured is Hadijja and the UGAFODE credit staff in charge of her loan (left to right).

loans.use: to purchase poultry stock.

loans.name: Eliseo

texts.es:
Eliseo un hombre serio, disciplinado y perseverante con sus anhelos, tiene 29 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en una comunidad de san José Chacayá.
Eliseo para generar sus ingresos  y sacar adelante a su familia trabaja para una institución privada desde hace un año. Eliseo con el  afán de mejorar su casa ha decidido solicitar un préstamo para la remodelación de su casa con el crédito él comprara  cemento, cal arena para que pronto su casa tenga un mejor aspecto. Su esperanza de vida es seguir mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en:
Eliseo is a serious, disciplined man who is determined with respect to his desires. He is 29-years old and lives with his wife and children in a neighborhood of San José Chacayá.

In order to generate an income for his family and to get them ahead, Eliseo has worked at a private institution for the last year. Out of a desire to make improvements to his house, Eliseo has decided to request a loan to remodel. With the loan, he will purchase cement, limestone and sand so that soon his house will have an improved appearance. Eliseo's life hope is to continue improving his housing.

loans.use: to purchase cement, limestone and sand for remodeling his house.

loans.name: Chika's Group

texts.en:
Chika is 46 years old and a mother to 4 children. She lives with her husband, who is presently unemployed.

As a teacher in the rural primary school, she engages in different business all year round to meet her family responsibility. Teachers in rural areas face salary delay for months and if one is not engaged in other life sustaining activities, life becomes tougher. Chika and her fellow teachers joined Nke-Anyi cooperative and in the past have enjoyed the palm oil storage loan product.

A portion of this loan will enable Chika to purchase fresh palm fruits and process them for the market.

She spends her weekends at the mill and also evenings after school hours. Her children and her husband are also supporting her with the work.

Chika and her group members appreciate all Kiva lenders that show an interest in supporting their loan

loans.use: to process and store palm oil products.

loans.name: Vikash

texts.en:
Vikash is 30 years old and lives with his wife. Vikash was previously working for his family business. In 2011, he became eligible for his first microcredit and independently he started with rice cultivation. Since 2011 he has repaid all his loans fully and on time.

Vikash still has a long way to go, for he wants to expand his cultivated area and build his own house. He therefore needs to expand his rice production and requires a loan of SRD 5,000 to buy inputs like diesel and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy inputs like diesel and fertilizers.

loans.name: Gloria's Group

texts.en:
Gloria is a 48-year-old mother of 7. She lives with her husband, who is a carpenter. Annually Gloria processes palm oil for the local market; last year was her first loan with the cooperative. For her, that loan was a life changing experience because her income increased and she was able to meet her family responsibility and also afford to save with the cooperative.

A portion of this loan will help her store product next season. She hopes that by the end of next year, her savings with the cooperative will be enough for her to purchase a motorcycle of her own.

She thanks all Kiva lenders who supported her last year and this year.

loans.use: to process and store palm oil products.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Her name is Divina; she is age 48, widowed, and from the province of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Ever since her husband died, she has dedicated her life to raising her children and is thankful to God that she raised them well and they are all working. Being a widow has been her biggest challenge in life, but with her faith and perseverance she has come out of it victorious.

She has derived her income from her small general store for four years already. She continues to operate her business for her daily needs and to improve their living conditions. To help her expand her business, she is seeking a PHP 10,000 loan to fill her small store with grocery items such as rice, frozen foods, biscuits, canned good, instant noodles, eggs, etc. so she can compete well with other general stores nearby. Having more essential food items to offer will make her small store attractive to consumers.

Divina prays for her store to grow and that God will bless her and her children abundantly. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Presentation

texts.en:
Presentation is 65 years old, a widow with 4-adult-age children who lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental.

She runs and operates a hog raising business and earns a monthly income of PHP 8,000

She needs to purchase bags of animal feed & vitamins, so she asks for a loan from Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed & vitamins.

loans.name: María Albertina

texts.es:
María, de 68 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está casada, su esposo está en otro país, porque se fue en busca de un mejor futuro para su familia, tuvo 3 hijos.

María, se dedica a trabajar en los oficios del hogar desde que era una niña, ahora tiene una granja de pollos de engorde la cual administra junto a sus hijos, tienen más de 6 años de estar trabajando, ella considera que es un negocio que sabiéndolo administrar da las ganancias esperadas y su horario es bastante variado. 

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar 300 pollos y concentrado para ellos, porque se avecina la temporada navideña y quieren prepararse con producto para sus clientes, teniendo este producto ella podrá tener una mejor ganancia ya que tendrá más producto para sus clientes y mejorar sus ventas.

Ella, desea poder tener una mejor infraestructura en la granja donde pueda tener más pollo y crecerlo más rápido.
texts.en:
María is 68 years old. She studied until second grade. She is married. Her husband is in another country because he went in search of a better future for his family.

María work has worked doing household chores since she was a little girl. Now she has a chicken farm that she runs with her children. They have been working at this for more than 10 years. She considers that knowing how to run this business brings the expected earnings and her schedule is quite varied.

María needs the loan to buy 300 chickens and food for them because the Christmas season is coming and they want to be prepared with product for their customers. Having this product she will be able to have improved earnings. She will have more product for her customers and improved sales.

She wishes to be able to have an improved infrastructure on the farm where she will be able to have more chickens and to raise them more rapidly.

loans.use: to buy 300 chickens and food for them

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila works hard to support her family. She is married and has a boarding house rental business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for the repair of her boarding house, like cement, wood, nails, etc.

Mila has been in this business for three years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for the repair of her boarding house, like cement, wood, nails, etc.

loans.name: Wathu Group

texts.en:
Asiyatu is 40 years old and married. She has six children who depend on her. Her husband owns a second-hand shoe business.

Asiyatu owns a grocery store. She would like to use this loan to buy more groceries to stock up her store. The profits from the business will help her feed her family every day. She started her store to become more self-dependent and to provide household necessities.

Asiyatu plans to pay school fees for her children and hopes to build rental houses. She also hopes to buy a plot of land in Mangochi town to construct a shop.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for her store.

loans.name: Favor Group

texts.en:
Mphatso is 28 and married. She has two children and one orphan that depend on her. Her husband runs a small business selling cloth.

Mphatso operates a business selling zitenje (pieces of fabric that are worn as clothing). She would like to receive a loan to buy more zitenje to sell. The profits from the business help her to pay school fees and medical bills for her children.

She started her business so her family could become financially stable. With the profits from her business, she hopes to build a house. She also plans to open a shop for her business and to employ people to assist in the daily activities of the business.

loans.use: to buy zitenje (pieces of fabric that are worn as clothing).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: A loan of $450 helps this borrower to invest in maintenance, parts replacement, body work, upholstery, and paint in order to provide taxi service

loans.name: Agueda

texts.en: Agueda wants to improve her life quality. She was born in Potosi but she moved to El Alto.  Agueda is a good cook. She prepares hamburguers and hot dogs  Agueda is a single mother of 2 two kids who are going to school  Agueda wants a loan to buy more cow and chicken meat and to buy soft drinks for her business. She hopes you can help her. She works hard. She is in her stand too many hours, but she makes this sacrifice for her family

loans.use: to buy more cow and chicken meat and to buy soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Leyda Jackelinne

texts.es:
La joven Leyda Jackelinne  de 26  años de edad,  es casada y vive con su esposo y su hija en su casa propia,  se dedica desde hace  03  años al negocio de venta de abarrotería en general ella vende todo lo relacionado con la canasta familiar y todos los productos comunes o básicos de una pulpería,   vive en  Choluteca,  al sur de honduras, 
La joven Leyda es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de abarrotería como ser pollo, papel, maíz, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, huevos y otros más,  con el apoyo de este crédito ella pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre  2015
texts.en:
Leyda Jackelinne is a 26-year old young woman who is married and lives with her husband and daughter in their own home. For the last three years, she has made her living with a business selling groceries and general goods. She sells everything related to a family's basic needs, common products and basic groceries. She lives in Choluteca, in the south of Honduras.

Young Leyda is an enterprising woman with a desire to get ahead. She works hard day after day to improve her standard of living. She is requesting the loan to purchase grocery items such as chicken, paper, corn, beans, rice, sugar, eggs and other items. With the help of the loan, Leyda plans to improve her income and also her standard of living. She is a client with a desire to work with Prisma.

Leyda's dream is to have a good business, increase her clientele and, at the same time, improve her future together with her family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - September 2015

loans.use: to purchase chicken, paper, corn, beans, rice, sugar, eggs etc.

loans.name: Joselito

texts.en:
Joselito is happy that he was able to continue operation of his small general store through the support of Kiva and its supporters. His earnings covered his child’s high school education and daily needs. His other child is already married.

He trusts that he can again request funds in the amount a 19,000 PHP loan to pay for and refill his store with essential food items like rice, bread, instant noodles, canned goods and toiletries. He continues to be diligent and conscientious with his business to be able to provide for his family.

Joselito aims to grow his store into a big grocery store. He desires for his child to earn a college degree, as it is his hope for a better life. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in his business.

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Blanca Rosa de 35 años de edad, vive con su hijo y su mama en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 10 años al negocio de venta de rosquillas,  quesadillas y rosquetes, sus clientes son todos sus vecinos amistades y personas de pespire,vive en pespire al sur de Honduras.
Doña blanca es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como maíz, manteca y cuajada, con el apoyo de este crédito ella pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un clienta con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su hijo. 
San Lorenzo  Honduras -Septiembre  2015.
texts.en:
Blanca Rosa is 35 years old. She lives with her son and her mother in her own house. She lives in Pespire in the south of Honduras. For 10 years she has been working in her business selling donuts, quesadillas and rosquetes (traditional pastry made with corn). Her clients are her neighbors, friends and the people of Pespire.

Blanca is an enterprising woman with the desire to get ahead and she strives day by day to improve her quality of living. She is requesting a loan to buy products like corn, margarine and curd. With the help of this loan she hopes to improve her income and also her quality of living. She is a client who wants to work with Prisma.

Her dream is to have a good business and increase her clientele while improving her future together with her son.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -September 2015.

loans.use: to sell her homemade breads like donuts, quesadillas and rosquetes.

loans.name: Vincent Novy

texts.en:
His name is Vincent Novy; he is 20 years old, and from the province of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is newly married to Juliecel and has a toddler. Being a tricycle driver is no easy task, but Vincent Novy does not mind the scorching sun or the rains on the road during rainy season, as long as he can provide for his wife and his child.

He has been tricycle driver for four years already. A tricycle is a motorcycle with a sidecar that carries around four passengers. It is a common means of transportation in the Philippines and serves as a kind of taxi for short distance travel. A proper and regular maintenance of his tricycle is necessary to ensure efficient and safe service. In view of this, he is humbly seeking your help in the amount of 8,000 PHP to pay for new tires, registration, and tune-up of his tricycle.

Vincent Novy's simple dream is to buy one more tricycle to improve his income and give his young family a better future. He prays for God to bless his family. He faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for new tires, registration, and tune-up of his tricycle.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a bamboo weaving business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bamboo to weave.

Divina has been in this business for six years now. In the future, Divina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bamboo to weave.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de maiz desde hace 5 años, es un joven muy trabajador, pues quiere tener junto con su madre una mejor calidad de vida, por esa razon se dedico a trabajar en la tierra, el quiere seguir con su trabajo por esa razon esta solicitando un credito INTEGRAL para la compra de los insumos agricolas necesarios como: fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y asi poder obtener una buena cosecha para cuando la venda pueda obtener buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
The young man, whose face has been pixelated because he is twenty-three years old and lives in a high risk area, has been growing corn for 5 years. He is a very hard worker because he wants to have a better quality of life together with his mother. This is why he makes his living working on the land.  

He wants to continue his work, which is why he is requesting this INTEGRAL loan to buy necessary agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, manure, pest controls, etc. This way he will be able to obtain a good harvest so that when he sells it he will be able to gain better profits.

loans.use: to buy necessary agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, manure, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina has previously received a number of loans through Kiva, which definitely helped fund the maintenance and registration of her jeepney. It ensured good performance of her jeep, thus continuous income to help support their daily needs.

She hopes that you can again entrust her an amount of PHP 50,000 to pay for new tires, spare parts, oil change and tune-up of her jeepney unit. A proper and regular maintenance of her jeepeny will ensure safe and efficient service of her public transport service. Her jeepney means a lot to her for it helps provide for their daily food and household expenses.

Avelina prays for additional means of income, so she can save for their old age. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for new tires, spare parts, oil change and tune-up of her jeepney unit.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is deeply encouraged by Kiva and its lenders for their kind hearts and lending her funds several times in the past, which really helped sustain and grow her store. It has encouraged her to be more diligent in growing her business and she is forever grateful for your help.

Once again she trusts that you could lend her funds in the amount of PHP 30,000 to refill her store with more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, which she sells at retail. Her store means a lot to her since it has been her source of income, which sustains her family's basic needs and sending her children to school. She is hopeful for your positive response.

She prays for God to prosper her store to be able to save for her children's College Education. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed at her variety store.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 52 years old, married and has five children.

Lorna is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Lorna requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pig.

In the future, Lorna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 52 years old and widowed with six children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has been in pig fattening for 25 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Nora is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila, 55, is a married woman with one child who is still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Lucila has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Lucila requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish net, bamboo and gasoline for her boat.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish net, bamboo and gasoline for her boat.

loans.name: Pinena

texts.en:
Pinena, 57, is a married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Pinena has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 37 years.

Pinena requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like coconut, sugar, banana, etc. for her food-production business.

In the future, Pinena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like coconut, sugar, banana, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Mathura

texts.en:
Mathura is a differently abled man of 43 years. He is married and is a father of three children. He hails from a village of Dhenkanal district, Odisha, India.

Mathrua is a man with sheer patience and wit. He has been earning his livelihood and supporting his family by selling snacks items like cakes, biscuits, mixtures, namkeens and sweets. He has a very large and loyal customer base due to his humble and kind behavior and due to his superior quality of service.

He has been in this business for seven years. The unique selling proposition of Mathura is that he provides door-to-door service to all his customer base.

He is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR to purchase additional snack items in bulk and enlarge and expand his business. The loan amount will help in increasing his customer base as well as in getting a higher return on his investment. Ultimately, this will result in his having a better and a higher standard of living.

Mathura aspires to open a big shop where he will stock varieties of snacks, bakery items and beverages in order to attract a premium segment of the customer base two years down the line.

loans.use: to purchase additional snacks items in bulk and enlarge and expand his business.

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
MARIA SOLEDAD, tiene 36 años de edad, ella es socia del grupo "Las Mercedes" formado por seis integrantes.
María Soledad tiene un pequeño negocio ambulante de venta de golosinas y bebidas el cual le ha ayudado a cubrir sus necesidades durante cinco años aproximadamente que viene trabajando. Hoy en día ella desea incursionar en el negocio de venta de ropa, para lo cual el préstamo recibido lo invertirá en comprar mercadería como blusas, polos, pantalones para damas que es lo que mas le han pedido. Espera que en éste nuevo negocio le vaya bien, y pueda obtener una mayor ganancia y pueda hacer crecer rápido tanto su negocio como clientela.
texts.en:
Maria Soledad is 36 years old.  She is a member of the group "Las Mercedes", made up of six people. Maria Soledad has a small street vending business selling candies and beverages, which has helped cover her necessities for the approximately five years she has been working.  

These days she would like to venture into the business of clothing sales, which is why she will invest the loan received into buying merchandise like blouses, t-shirts, and pants for ladies, which is what she has been asked for most.  She hopes that this new business goes well for her, and that she is able to obtain more profit and quickly grow her business as well as her clientele.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie started her small-time business two decades ago in Badian, Cebu. She has managed to have enough inventory and gain more profits, but sometimes her stock is taken on credit, a common practice in the villages of Cebu.

With this, she is in need of additional capital so she can restock her shelves. She will use it to buy more stocks of merchandise such as canned sardines, beef loaf, shampoo, bath soap, milk, coffee, sugar, matches, biscuits and liquor. In the future, she hopes to be more sustainable and save enough for old age and business expansion.

loans.use: to buy canned sardines, beef loaf, shampoo, bath soap, milk, coffee, sugar,  matches, biscuits and liquor.

loans.name: Ma. Nora

texts.en:
Ma. Nora is 42 years old and married. She has three children, one of whom is still in school. Ma. Nora works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Nora runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years.

Ma. Nora requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, snack foods, soap, shampoo and other personal care products.

In the future, Ma. Nora would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, snack foods, soap, shampoo and other personal care products.

loans.name: Margelyn

texts.en:
Margelyn is 53 years old and has seven children. She is married and has one child still in school. She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines.

Margelyn has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers, vegetable seeds and other farm supplies. She has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Margelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, vegetable seeds and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Susaneth

texts.en:
Susaneth is 49 years old, married and has five children.

She earns a living by raising goats in the Philippines. She has been raising goats for five years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Susaneth is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional goats to raise.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goats to raise.

loans.name: Emierose

texts.en:
Emierose is 31 years old, married and has two children, who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She has been farming sugarcane for five years now and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Emierose requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Marylou

texts.en:
Marylou is a single woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marylou is 40 years old and has two children presently in school. She has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Marylou has requested a PHP 29,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat, and other materials. She has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat, and other materials.

loans.name: Lory

texts.en:
Lory works hard to support her family. Lory is married and has a farming sugarcane business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years now.

She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fertilizers and pay laborers' salaries.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Lory would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers and pays for laborers' salaries.

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Luis, de 22 años de edad, el no tuvo el privilegio de asistir a la escuela, es agricultor y está soltero en casa y vive con su madre y tres hermanas que económicamente de él solo depende su madre.

Luis, se dedica a la agricultura, toda su vida se ha dedicado a esto, pero aparte de eso trabaja como corralero en una ganadería y es esa su fuente de ingresos con lo que aporta todo para su casa.

Luis, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas como: semilla, abono, fertilizantes y para pago mano de obra que le ayudo a la siembra de granos básicos, también termino de cancelar una deuda que tenía pendiente.

Luis, sueña con seguir estudiar.
texts.en:
Luis is 22 years old. He didn't have the privilege of going to school. He is a farmer and is single. He live with his mother and three sisters. Only his mother depends on him economically. Luis works in agriculture. He has spent his whole life in it. Apart from that he also works with livestock on a farm, and that is his source of income from which he pays for everything for his house.

Luis needs the loan to buy agricultural supplies such as seed, manure and fertilizers, and to pay for labor that helped him plant staple grains. He also finished paying off a pending debt. Luis dreams of going back to school.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies like seed, manure and fertilizers, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Richard Calvin

texts.en:
Richard Calvin is a repeat client of UGAFODE, who has previously taken loans of 5M and 2M. He deals in special hire, using his Toyota Premio that he acquired through Kiva funding.

His business prospect is to purchase a bus and have many other Toyota Premios to enable him to get more sources of funding. He must compete with mushrooming businesses of his type that are coming up in his locality.

He is grateful for the funds because he earns a living for his family. He appreciates the vision held by Kiva funders to pull people out of poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a vehicle for a special-hire taxi.

loans.name: Ramon Antonio

texts.es: Don Ramon de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica al cultivo de maiz desde hace varios años, vende sus productos en los diferentes mercados que estan cerca de su casa y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando nuevamente un credito para la compra de abono, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, etc. y asi poder continuar con sus cultivos ya que le generan buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Ramon is 57 years old and lives with his wife in a house he owns. For five years he has worked growing corn. He sells his products in different markets close to his house. With the income he makes he is able to meet some of the household expenses.

He is seeking another loan to buy manure, fertilizers, pesticides, etc., in order to be able to continue with his planting, since it generates good income.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomás con 59 años de edad, de estado civil casado, vive junto a sus esposa,en el distrito de Cañaris,provincia de Ferreñafe,departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú. Tomás cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.

Tomás se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de arroz, junto a su familia se esfuerzan en la labor que realiza. Solicita préstamo para el pago de mano de obra de jornaleros que realizan las labores agrícolas en su cultivo de arroz. De esta manera tener buenos rendimientos en su cultivo.

Tomás es socio recurrente en Edpyme Alternativa. Ha manejado cuatro créditos, los cuáles los a cancelado de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Tomás, at 59 years old and civilly married, lives with his wife in the district of Cañaris, in the province of Ferreñafe, department of Lambayeque in the country of Peru. Tomás has very good personal and work referrals by the locals of the area.

Tomás makes his living through agriculture, specifically growing rice together with his family and he exerts himself in the work he does. He is asking for this loan to pay for labor costs of the day workers that complete the agricultural work in his rice cultivation. In this way he has a good yield for his harvest.

Tomás is a recurring member in Edpyme Alternativa. He has handled four loans, which he has paid off punctually.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs of the day workers that complete the agricultural work in his rice cultivation.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Don Antonio vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica a la crianza de ganado lechero, se dedica a esa actividad desde hace 40 años y comercializa la leche en os pueblos aledaños, ya tiene clientes establecidos, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas es como logra salir adelente, el esta solicitando un credto para la compra de dos vacas para continuar conla crianza y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Antonio lives with his family group in a home he owns. He works breeding dairy cattle. He has worked in this business for 40 years, and sells the milk in the neighboring towns. He now has established customers. The earnings he makes from his sales is how he gets ahead.

He is seeking a loan to buy two cows to continue with the breeding, and thereby have greater economic earnings to provide a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Robena

texts.en:
Robena is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 36 years old and has one child still in school. She has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Robena has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat, and maintenance for her business. She has been in this business for five years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat, and maintenance for her business.

loans.name: Rube

texts.en:
Rube is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 39 years old and has two children who are currently in school. Rube has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell. Rube has been in this business for four years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a construction supply business in the Philippines.

Margarita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional construction supplies to sell.

Margarita has been in this business for 12 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional construction supplies to sell.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a hard-working woman entrepreneur.

She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from her general store.

Merlinda dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Jose Valentin

texts.es:
Valentín, de 52 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, debido a la situación económica no pudo continuar sus estudios, está casado y su esposa es empleada y trabaja en la ciudad, es padre de tres hijos el primero de ellos estudia segundo año de la carrera de medicina, la segunda estudia segundo año de licenciatura en ciencias jurídicas y el tercero estudia tercer año de bachillerato.

Valentín, tiene 25 años de trabajar en al área de la caficultura, sus padres lo llevaban a las fincas para que les ayudará y él se acostumbro a caminar en medio de tanta vegetación y fue así como le gusto y cuando el pudo hacer sus proyectos con sus propios fondos se dedico a esta actividad.- El lugar donde trabaja está a tres kilómetros de su casa, a veces se transporta a pie y a veces en carro y generalmente trabaja de 6:00 a.m. a 1:00 de la tarde.

Valentín, necesita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes como sulfato y formula para el cultivo de café y para pagar mano de obra, que le ayude a realizar estas actividades; el préstamo le beneficiara porque podrá mejorar sus cosechas y generar más ganancias para cubrir las necesidades de su casa.

Los sueños del Valentín, son que sus hijos terminen sus estudios universitarios, para que puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida.- También quiere comprar una parcela más de terreno para ampliar el área donde siembra café.
texts.en: Valentin is 52 years old. He studied up to high school because of his financial situation. He is married and his wife is an employee and works in the city. He is the father of three children. The first son is in his second year of medical school, the second daughter is in her second year of judicial sciences and the third son is in his third year of high school. Valentin has been working in coffee agriculture for 25 years. His parents would take him to farms to help them, and he got used to walk in the midst of so much vegetation. He liked it so much so that when he was able to do his projects with his own funds, he worked in this activity.  His place of work is at three kilometers from his house. Sometimes, he travels by foot and sometimes by car, and generally he works from 6:00 a.m. to 1:00 in the afternoon. Valentin needs the loan to buy fertilizers, such as sulfate and formula to cultivate coffee and pay for hand labor to help him with these activities. With the loan, he will be able to improve his harvests and generate more income for household expenses. Valentin's dreams are for his children to finish their college careers so they can have a better quality of life. He also wants to buy one more plot of land to expand the area where he grows coffee.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers such as sulfate and formula for cultivating coffee and to pay for hand labor.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 41-year-old, married man with six children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer growing food crops like bananas and tomatoes; in addition he builds houses by taking on contracts to get more money. He started these businesses with a hope of empowering his family economically. He faces a challenge of inadequate capital that hinders growth of his businesses.

Besides that, he is working very hard to make sure he finishes his house construction and expands his garden to a big harvest. Stephen has asked for a loan to buy bricks and cement for his house construction.

loans.use: to buy bricks and cement for his house construction.

loans.name: Misma

texts.en:
Misma is 65 years old, married and has four children.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Misma has been pig fattening for 10 years now, and she has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Misma requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

In the future, Misma would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 47-year-old married man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.

He is a farmer, growing coffee and rearing cows and goats on a large scale. He started these activities way back in 1995 in a rural area with a hope of increasing his family income.

He is facing a hardship of fluctuating market prices that lower his overall profit. In future, he hopes to educate all his children to higher levels of learning and develop his family.

Peter needs a loan to buy coffee seeds for planting.

loans.use: to buy coffee seeds for planting.

loans.name: Antonio Rodrigo

texts.es:
Antonio es un hombre de 33 años de edad, casado con una  linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre 8 y 13 años de edad. Esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Antonio es un padre de familia que trabaja de sol a sol para que a su familia no le haga falta nada, él desde hace 20 años trabaja como albañil, construyendo en su comunidad casas modernas y de buena calidad. Antonio con el afán de prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes ahora solicita un préstamo para la compra de herramientas de albañilería tales como: serruchos, corta hieros. 
Su gran sueño es poder tener su propia casa, y mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir mejor los gastos de su familia.
texts.en:
Antonio is a 33-year old man. He is married with a lovely family of two children who are 8 and 13 years old. This humble family lives in a community of Sololá. Antonio is a parent who works from sun up to sun down so that his family doesn't lack anything. For 20 years, he has worked as a builder, building good-quality modern houses in his community.

With the eagerness of giving his customers a better service, Antonio is now asking for a loan to buy masonry tools such as saws and short irons. His big dream is to be able to have his own home and to improve his income to better cover his family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy masonry tools such as saws and short irons.

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa is a 47-year-old woman from the community of Alegria, Cebu. She is married and has a 13-year-old daughter.

She runs a sari-sari (variety) store business and a vulcanizing shop. This is her main livelihood that she uses in providing for her family.

She is asking a loan to buy tires, sachet items of Milo, milk, sugar, toothpaste, hair conditioner, canned food and biscuits.

Andresa hopes to keep her business, manage it well and make expansions in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy tires, sachet items of Milo, milk, sugar, toothpaste, hair conditioner,  canned food and biscuits.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Melchora is a 57-year-old married woman from Dumanjug, Cebu.

Melchora works hard to earn a living through hog raising. She has been raising hogs for 12 years now. This business provides her the income that she needs for their expenses.

Melchora is asking for a loan from CEVI to buy piglets, feed and food for family consumption. She believes that if she will be provided support through loans, she will be able to improve her business to generate more revenue and obtain additional piglets to raise, maximizing income in four months.

Melchora dreams of living a prosperous life.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and food for family consumption.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 46 years old, married, and has five dependents, ages 7 to 19.

She is raising hogs for an income so she can help meet the needs of her family. She plans to use her loan to buy hog feed to fatten her hogs.

Nancy hopes that she will be able to produce healthy hogs that will attract buyers from the market at a good price, thus giving her a good return on her investment.

She plans to improve and increase the hogs that she is raising in the future so her business will be more stable.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Precilla

texts.en:
Precilla joined CEVI to gain access to its services. She is 54 years old from Malabuyoc, Cebu. She is supporting a 15-year-old son by operating a sari-sari (variety) store business. She is making good sales daily.

She wants to take advantage of the demand so she would like to increase her inventory so she can expand her store in the future. She plans to use her loan to buy canned goods, toothpaste, shampoo, insect repellent, canned sardines, seasoning, detergent powder, soy sauce, vinegar, cooking oil and bath soap. sauce.

In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, toothpaste, shampoo, insect repellent, canned sardines, seasoning, detergent powder, soy sauce, vinegar, bath soap, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith continúa con su negocio de fabricación y venta de muebles. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió comprando madera, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque no tuvo problemas. Actualmente su negocio prospera, los muebles rotan diariamente y tiene la necesidad continua de comprar madera, “compro madera de todo tipo y según lo que haya en oferta…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que los muebles tienen buena acogida y se venden, la desventaja es la faltz de dinero para comprar madera por mayor. Su sueño es abrir una mueblería, ella desea comprar madera por mayor para fabricar muebles de casa. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Edith solicita un préstamo para comprar madera por mayor para fabricar muebles de interiores.
texts.en:
Edith continues with her business making and selling furniture. The loan that she got was invested into buying wood. Her payments were on time because she didn't have any problems. Now her business prospers, the furniture rotates daily and she constantly needs to buy wood. "I buy all types of wood according to what there is available..." she says.

The advantage of her business is that the furniture is well received and sells. The disadvantage is lack of money to buy wholesale wood. Her dream is to open a furniture store. She wants to buy wholesale wood to make household furniture. This is the 2nd loan sequence with the institution in the 6 years that she has been developing this job. For those reasons, Edith is asking for a loan to buy wholesale wood to make indoor furniture.

loans.use: to buy wood wholesale to make indoor furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement and sand and pay for labor.

loans.name: Venancia

texts.en:
Venancia is 51 years old. She is a happy woman who sells "salbaro", a type of snack that looks like a thin biscuit. She also sells bread and rice cakes. She has been in this business for 20 years.

Venancia is asking for a loan to buy coconuts, flour, and sugar. She hopes to increase her production and she only finds hope by asking for this loan. Her income will allow her to buy food and pay for bills, like electricity at home. She is from Badian, Cebu.

loans.use: to buy coconuts, flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Sumiko Del Pilar

texts.es:
Sumiko con 25 años de edad de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa familiar, junto a su cónyuge e hijo, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú. Sumiko cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Sumiko se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales como cerdos, gallinas, patos y cuyes, con una experiencia en el rubro de 03 años aproximadamente.Solicita préstamo para invertir en la compra de animales para venta y de alimentos balanceados, y gastos diversos.

Sumiko es socia nueva para Edpyme Alternativa. Es su primer crédito.
texts.en:
Sumiko is 25 years old and in a common-law relationship. She lives in a family home with her spouse and child, in the Cayaltí District, Chiclayo Province, department of Lambayeque, Peru. Sumiko has very good personal and work references. The inhabitants of this town work mostly in agriculture, business and the cattle industry.

Sumiko works breeding and selling animals like pigs, chickens, ducks and guinea pigs, with approximately 3 years experience in the area. She requests a loan to invest in buying animals to sell, formulated feed and various expenses.

Sumiko is a new member for Edpyme Alternativa. It is her first loan.

loans.use: to invest in buying animals to sell and formulated feed.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda is 49 years old, married, and she has four children, three of whom are in school.

Minda is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Minda has been farming sugarcane for five years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Minda would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 36 years old and married.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Rosalia has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic works hard to support her family. She is married and has a butcher shop business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional meat to sell.

Marivic has been in this business for ten years now. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional meat to sell

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad, de 55 años de edad, es un señor muy emprendedor y trabajador pues por circunstancias de la vida no tuvo la oportunidad de ir a la escuela a estudiar, las condiciones económicas de su familia no estudio, pero gracias a programas de alfabetización de personas mayores él aprendió a escribir y a estudiar y como era el hermano mayor de sus hermanos y él tenía que trabajar desde pequeño junto a su padre para darle el sustento diario a su familia.- Está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos y tienen dos hijos de 7, 1, 22 y 20 años de edad, pero los mayores no viven con él.

Natividad, se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de hortalizas como pepino, ejotes, tomate y chile, pero también siembra maíz y frijol pues son actividades que realiza a diario desde que era pequeño y fue gracias a su padre que le enseño a cultivar la tierra, pero además de esta actividad también trabaja en proyectos de construcción de ayudante de albañil, estas son actividades que le generan buenos ingresos económicos para él y su familia.- Su día empieza a las 5:00 de la mañana para desplazarse a sus cultivos y empezar los trabajos de siembra y recolección de frutos y su esposa le apoya a vender y comercializar los productos y en algunas ocasiones le ayudan sus hijos mayores.

Natividad, necesita el préstamo para comprar semilla, abono, fertilizantes para el cultivo y para construir un soporte para el cultivo, de esta manera podrá comprar lo necesario para hacer sus cultivos y poder vender más y obtener mayores ganancia para él. 

Natividad, sueña con incrementar su producción de granos básicos y ser un exportador de sus productos hacia otros lugares y obtener mayores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Natividad is 55-years old and a very entrepreneurial and hard-working man. Because of life circumstances and the economic conditions of his family, he did not have the opportunity to go to school and study. But, thanks to literacy programs for adults, he learned to write and to study. Since he was the oldest brother of his siblings, he had to work from a young age with his father to give his family their daily sustenance. He is married and his wife works in domestic chores. They have four children, ages 1, 7, 20, and 22-years old, but the older ones do not live with him.

Natividad works in agriculture, specifically planting vegetables such as cucumber, green beans, tomato and chilies, but he also grows corn and beans because they are jobs that he has done every day since he was little thanks to his Dad who taught him to cultivate the land. Along with this, he also works with construction projects as a building assistant. These are jobs that get him a good income for him and his family. His day starts at 5:00 AM to move his crops and begin the job of planting and collecting the fruits. His wife helps him to sell and commercialize the products and on some occasions his older children help him.

Natividad needs the loan to buy seeds, compost, and fertilizers for the crops, and to build a support for the crops. This way he will he able to buy what he needs to make his crops and be able to sell more and get more earnings. Natividad dreams of increasing his basic grains production and being an exporter for his products to other places, and getting more income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, and fertilizers for the crops, and to build a support for the crops.

loans.name: Jose Vidal

texts.es:
Vidal, de 38 de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, no continuo con sus estudios por decisión propia, debido a que quería trabajar para ganar su propio dinero y comprarse lo necesario para él; ahora está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos y tienen cuatro hijos de 17, 16, 14 y 3 años de edad, todos viven en su casa y dependen de él.

Vidal, se dedica a la agricultura desde pequeño, él le ayudaba a su padre a trabajar y así aprendió esta actividad la cual ha sido de mucha ayuda para poder mantener a su familia y poder darle lo necesario.- Pero aparte de esta actividad también se dedica a trabajar de albañil, pues es otra actividad que le genera ingresos económicos.

Vidal, necesita el préstamo para comprar semilla, abono, fertilizantes, insecticidas y para pagar la mano de obra para preparar el terreno, porque solo no da abasto.

Vidal, sueña con comprar más terreno para poder hacer más trabajos y poder obtener más cosechas y también desea poder ayudarle a sus hijos con los estudios para que puedan estudiar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Vidal, at 38 years of age, went to school until ninth grade. He didn't continue his studies by his own decision, since he had to work to earn money and buy what he needed for himself. Now he lives with a common-law partner and his partner does the housework. They have four children of 17, 16, 14 and 3 years old, who all live in his house and depend on him.

Vidal, who has worked in agriculture since he was young, helped his father work and in this way he learned this activity which has been very helpful for him to maintain his family and be able to give them everything they need. However, besides this activity he works as a construction worker, which is a job that generates economic income.

Vidal needs this loan to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, insecticides and to pay his day workers to prepare the field because alone he can't keep up.

Vidal dreams of buying more land to be able to work more and obtain more crops. He also wants to be able to help his children with their studies so they can study to get a university degree.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer, insecticides and to pay his day workers to prepare the field.

loans.name: Maria De La Paz

texts.es:
María, de 47 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está casada y es madre de 9 hijos de los cuales 7 ya tienen su propio hogar y dos están estudiando.

María, se dedica a los oficios del hogar, pero también junto a su esposo salen a trabajar al campo para sembrar maíz, frijol, maicillo y algunas hortalizas, pero aparte de eso también elabora tortillas para vender a los habitantes de su caserío, también vende maíz y frijol por libras y esto le genera una fuente de ingresos.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar semilla, abono y fertilizantes, para el mantenimiento de su milpa y para pagar mano de obra, que le ayuden a su esposo a los trabajos de limpia, siembra y fertilización.

María, sueña con poder remodelar su casa, porque se encuentra en mal estado, los baños y también poder invertir más en lo que es la siembra.
texts.en:
María, 47, studied up to fourth grade. She is married and is the mother of nine children, of whom seven already have their own homes and two are still in school.

Maria is a homemaker, but she also works with her husband in the fields growing corn, beans, millet, and some vegetables. In addition to this, she generates an extra income by making and selling tortillas to the people in her neighbourhood, and by selling corn and beans by the pound.

María is requesting a loan to buy organic and inorganic fertilizers, and seeds; to maintain their fields; and to pay for labour to help her husband prepare the fields, plant crops, and spread fertilizers.

María dreams of being able to make some renovations to her house because the bathrooms are in bad shape; she also would like to invest more in their crops.

loans.use: to buy organic and inorganic fertilizers, and seeds.

loans.name: Lorenza De Jesus

texts.es: Lorenza de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, ella se dedica a vender huevos en las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace mas de 15 años, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, tiene mucha clientela pues su producto es muy vendible y lo da a buen precio, ella esta solicitando un credito para comprar huevos al por mayor y así obtener mejores ganancias y poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Lorenza is 45 years old, and lives with her spouse and four children in a home they own. For more than 15 years she has worked selling eggs in different neighborhoods close to her place of residence. With the earnings she obtains from her sales, she is able to meet her household expenses.

She has many customers as her product is very sellable, and she has good prices. She is seeking a loan to buy eggs wholesale and thus obtain better earnings, to be able to give her family increased financial stability.

loans.use: to buy eggs wholesale.

loans.name: Joselito

texts.es:
Joselito con 37 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge e hijo, en el distrito de Pomahuaca, provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Joselito cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Joselito se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café,de variedad Catimor de 06 y 07 años de edad, cuenta con fincas fruteras de café en buen estado. Adicionalmente se dedica al cultivo de pan llevar, cuenta con más de 08 años de experiencia en el rubro, así mismo se desempeña como peón agrícola. Se solicita préstamo para invertir en el negocio de abono y mantenimiento de su cultivo de café. De esta manera podrá adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.

Joselito es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa, este es su quinto crédito.
texts.en:
Joselito is 37 years old and in a common law marriage. He lives with his partner and son in the Pomahuaca district, in the Jaén province, in the department of Catamarca, in Perú. Joselito has very good personal and business references from the inhabitants of the area. The people of that area work primarily in agriculture, business and livestock.

Joselito works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee of the Catimor variety, between 6 and 7 years old. He has fields planted with coffee in good condition. Additionally he grows food crops. He has more than 8 years experience in this field. He also works as a farm hand. He seeks a loan to invest in his business with fertilizer and maintain his coffee crop. In this manner he will be able to earn an acceptable income to improve his quality of life.

Joselito is a recurring borrower with Edpyme Alternative. This is his fifth loan.

loans.use: to invest in his business with fertilizer and maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Ángel con 63 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente vive junto a su cónyuge e hijos, en casa propia de material rústico, en el distrito de La Peca, provincia de Bagua, departamento de Amazonas, país Perú. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican a su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Ángel se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 1.5 hectáreas,variedad Catimor,resistente a enfermedades, plantación esta en su cuarto año de producción tiene 5 años de edad, con una experiencia en el rubro hace 10 años. Adicionalmente se dedica al cultivo y venta de cacao.Solicita préstamo para mantenimiento y cultivo de 1 hectárea de café, asegurando una buena producción para campaña 2016, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

ángel es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa. Firma con su cónyuge .
texts.en:
Ángel is 63-years old and in a common-law marriage. He lives with his partner and children in his own house made of rustic material, in the district of La Peca, Bagua province, and department of Amazonas, in Peru. The inhabitants of this place work mainly in agriculture, business and livestock.

Ángel works in agriculture, growing coffee, and to-date he has 1.5 hectares of the Catimor variety, resistant to diseases. This plantation is in its 4th year of production and is 5 years old. Ángel has 10 years of experience in this field. Additionally, he works growing and selling cocoa.

He is asking for a loan for the maintenance and cultivation of 1 hectare of coffee, ensuring a good production for the 2016 season reflected in a larger sales volume, and thus he will have a larger income to be able to improve his and his family's quality of life. Ángel is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa. He is applying for this loan with his partner.
.

loans.use: for maintenance and cultivation of 1 hectare of coffee.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with seven children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She supplements this income with earnings from buying and selling fish.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rosenda dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Hanilet

texts.en:
Hanilet is 21 years old with one child. She works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a business buying and selling pearls in the Philippines. She has been buying and selling pearls for nine years and also earns an income from food vending.

Hanilet requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of pearls to sell.

Hanilet has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of pearls to sell.

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Annalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store and from buying and selling dried fish.

Annalyn is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of vegetables for her buy and sell vegetables business.

Annalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of vegetables.

loans.name: Mirian Rosivel

texts.es:
Mirian, de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está casada, es madre de 2 hijos, su pareja se dedica a la albañilería y en casa viven solo ellos cuatro.

Mirian, se dedica al comercio de ropa desde hace cuatro años, este oficio lo aprendió de su hermana mayor, porque ella se dedicaba a lo mismo y ella le ayudaba a salir a vender; fue así como ella se interesó en dicho negocio también; antes ella se dedicaba a los oficios del hogar y la distancia que recorre para ir a vender es de 1 kilómetro y ella anda casa por casa vendiendo la mercadería, mientras tanto su esposo queda en casa cuidando los hijos, porque su jornada de trabajo la hace por la mañana y ella siempre sale a vender de la una de la tarde en adelante.

Mirian, necesita el préstamo para comprar más ropa como pantalones, camisas, centros, ropa interior femenina y masculina, además ropa para niños y niñas y también calzado de todo eso compró docena y media.

El sueño de Mirian, es poder ampliar más el negocio y hacerlo fijo en su casa y traer un poco más de variedad de mercadería y también desea mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mirian is 28 years old. She studied up until receiving her high school diploma. She is married and is the mother of 2 children. Her partner makes a living in construction and only the four of them live in the house.

Mirian has made a living in the clothing business for four years. She learned this trade from her older sister because she worked doing the same thing and she helped her go out and sell.
