It was because of this that Mirian also became interested in said business. Before, she made a living doing housework. The distance she travels to go and sell is 1 kilometer. She goes from house to house selling the merchandise. Meanwhile, her husband stays at home taking care of the children because his work day is in the morning and she always leaves to sell from one o'clock in the afternoon on.

Mirian needs the loan to buy more clothes like pants, shirts, tank tops, women's and men's underwear as well as clothing for boys and girls, and also footwear. She bought a dozen and a half of all this.

Mirian's dream is to be able to expand her business more, make it permanent in her home and bring in a little more variety of merchandise. She also wishes to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, tank tops, women's and men's underwear, clothing for boys and girls, and footwear.

loans.name: Alejandrina Monica

texts.es: Alejandrina es una mujer de 59 años que vive en la localidad rural de Coporaque, que está ubicada en Arequipa. Ella se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno y ovino orgánico, poniendo siempre mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por la alfalfa orgánica que cultiva. Solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar cinco vacas orgánicas, espera que su leche sea vendida a un mejor precio al ser orgánica. En el futuro espera poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y seguir contando con buena salud, razón por la cual apuesta por lo orgánico.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a 59 year old woman who lives in the rural village of Coporaque, located in Arequipa. She works breeding organic cattle and sheep. She pays close attention to the care she gives them and their food, which consists of organic alfalfa that she grows.

She seeks a micro loan to be able to buy five organic cows. She hopes that the milk will sell at a better price since it is organic. In the future she hopes to be able to improve her living conditions and to continue counting on good health. For that reason she is betting on organic.

loans.use: to buy five organic cows.

loans.name: Anthonia's Group

texts.en:
Anthonia, a 34-year-old woman, is still single. She lives with her mother, who has been ill for many years. Anthonia, being the first child, has taken on the responsibility of taking care of the family since the father is no more.

She performed very well with her first loan with the cooperative last year, and she used part of her earnings from the loan to add more birds to her newly established poultry business. She plans to engage in palm oil processing during the peak season; and by October each year after paying off her loan, she will reinvest the profit into her poultry business to raise birds that she can resell during the Christmas season.

With this plan, she hopes to raise more income to support her sick mother and also her siblings. This loan will enable her to purchase palm fruits and process them for storage, anticipating that her savings after her sales next year will give her enough money to add broiler birds.

Anthonia thanks all Kiva lenders that wish to support her dream.

loans.use: to purchase palm fruits and process them for storage.

loans.name: Ana Doris

texts.es:
Ana, de 20 años de edad, es una joven muy trabajadora, estudio hasta bachillerato, no continuo con sus estudios debido a que su familia no tenía las facultades económicas para poder darle el apoyo para que estudiara en la  universidad; está soltera y vive con sus padres y tres hermanos.

Ana, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, ella ayuda a su madre en los quehaceres del hogar, porque por el momento no tiene ningún trabajo que le devengue un sueldo; anteriormente trabajo dos años con el programa de alfabetización, el cual le daba un salario para poder sostenerse con lo necesario para ella.- Pero además de los quehaceres del hogar, también se dedica a elaborar artesanías como matates, bordados en mantas y elaboración de accesorios de hilo, este negocio le ha dado buenos resultados y buenas ganancias.

Ana, necesita el préstamo para comprar hilo, mantas para los bordados y otros accesorios necesarios para la elaboración de su trabajo y para la reparación de su casa porque le cambiará el techo, debido que el que actualmente tiene no está en buenas condiciones, esto lo podrá lograr gracias al préstamo otorgado por la institución. 

Ana, sueña con poder casarse y tener hijos poder crecerlos junto a su pareja y poder darles lo necesario para vivir diariamente.
texts.en:
Ana is 20-years old. She is a young, hard-worker who studied until high school. She did not continue with her schooling due to her family not having the economic abilities to be able to give her support so that she could go to college. She is single and lives with her parents and three siblings.

Ana works in domestic chores and she helps her mother with the household chores, because for the moment, she doesn't have a job that earns a salary. Previously, she worked for two years with the literacy program, which gave her a salary to support herself with what she needed. Along with the household chores, she also works making crafts such as canvas bags, embroidered blankets and wire accessories. This business has given her good results and good earnings.

Ana needs the loan to buy thread, embroidered blankets and other accessories needed for the development of her work, and to repair her house. She would repair the roof because the one that she has now is not in a good condition. She will be able to do this thanks to the given loan from the institution. Ana dreams of being able to get married and have children to raise with her partner, and to give them everything they need to live.

loans.use: to buy thread, embroidered blankets and other accessories needed for the development of her work.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es:
Erlinda con 49 años de edad, de estado civil casada,vive en casa propia,junto a su esposo e hijos, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Erlinda se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, con una experiencia en el rubro hace 15 años.Adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de alimentos preparados (tamales).Solicita préstamo para invertir en la compra de animales (pavos,patos y cuyes) y otros gastos personales.De esta manera mejorará la crianza de animales, ingresos por ventas y la mejora en su calidad de vida.

Es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Sus créditos anteriores los realizó con pagos puntuales..
texts.en:
Erlinda is 49 years old, married, and lives in her own house with her husband and their children, in the Cayalti district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque department, of Peru. The inhabitants of this locality are, in the majority, dedicated to agriculture, commerce, and cattle-raising.

Erlinda raises and sells corral animals, with 15 years experience. In addition, she sells prepared foods (mainly tamales).

Erlinda is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of farm animals such as turkeys, ducks, and guinea pigs, and to cover relevant personal expenses. In this manner, she will be able to improve her animal raising and her sales income, plus her quality of life.

Erlinda is an ongoing member of Edpyme Alternativa, and her past payments were always made punctually.

loans.use: invest in the purchase of farm animals (turkeys, ducks, and guinea pigs) and other relevant personal expenses.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José con 54 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge y sus menores hijos, en casa propia de material rústico, en el distrito La Peca, provincia de Bagua, departamento de Amazonas, país Perú.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría al cultivo frutales, café y maíz.

José se dedica a la agricultura,específicamente al cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 1.5 hectáreas,variedad Catimor, resistente a enfermedades, plantación esta en su cuarto año de producción tiene 5 años de edad,cuenta con un experiencia en el rubro hace 15 años. Adicionalmente se dedica al cultivo y venta de cacao.Solicita préstamo para mantenimiento y cultivo de 1.5 hectáreas de café, asegurando una buena producción para campaña 2016, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

José es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa. José firma con su cónyuge.
texts.en:
José, at 54 years old and living in a common-law relationship, lives with his partner and his younger children in his own house made of rustic material in the district of La Peca, province of Bagua, department of Amazonas, country of Peru. The majority of the inhabitants of this town make their living growing fruit, coffee and corn.

José makes his living in agriculture, specifically in coffee growing counting up until today 1.5 hectares, of the Catimor variety, resistant to illnesses. His plantation is in its fourth year of production and is five years old. He has 15 years of experience in the listing.

Additionally he works growing and selling cocoa beans. He is asking for this loan to maintain his 1.5 acre crop of coffee beans, assuring a good harvest for the 2016 season, reflecting in a higher volume of sales therefore he will obtain more profits so he can better the quality of life of his family.

José is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa. He is signing with his spouse.

loans.use: to maintain and grow 1.5 hectares of coffee beans.

loans.name: Awen Indah Group

texts.en:
The Awen Indah Group has a 10.500.000 IDR loan from MUK and can pay off the loan on time. The seven-member group decided to take out a new loan to improve their businesses.

Ni Made, the head of the group, sold her three pigs for 3.500.000 IDR and she still has one left to sell later. After deducting all of her costs, she earned a profit of 1.000.000 IDR. She feels happy all of her hard work after five months of raising the pigs got results.

From the profit she earns, she provides for her family's daily needs and saves for her family's future needs.

With no change in number of members and loan size, the Awen Indah Group members, from their new loan, will each receive 1.500.000 IDR. This loan is focused on purchasing superior piglets, feed and farming.tools.

With her loan, Ni Made will purchase two piglets for fattening and feed. She will also buy farming tools from her loan.

She hopes to fatten her pigs over the next five month and sell them at a high price. Her husband helps her business by finding traditional feed, such as banana leaves, from his garden. With this business, Ni Made hopes she can save money and renovate her kitchen.

loans.use: to purchase two piglets, feed and farming tools.

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en:
Oliva is thanking CCT and Kiva for their noble advocacy of supporting the livelihood of poor people like her. The loans help maintain her tricycle and thus provides her family with steady income. She was also able to buy various kinds of candies to sell for additional income.

She hopes she could again borrow funds in the amount of PHP 25,000 to pay for the maintenance of her tricycle and partly to purchase more candies to sell. She is encouraged to be more conscientious in her business because of the kind-hearted lenders.

Oliva prays for God to bless her public transport service and candy selling so she could continue to send her children to school. She faithfully meets up with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay Micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for tricycle parts and maintenance and to purchase candies to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites, 44 years old, owns a general store, selling various commodities such as sugar, coffee, soap, edible oil, assorted canned goods, soft drinks, frozen foods like ham, hot dogs and dressed chicken.

She is married and has two young children. Her husband earns income to support the daily needs of the family.

For almost three years now, Marites has owned her business, catering mostly to neighbors and local settlers in the community where she lives.

She would like to maintain the inventory of her store and boost her income. She decided to join CEVI, a field partner of Kiva to meet her financial need's.

Marites has requested a loan to buy assorted merchandise like beverages, condiments, and frozen foods. She could attract potential new customers and slowly improve her earnings. She could also provide for the needs of her family and start to settle her obligation.

Marites is determined that with proper handling of her business, she will become productive in the future.

loans.use: to buy assorted merchandise like beverages, condiments and frozen foods.

loans.name: Jaya Usaha Baluk Group

texts.en:
Jaya Usaha Baluk Group members requested a loan to develop their farm businesses. After several loan cycles, the group successfully maintains their rice fields and gardens, earning their families' income. Three members decided to resign from the group. Their rice fields and garden harvests were successful and they earned a satisfactory profit. They have earned enough to fulfill their families' needs and have enough capital to continue their businesses. They are thankful to lenders, Kiva and MUK.

Now with the rainy season approaching, the rest of Jaya Usaha Baluk Group members will continue with another loan for farming. All of the members are farmers and breeders. They will use the loan to purchase seed, farming tools and fertilizer. Some members raise pigs at their homes.

Ni Nengah will use her portion to buy farming tools and fertilizer for her cacao, coconuts and other crops in her garden. She hopes that six months from now she can see an improved harvest from her garden. Ni Nengah and other members of Jaya Usaha Baluk Group expect a continuing relationship with MUK until they have enough savings to continue their businesses with their own money.

loans.use: to buy farming tools and fertilizer.

loans.name: Koubanao Yentine Group

texts.fr: Le Banc Villageois qui abrite ce groupe a été inauguré en février 2001. C'est un groupe composé de femmes qui exercent le commerce, prennent des prêts qu'elles remboursent à temps et sont solidairement liées. Madame Mame Khady qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de trente neuf ans et mère de six enfants dont trois filles. Elle s'active depuis très longtemps dans la vente de l'huile de palme, de la patte d'arachide et des balais. Elle va acheter avec le prêt sollicité quatre bidons de vingt litres d'huile de palme et deux seaux de patte d'arachide. Malgré la concurrence elle arrive à écouler sa marchandise. Les bénéfices vont servir à participer à la prise en charge des enfants.
texts.en:
The 'banc villageois' that houses this group was inaugurated in February 2001. The group is composed of women working in commerce and taking out loans, which they repay on time. The group members are bound by solidarity.

Ms. Mame Khady, who is at the right in the photo with her hand raised, is the group's representative. She is married, 39 years old, and the mother of six children, of whom three are girls. She has been active for a very long time selling palm oil, peanut butter, and brooms.

With this loan, she is going to purchase four 20-liter containers of palm oil and two pails of peanut butter. Despite the market competition, she manages to sell her merchandise. The profits will be used to help cover expenses for the children.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil, peanut butter, and brooms

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia, is a 59-year-old married mother of six grown children and lives in the town of Mcarthur, Leyte. She raises hogs to earn a living. Her husband is a farmer.

For the past 20 years, she has sold hogs to the local residents in her community. Aside from hog raising, she also owns rice paddies, growing and selling rice.

She is seeking ways to improve her livelihood. She would like to have a bountiful harvest but she lacks capital.

Julia has requested a loan to buy farm supplies like fertilizer and insecticide. These are vital in her farming business. It would enable her to have a high-quality yield and boost her earnings. Thus, she could set aside some profit for future use while improving her business

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
For almost 15 years, Vilma has owned a shop, selling whitening soap, household wares and jewelry.

She is a married woman and has six children, residing in the rural town of Macarthur, Leyte. Three of her children are still attending school.

She caters mostly to neighbors and local dwellers in her place.

She join CEVI to boost her business. She has insufficient funds to maintain the shop's merchandise.

Vilma has requested a loan to buy stock such as plastic wares, rtw (ready-to-wear) and jewelry. In this way, she would able to filled her store with a variety of stock and attract more customers. Thus, her income will improve and continue to support the needs of her family.

Vilma is looking forward to become productive and sustainable as well in the future.

loans.use: to buy stock such as plastic wares, rtw (ready-to-wear) and jewelry.

loans.name: Sokhna's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 2 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée le 7 février 2001. Il est constitué de femmes du même village et des environs qui ont de bonnes relations et une parfaite entente. Elles s'activent principalement dans le commerce. 
MAGUETTE debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est l'emprunteuse vedette. Elle mariée, âgée de 46 ans et mère d'une fille et 4 garçons. Elle s'active dans le commerce. Elle achète ses marchandises dans les marchés hebdomadaires de la ville  et les revend dans son village 
Avec le prêt reçu elle compte  acheter 3 bidons d'huile de 30 litres chacun  à 16 000 FCFA l'unité et revend le litre à 850 FCFA. Elle achète aussi 200 savons à 200 FCFA l'unité et le cède à 275 FCFA. Elle achète un sac d'omo à 8000 FCFA et le revend à 9500 FCFA. Elle achète des légumes, carotte, tomates, choux, manioc,  pour une valeur de 50 000 FCFA et obtient un bénéfice de 100 000 FCFA après vente des légumes. Le reste du prêt est confiée à ses fils qui mènent eux aussi des activités génératrices de revenus pour aider leurs parents. 
Avec les bénéfices, elle satisfait les besoins de sa familles notamment ceux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group of two members is part of the 'banc villageois' that was created on February 7, 2001. It is composed of women from the same village and nearby. The women have good relationships and get along extremely well. They are mainly active in commerce.

MAGUETTE, standing at the right in the photo with a hand raised, is the featured borrower. She is married, 46 years old, and the mother of a girl and four boys. She is active in commerce. She purchases merchandise at the weekly markets in town and resell in her village.

With this loan, she intends to purchase three 30-liter containers of oil at 16,000 francs CFA per unit and resell at 850 francs per liter. She is also purchasing 200 units of soap at 200 francs each to sell at 275 francs each. She is purchasing a bag of Omo [a brand of detergent] at 8,000 francs to resell at 9,500 francs. She is purchasing vegetables, carrots, tomatoes, cabbage, and cassava worth 50,000 francs to obtain a profit of 100,000 francs upon selling them.

The rest of the loan is entrusted to her sons, who also operate revenue-generating businesses to help out their parents. With the profits, she has met the needs of her family, especially those of her children.

loans.use: to purchase oil, soap, and vegetables

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 30-year-old married man from Jabalia city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with his wife and two children in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 31-year-old married man from Jabalia city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with his wife and two children in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Mahmoud took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.
.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Diego Wilmer

texts.es: Diego tiene 36 años de edad de estado civil soltero tiene una hija de 8 años bajo su responsabilidad Melany estudia en una escuela del sector, el empezó hace 18 años atrás su trabajo como ayudante de transporte, siendo responsable, optimista y ahorrador pudo comprar un pequeño  bus que traslada  personas a comunidades donde es tan difícil conseguir este servicio por el mal estado de las carreteras. Diego necesita este dinero para realizar mantenimiento  oportuno a su unidad y evitar que a futuro tenga que cambiar partes dañadas del mismo, generando así dinero que pueda ser invertido en la alimentación y educación de su pequeña hija
texts.en:
Diego is 36 years old and is a single father. His daughter Melany is eight years old and attends a local school. Eighteen years ago, he started working as a transportation assistant. Always responsible and optimistic, he managed to save up enough money to buy a small bus, which he uses to drive passengers to communities where it is hard to find this type of service due to bad road conditions.

Diego needs this money to do regular maintenance on his unit in order to avoid having to replace damaged parts in the future. This will allow him to continue to make money and provide for his little girl.

loans.use: to maintain his bus.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Crabbing has been a viable food and livelihood source for Luzminda’s family. She has engaged herself in this very unique type of business of trapping crabs, which is commonly called by their communities as “pangal”, for about three years now. Her husband Ramie is helping her run the business and has also maintain a good profit by selling fresh varieties of fish everyday. They have considered their business as their primary source of living, since it has been helping them provide for the needs of the family, especially for their only source of happiness--their child.

However, there are instances where the family struggles financially. They need to cope with day-to- day expenses and also make sure that there is enough capital available for the business operation. As a result, they have to sacrifice their business needs and first pay the necessary bills as much as possible.

In order to prevent things like this happening again, they want to have a secured fund which will support their necessities in improving the “pangal”.

They want to request a loan of Php 8,000 to buy materials and tools used to trap a significant number of crabs they could grow and sell in the market afterwards.

Luzminda is telling her story not for the readers to pity their situation, but to serve as an inspiration to other entrepreneurs and individuals who also aspire to make good use of the available resources to improve their lives. Any amount coming from the you would help create a brand new start and another exciting journey for the lives of Luzminda and her family.

Luzminda’s vision is aligned to what CCT and Kiva dream of for the people they serve. She wants to help alleviate poverty among the people in their community by starting to dream, and doing something for her family and her business. As she experience the fullness of God’s grace through the lives of others, she also aspires to help other people in the best way she can, like giving them the same kind of hope and support she receive.

Luzminda is an active member of CCT. She gets inspiration and wisdom of God’s undeserved grace and love through the Bible studies and fellowship meetings which the organization conducts every week. CCT’s approach is holistic and transformative, giving emphasis to the importance of the integral work of God in the communities they serve.

loans.use: To pay for tools and materials used for "pangal" or trapping crabs.

loans.name: Ndiague's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée le 19 novembre 2004. Il regroupe des femmes du même village et des environs qui ont de bonnes relations et une bonne entente. Une bonne ambiance anime les réunions de groupe. Elles s'activent principalement dans le commerce et l'embouche. 
Daba debout à droite de la photo est l'emprunteuse vedette. Elle est mariée, âgée de 40 ans et mère de 2 enfants. Elle s'active dans l'embouche.
Avec le prêt reçu, elle achète 2 bœufs l'unité à 125 000 FCFA et 2 brebis à 50 000 FCFA l'un. Elle les engraisse et les revends au bout de 2 à 3 mois. Elle fait ça deux fois pendant les six mois.  Elle fait un apport personnel pour acheter de l'aliment de bétail et répondre aux autres charges.
Avec les bénéfices, elle compte renforcer son activité et aussi celui de son fils qui fait de l'embouche comme elle.
texts.en:
This group is part of the 'banc villageois' that was created on November 19, 2004. It is composed of women from the same village and nearby. The women have good relationships and get along well. A nice ambiance enlivens the group meetings. They has been active mainly in commerce and livestock farming.

Daba, standing at the right in the photo, is the featured borrower. She is married, 40 years old, and the mother of two. She is active in the fattening of livestock.

With this loan, she is purchasing two steers at 125,000 francs CFA per head; and two sheep at 50,000 each. She fattens them and resells them after two or three months. She does this twice every six months. She is putting in her own funds to purchase animal feed and to cover other expenses.

With the profits, she intends to bolster her business and also that of her son, who farms livestock like she does.

loans.use: to purchase two steers and two sheep

loans.name: Mousa

texts.en:
Mousa is a 39-year-old single man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with his family in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Mousa took out a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. Palestinians have water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower. Those boilers can be dangerous, expensive, and inefficient. This will help Mousa to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en: Glenda lives in the municipality of Garcia Hernandez in the province of Bohol. She is 32 years old, married and has two children aged four years old. She has been engaged in a sari-sari (convenience) store business for 10 years now. She sells rice, noodles, coffee, canned food, eggs, spices and soft drinks. She is asking for a loan to buy soft drinks, liquors, canned food, chips, candies, beverages and seasoning. It is her dream to be able to send her children to school and see them have degrees in the future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, liquors, canned food, chips, candies, beverages and seasoning

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: In the Philippines, people like fried food. A lot of food is cooked fried, not only because adults like it but because this is also a children's favorite. Just like Erlinda from Garcia Hernandez, who found a thriving business selling fried chicken. These chicken parts are coated with breading mix, flour and seasoning, and deep-fried. People like to buy this kind of food to eat with rice during lunch or dinner. Some people even enjoy having this as a snack. Aside from chicken she also cooks other dishes to sell. She is asking for a loan to buy chicken, oil and pork to prepare for other dishes. She hopes to live a progressive life and send her four children, ages 3-10, to school.

loans.use: to buy chicken, oil, pork

loans.name: Damayanti

texts.en:
Damayanti is a 48-year-old married woman hailing from Attabira village, which comes under Sambalpur district of Odisha, India. She seeks a loan of 15,000 INR to construct a toilet in her home. Damayanti lives in a home with no access to a toilet, thereby forcing the family members to go outdoors to relieve themselves. They have to travel long distances at odd hours of the night.

Building a private toilet in the house will help prevent diseases that are caused from open defecation and promote a healthier lifestyle. Plus, having a toilet will save them 300 INR every month, which they are spending on diseases caused by open defecation. This loan will give them access to a better, safer, healthier quality of life.

loans.use: to construct a toilet in her home.

loans.name: Debaki

texts.en:
Debaki is a mother of four children. She, her husband, and her children reside in Sambalpur district of Odisha, India. Debaki and her husband have a monthly income of 5,700 INR. Every month she is forced to fork out around 300 INR towards her family’s medical expenses as a result of the sanitation crisis they face.

Like many Indians, Debaki and her family still do not have access to modern sanitation, and are forced to defecate in the open. Open defecation is disastrous, as it is impossible to keep human feces away from crops, wells, food, and children. According to studies, hundreds of children die every year due to preventable sanitary-related diseases. Lack of sanitation facilities also means trekking at least a kilometer to relieve themselves. And, women like Debaki bear the brunt, as they are mostly attacked and assaulted when they step out early in the morning or late in the evening.

In order to improve their sanitation facilities, Debaki has approached Kiva's partner People's Forum, seeking a loan of 15,000 INR. She intends to use the loan towards construction of a toilet at home. Your loan will help Debaki and her family to improve the quality of their lives.

loans.use: to construct a toilet at home.

loans.name: Basanti

texts.en:
Basanti is a 45-year-old humble and simple lady. She hails from a small village of Sambalpur district, Odisha, India. Basanti is a married lady and is a blessed mother of two sons, who are independent and earning their livelihoods in a separate city.

Her household income is very low, and the income of her husband is used to meet the daily household expenses. For this reason, she was never able to afford to build a toilet at her home. The absence of a toilet at her home compels her to walk a long distance to relieve herself. She no longer finds it feasible enough, as she can sense the danger of crime and molestation.

Therefore, she is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum. She will use the loan amount to build a clean and hygienic toilet and install a commode in it.

Your loan will help her family to enjoy good health and promote cleanliness in the community. Basanti is awaiting your kind hearts to help her and her family.

loans.use: to build a clean and hygienic toilet and install a commode in it.

loans.name: Penda's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois  dont fait fait partie ce groupe de femmes a été créé en Juillet 2012. Elles jouissent d’une bonne entente et d’un bon esprit de groupe. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Penda (debout à l’extrême droite avec la main levée),  est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants. Elle s’active dans vente de patte d’arachide et d’huile de palme.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter 07 sceaux de 15 kg de patte d’arachide à 12500f le sceau et 03 bouteille de 20 litre d’huile de palme à 17500f la bouteille  et payer un transport de 10000f pour le revende en détails.

Avec les bénéfices ; elle compte prendre soins de ses enfants (soins médicaux habillement nourriture) et aider son mari dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
The Banc Villageois that this group of women belong to was created in July 2012. They get along well and have a good group spirit. Their primary activity is small-scale commerce.

Madame Penda (standing on the far right with her hand raised) is the featured group member. She is married and the mother of eight children. She sells peanut butter and palm oil. Her new loan will permit her to buy seven buckets of 15 kg each of peanut butter and three bottles of 20 liters of palm oil at 17,500f per bottle and pay 10,000f for transport. She will resell these goods retail. With the profit, she intends to care for her children (healthcare, clothing, food) and help her husband cover the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seven buckets of 15 kg each of peanut butter at 12,500f the bucket and three bottles of 20 liters of palm oil at 17,500f per bottle.

loans.name: Ramzi

texts.en:
Ramzi is a 51-year-old married man from Rfah City, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with his family in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Ramzi took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. This will help Ramzi to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: buy a solar system for heating water for his family's house.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a 27-year-old single man from Jabalia City, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with his family in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Said took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar energy system for heating water for the family house.

Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive, and inefficient. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius earns a living through his small businesses. At 40, he works hard for his two children who are still dependents. He is engaged in raising hogs, driving his motorcycle for a habal-habal (motorcycle transport) service, rice farming and operating a sari-sari store. It entails a lot of work to keep up with all his small businesses but he perseveres. He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, seedlings, canned sardines,  beef loaf, shampoo, bath soap, milk, coffee, sugar, matches, biscuits and liquor.  With this, he will be able to keep and manage his business well, thus giving his children a chance for a better future. He will continue to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings, canned sardines,  beef loaf, shampoo, bath soap, milk, coffee, sugar,  matches, biscuits and liquor.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is truly happy for a number of loans funded by Kiva and its supporters, which really helped sustain his beauty salon. Being a beauty lover, he enjoys enhancing a person's looks and making them beautiful. He thanks God for Kiva and CCT's noble advocacy of supporting small business men like him.

He trusts you could again consider his request for a PHP 30,000 loan to buy the regular needs of his salon, such hair color, hair rebond, conditioner, shampoo, etc. His taste for beauty and friendly personality draws people to come in and patronize his salon. His income from his salon helps him cover his daily needs and assist his parents.

Mario aims to improve his salon to attract more customers and hopes that he'll continue to be independent. Every week, he meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups, each composed of 15 to 30 community partner, that gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for beauty supplies and hair products for his salon.

loans.name: Julinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Julinda works hard to support her family. She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

Julinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

loans.name: Lucas

texts.es:
Lucas es un hombre de 33 años de edad, es casado con una familia de dos hijos de las edades entre 7 meses y 7 años, está humilde familia vive en una comunidad de San Andrés Semetabaj.
Lucas es un padre de familia que todos los días se esmera para darle a su familia  lo necesario, él trabaja desde hace 15 años a la albañilería, con mucho sacrificio día a día sale de su casa y trabaja bajo el radiante sol. Lucas con el deseo de darle a sus hijos un hogar digno, a decidido solicitar un préstamo para la remodelación de su casa, con el dinero el comprara; piedrín, cemento, cal y arena.
Sus esperanzas de vida es terminar la construcción de su casa, mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y brindarles educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lucas is 33 years old, married, and has two children, a seven-year-old and a seven-month-old. This humble family lives in a community in San Andrés Semetabaj.

Lucas provides for his family and strives every day in order to give them what they need. He has been working in construction for the past fifteen years. With self-sacrifice and dedication, he works hard every day under the bright sun. Lucas wants to give his children a decent home, which is why he decided to apply for a loan to remodel his house. He will use the money to buy gravel, cement, lime, and sand.

His goals in life are to finish building his house, improve his family's quality of life, and give his children a good education.

loans.use: to buy gravel, cement, lime, and sand to remodel his house.

loans.name: Niveen

texts.en:
Greetings from Palestine. Niveen is a 25-years-old married woman with three kids and lives in Yata in Hebron city. Niveen has a small stockade in front of her house. Her main business is to trade in livestock, such as goats, sheep, ewes, etc. 

Niveen needs the loan to buy sheep and ewes in order to raise them and after that sell them and make some profits. The business faces two main challenges. The first one is the lack of liquidity, which limits her ability to expand her project, and the other challenge is the seasonality of the livestock trade.

For the future, Niveen hopes to expand her project by increasing the number of livestock.

Niveen thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy sheep and ewes in order to raise them and after that sell them and make some profits.

loans.name: Juliano

texts.en:
Juliano is 57 years old from the town of Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. He is married with two adult children. He continues to spend his time wisely by doing carpentry works, farming rice and raising hogs to earn an income.

He is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and feed. Juliano aims to make his business successful, so that he can support his needs at present and when he is old. This way, he will not rely on his children.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and feed.

loans.name: Jeaneta

texts.en:
Jeaneta is 41 years old and a mother of four children, ages 13-19. Her family lives in Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. She has been doing farming since having her family. This has been their source of livelihood. She also raises hogs for supplemental income. Like most mothers, she wants her children to have a life quite different from hers.

She realized that she could do better with her farming if given financial assistance. She has requested for a loan to be used to buy pigrolac feed, piglets and supplements. The extra income that she can get from this will be used for her family’s daily consumption and her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy pigrolac feed, piglets and supplements.

loans.name: Basma

texts.en:
Greetings from Palestine. Basma is a 36-year-old married woman with five kids and lives in Yata in Hebron city. Basma has a small stockade in front of her house. Her main business is to trade in livestock, such as goats, sheep, ewes, etc. 

Basma needs the loan to buy sheep and ewes in order to raise them and after that sell them and make some profits. The business faces two main challenges. The first one is the lack of liquidity which limits her ability to expand her project, and the other challenge is the seasonality of the livestock trade.

For the future, Basma hopes to expand her project by increasing the number of livestock.

Basma thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy sheep and ewes in order to raise them and after that sell them and make some profits

loans.name: He Muong 14 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lien is 52 years old and lives with her husband, her two sons, a daughter-in-law and a grandchild in an old Thai ethnic traditional house at a remote village. 

Like other villagers, Mrs. Lien works very hard at agricultural production for a living with plenty of activities such as growing rice, corn, cassava, breeding buffalo, pig, chicken and duck. 

This is the sixth time she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program, and she will use the loan to buy a sow. She hopes that with this investment, she could provide better for the crowded family. Mrs. Lien dreams her family will have a more abundant life and her grandchild will have a brighter future. 

In the picture, she stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy a sow

loans.name: Maesam

texts.en:
Maesam is a 22-year-old, single lady from Tubas near Nablus city. Her father is an employee where he gets a low and unstable income. This income barely covers all the family’s needs.

Maesam is a student in the university where she studies Breeding. She wants to take the BA degree and find a job in the future to support her family. Maesam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university fees for the final semester. By taking this loan, Maesam will be able to register in the university and pay part of the urgent expenses she has.

Maesam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university fees for the final semester.

loans.name: Vicente Fabian

texts.es:
El señor Vicente es un hombre luchador de 24 años es soltero pero tiene un hijito de 2 años que vive con la mamá, él vive en casa de sus Padres pero es independiente, vive y tiene su negocio en un pequeño Recinto llamado San Bernabé el mismo que está ubicado al noroccidente de la Provincia de Pichincha en el Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos, este Recinto es muy visitado por turistas nacionales y extranjeros que disfrutan de sus maravillosas atractivos turísticos y sitios de descanso.
El señor Vicente se dedica a la producción de cerdos, aprendió de este negocio desde su niñez junto con los papas, ya que fue criado en el campo a este negocio le dedica un promedio de 4 horas al día, no pudo estudiar por la falta de oportunidades, solo tiene la secundaria pero lucha y lucha muy duro para que  su hijo tenga lo necesario.
Solicita este crédito para invertir en el negocio para arreglar las chancheras y construir otra para incrementar la producción ya que tiene cerdas madres que están preñadas y necesita más espacio, con esta nueva inversión mejorará su calidad de vida, Don Vicente agradece a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada
texts.en:
Vicente is a 24 year old fighter. He is single but has a young two year old son that lives with the mother. He lives in his parent's house but he is independent. He lives and has his business in a small village called "San Bernabé" which is located in the North-West of Pichincha Province in San Miguel de los Bancos Cantón. This village is visited by many foreign and national tourists who enjoy it's magnificent tourist attractions and places to relax.

Vicente works raising pigs. He learned this business when he was young together with his parents as he was raised in the country. He spends an average of four hours per day at this business. He could not study due to a lack of opportunity. He only has his secondary education but strives and strives fiercely so his son has what he needs.

He is requesting this loan to invest in his business to fix his pigpens and construct another in order to increase his production. He now has breeding sows that are pregnant and he needs more space. With this new investment he will improve his quality of living. Vicente is grateful to Kiva for the support and the opportunity being offered to him.

loans.use: to fix his pigpens and construct another for his breeding sows and with this new investment improve his quality of living.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 21-year-old, single man Jenin city. He lives with his family in a small, old house. He is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support. Ahmad has greenhouses for the cultivation of vegetables and fruits in the city. It is a good business and provides him a good income, but the economic situation in West Bank is bad, because of the latest conflict.

Ahmad could not save cash from last season, so he took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy some seedlings and pesticides for his greenhouses for this season. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to get married.

loans.use: to buy some seedlings and pesticides for his greenhouses.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 21-year-old, single man Toubas near Nablus city. He lives with his family in a small, old house. He is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support. Mohammad has greenhouses for the cultivation of vegetables and fruits in the city. It is a good business and provides him a good income, but the economic situation in West Bank is bad because of the latest conflict.

Mohammad could not save cash from last season, so he took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy some seedlings and pesticides for his greenhouses for this season. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to get married.

loans.use: to buy some seedlings and pesticides for his greenhouses for this season.

loans.name: Sabreen

texts.en:
Sabreen is a 22-year-old, married woman from Attel near Tulkarm city. She lives with her family in a small, old house. Her husband is the only breadwinner for her family, and they depend on him for support. Sabreen has greenhouses for the cultivation of vegetables and fruits in the village. It is a good business and provides her a good income, but the economic situation in West Bank is bad because of the latest conflict.

Sabreen could not save cash from last season, so she took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help her to buy some seedlings and pesticides for her greenhouses for this season. She hopes that this new inventory will enable her to increase her sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to help her husband in the part of family expenses.

loans.use: to buy some seedlings and pesticides for her greenhouses for this season.

loans.name: Idi

texts.en:
Idi is a maize farmer and a Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Idi has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Idi would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Idi can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Idi will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Idi is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the lives of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Musa Police

texts.en:
Musa is a maize farmer and a Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Musa has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Musa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Musa can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Musa will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Musa is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the lives of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get university education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Hassan Sarki

texts.en:
Hassan is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Hassan has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Hassan would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Hassan can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Hassan will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Hassan is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Jamilu

texts.en:
Jamilu is a Babban Gona farmer. Jamilu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday. Traditionally, Jamilu would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With this loan Jamilu can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Jamilu has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Jamilu is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to purchase better inputs to improve his yield and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Hudu

texts.en:
Hudu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Hudu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Hudu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Hudu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Hudu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Hudu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Sirajo

texts.en:
Sirajo is a Babban Gona farmer. Sirajo is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday. Traditionally, Sirajo would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With this loan Sirajo can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Sirajo has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Sirajo is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to purchase better inputs to improve his yield and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Gloria Delmy

texts.es:
Gloria, de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, debido a la situación económica de su familia no continuo con sus estudios en la universidad, está casada, su esposo se dedica a la carpintería y no tienen hijos, ellos viven con su papá, su mamá.

Gloria, tiene una tienda de productos para la canasta básica en su casa, en donde ofrece a sus clientes, azúcar, frijoles aceite y otros productos necesarios para la cocina, son dos años de tener este negocio del cual ha obtenido ingresos para poder suplir las necesidades de su casa.

Gloria, necesita el préstamo para comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maíz, entre otros productos de primera necesidad para fortalecer su tienda y poder ofrecer más mercadería a sus clientes.

Gloria, sueña con poder tener hijos con su esposo y también desea poder agrandar más su negocio y ser distribuidora de productos a otras tiendas.
texts.en:
Gloria, 26, studied through high school. Due to the economic situation of her family, she didn't continue with her studies in the university. She is married, her husband works as a carpinter and they don't have children. The live with her father and mother. Gloria has a basic goods store in her home, where she offers her customers sugar, beans, oil and other necessary products for the kitchen. She's had this business for two years, from which she's obtained income to be able to supply the necessities of her home.

Gloria needs the loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, corn, among other staple goods to strengthen her store and be able to offer more merchandise to her customers. Gloria dreams of being able to have children with her husband and also wishes to be able to grow her business more and be a distributor of products to other stores.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, corn, among other staple goods to strengthen her store.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Roberto con 36 años de edad,estado civil casado,vive junto a su esposa e hijos, en el distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú,en una zona rural. Roberto cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Roberto se dedica a brindar los servicios agrícolas de jornalería, contando con herramientas propias, como mochila de fumigar, palana, pico y oz; con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio.Solicita préstamo para arreglos de vivienda y para mantenimiento de equipos y herramientas, dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas, con gran influencia en el negocio; cliente piensa mejorar productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los habitantes de la zona.

Roberto es socio recurrente en Edpyme Alternativa. Ha tenido dos créditos de 1000,00 y 1000,00 los cuáles los a cancelado de manera puntual. Desde que se convirtió en socio de Edpyme Alternativa a mejorado su calidad de vida de igual forma. .
texts.en:
Roberto, 36 years old, married, lives with his wife and children in the Oyotún district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque department, Peru, in a rural zone. Roberto has very personal and work references on behalf of the residents of the area. The inhabitants of this area mostly work in agriculture, trade and animal husbandry.

Roberto works providing agricultural services as a day laborer with more than 5 years' experience in the business, having his own tools like a fumigation backpack, hoe, pickaxe and sickle. He is applying for a loan to repair the home and for maintenance for equipment and tools. Said investment will serve him for having his equipment and tools in better condition, with great influence on the business. This client thinks to improve productivity of his services and therefore be able to tend to the various needs of the inhabitants of the area.

Roberto is a recurring member of Edpyme Alternative. He's had two loans of 1000.00 and 1000.00 [PEN], which he's paid off in a punctual manner. Since he became a member of Edpyme Alternative, he's similarly improved the quality of his life.

loans.use: to repair the home and for maintenance for equipment and tools.

loans.name: Juan Nahun

texts.es:
El señor, Juan Ávila  de 29 años de edad es soltero  vive en casa de su familiar, vive en la ciudad de Nacaome Valle, se dedica desde hace 08 años a su negocio que es venta de ropa nueva, El señor Juan es un Hombre muy trabajador con muchos deseos de salir adelante  y agradece por la oportunidad que le brinda junto a sus compañeros de poder obtener su segundo crédito y esperando que podamos apoyarlo
Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de ropa nueva. Con el apoyo del crédito él pretende surtir y mejorar su negocio como una persona responsable esta alegre de trabajar con Prisma.  
Su sueño es que en su próximo crédito  mejorar sus Ingresos.
San Lorenzo  Honduras Septiembre 2015.
texts.en:
Juan Ávila is 29 years old and is single. He lives in the house of a family member in the city of Nacaome, Valle Department. He has worked for eight years in his business which is selling clothing. Juan is a hard-working man with great desire to get ahead. He is grateful for the opportunity that is being offered him together with his colleagues to be able to get his second loan. He is hoping to be supported.

He is requesting the loan to buy new clothing. With the help of the loan he hopes to stock and improve his business. As a responsible person he is happy to work with Prisma..

His dream is to improve his income with his next loan.

San Lorenzo, Honduras. September 2015.

loans.use: to buy clothing for his sales.

loans.name: Carolina Yasmin

texts.es: Carolina vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su esposo, es una mujer muy trabajadora ella se dedica al cultivo de maiz y tambien a la venta de ropa desde hace 5 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas es como ha logrado salir adelante, anteriormente solicito un credito para mejorar su vivienda, en esta ocasion esta solicitando nuevamente un credito para la compra de ropa por mayor ya que es su fuente de ingresos y asi podra darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Carolina lives in her own house with her two children and her husband. She is a very hardworking person. She farms corn and for the past 5 years she has also been selling clothing. With what she earns from her sales, she has been able to get ahead. She previously requested a loan to improve her house. On this occasion, she is requesting a new loan to buy clothing at wholesale price. This is her source of income and this way she could provide her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing at wholesale price.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar works hard to support her family. She is a mother of 6 sons who are studying and has a cattle farm in a village near Hebron, while her husband is a bus driver, but he helps her in the farm too. She has been in this business for 6 years.

She has requested a $1500 loan through Kiva's partner Alibdaa, Palestine to purchase more cattle and feeds for her farm.
She hopes to increase her farm and earn more income to develop her life and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle and feeds for increasing milk sales then earn a better income to help her family and educate her children.

loans.name: Kyla

texts.en:
Kyla is 32 years old and married with one child who is in school. Kyla works very hard to provide for them.

Kyla has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Kyla has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Kyla would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is 53 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ninfa has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, diapers, sugar, spices and other groceries. 

In the future Ninfa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Welchita

texts.en:
Welchita is 51 years old, married and has five children. One of whom in school.

Welchita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Welchita requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Welchita has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Welchita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward used the previous loan to buy a bigger milling machine. He is a mechanic with a workshop and also offers a service of milling in a busy trading center, which he started way back in 2004 with a hope of getting more income for his family. He is acquiring another loan to help him buy a second hand motorcycle that will enable him transport his products to the market with ease after facing high transportation costs of his products to the milling place and his customers. In future, Edward hopes to educate all his children to higher levels of learning and start another workshop outlet.

loans.use: to buy a second hand motorcycle that will enable him transport his products to the market.

loans.name: Muong Phang 36 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuong is 28 years old, has been married and become the mother of a boy at the age of 8 and a girl at the age of 4. She lives with her husband and her children in a Thai ethnic traditional house at a remote village where people mainly work at agricultural production for a living. Like other villagers, Mrs. Thuong and her husband work very hard at cultivation and animal husbandry with several activities such as cultivating rice, breeding ducks, chicken and fish.

This is the third time she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program and she will use the loan to buy baby fish to develop fish farming. She hopes that with her good experience in farming and with the technical support from the Program, her investment will be successful and bring good income for her family, just like her investment from previous loan at Anh Chi Em in fish raising. Mrs. Thuong dreams that her family will have a more sufficient life and her children will have a brighter future. In the picture, she stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy baby fish to develop fish farming

loans.name: Ma. Morena

texts.en:
Ma.Morena is 47 years old, married with five children. Two of her children are in school, she is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ma.Morena has a food vending business in the Philippines. Ma.Morena requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Ma.Morena has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Ma.Morena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Mehujayme

texts.en:
Mehujayme is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like rice milling business.

Mehujayme dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 42 years old, married and has six children. Five of her children are enrolled in school.

Gemma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Gemma requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en: Sylivia deals in matooke business and operates a saloon as well for additional income. She is a very hard working woman, but meets a set back of limited capital to buy enough stock. She would love to buy another stock of matooke because the demand is very high. The challenge is that, she does not have enough capital to buy sufficient stock of matooke. She is requesting for a loan facility to buy more matooke to sell. She will be grateful for your help.

loans.use: to buy more matooke to sell.

loans.name: Izdihar

texts.en: Izdihar is 22 years old. She is married and lives in a village near Nablus city. She has four children. Her husband is a construction employee. Izdihar and her husband need to renovate their house and buy furniture such as a bedroom set and sofa. They have decided to borrow from Kiva’s partner Alibdaa a $1500 loan. In this way, she can make her home secure and improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to renovate her house and buy a bedroom set and sofa to make improvements to her house.

loans.name: Amjad

texts.en:
Greetings from Palestine. Amjad is 33 years old, married with four kids, and lives in Tubas in Jenin City. Amjad has a small stockade in front of his house. His main business is to trade livestock, such as goats, sheep, ewes, etc. Amjad needs the loan to buy sheep and ewes in order to raise them and then sell them to make some profits. The business faces two main challenges. The first one is the lack of liquidity, which limits his ability to expand his project; the other challenge is the seasonality of the livestock trade.

In the future, Amjad hopes to expand his business by increasing the number of livestock. Amjad thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy sheep and ewes in order to raise them and then sell them to make some profits.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en: Uzma started her school 10 years ago because she realized she had time to give back to her community. Half of her 110 students are female and Uzma is trying to expand her school. She has taken a loan for PKR 150,000 and intends to buy chairs, desks and office tables. Uzma wants to grow her school to teach college-level classes to students in the future.

loans.use: to buy chairs, desks and office tables

loans.name: Aala

texts.en:
Aala is a 21-year-old single young lady from Qabatia, Jenin City. Her father works as an employer where he gets a low and unstable income. His income barely covers all the family's needs.

Aala is a student in the local university where she studies law. She wants to earn a BA degree and find a job in the future to support her family.

Aala took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay her university fees for this semester. By taking this loan, Aala will be able to register at the university and pay part of the urgent expenses she has.

Aala appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay her university fees for this semester.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a 30 year old married man with 3 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. He is a retailer and also deals in motorcycle transport as a way of expanding his income to his family. He works in this business 12 hours a day and 6 days a week. He is doing all this with a hope of increasing more income for his family. He is looking forward to building rentals too in future and educate all his children to higher levels of learning. He is facing challenges of health problem himself and this has resulted into low profits since some days he does not open the shop when he is sick. Christopher has asked for a loan to buy stock of sugar, cooking oil, soap,rice,and salt for selling.

loans.use: to buy stock of sugar, cooking oil, soap, rice and salt for selling

loans.name: Muong Phang 37 Group

texts.en:
Khiem, 20, is young ethnic Thai lady who is married and the mother of a 3-year-old son. She lives with her in-laws, her husband and her child in a traditional ethnic Thai house in a remote village. She works very hard at agricultural production to support her family with several activities such as cultivating rice, breeding pigs, chicken, fish and ducks.

The income from farming and breeding is unstable, so she has always wanted to expand production. This is the first time that she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em program and she will use the loan to buy baby fish to develop fish farming. She hopes that with the technical support of the program, including training and counseling in business and production, her investment will go well so that she can provide better for her crowded family.

Khiem dreams that her family will have a more abundant life and her child will grow up healthily, will study well and will have a bright future. In the picture, she is the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy baby fish to develop fish farming.

loans.name: Doha

texts.en:
Doha is a pregnant woman who lives in Ya’bod. She is a tailor and her husband is an employee. They are preparing for their new baby to be born.

Doha needs many supplies for her baby such as clothes, diapers and a cover for the baby bed.

She has asked for a loan from Alibdaa to prepare well for her first child. She is very grateful to Kiva’s partner Alibdaa for the support and trust provided to her.

loans.use: to buy baby clothes, diapers and a cover for the baby bed.

loans.name: Jose Fidel

texts.es: Jose, tiene 47 años de edad, está casado, vive en el municipio de Tocoa Colon junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos.  El siempre ha sido agricultor pero en busca de obtener más ingresos decidió con su esposa desde hace 3 años poner un negocio de abarrotería. Este negocio le ha permito obtener mayores ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de su familia. En la pulpería vende arroz, azúcar, manteca, frijoles, sal, huevos, refrescos, churros, dulces y otros abarrotes. El está solicitando la cantidad de 10,000.00 Lempiras ya que desea invertirlo en el surtido de su negocio con productos como ser: granos básicos, harina, café, manteca, azúcar, productos de limpieza  y otros productos de uso diario. De esta manera el planea mejorar sus servicios dentro de su comunidad, ampliar la cantidad y variedad de productos y su clientela. Su meta es continuar con el cultivo de maíz mediante  las ganancias que pueda obtener de su negocio.
texts.en:
Jose is 47 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and three children in the municipality of Tocoa Colon.  He has always been a farmer but, looking for a way to earn more, he decided to open a grocery store with his wife three years ago.  This business has allowed him to earn a higher income in order to pay for his family’s needs.  He sells rice, sugar, shortening, beans, salt, eggs, drinks, churros, sweets, and other groceries in his store.  

He is asking for a loan of 10,000 Lempiras because he wants to invest it in stocking his business with products such as basic grains, flour, coffee, shortening, sugar, cleaning products, and other daily-use items.  In this way he plans to improve his services within the community, expanding the quantity and variety of products and his clientele.  His goal is to continue planting corn through the earnings he gets from his business.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, flour, coffee, shortening, sugar, cleaning products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Зулфия 51 летняя женщина. Она уроженка района Шахритус. Зулфия живет вместе с детьми и мужем. Она спокойная, умная, активная и ответственная. Зулфия решила начать новый бизнес. Она всегда ищет что-то нового. Зулфия привыкла трудиться, и без труда она не может сидеть дома. Зулфия хочет заниматься животноводством, она научилась от соседки. Зулфия просит кредит для купли несколько скота. Она уверена в том, что у нее все получиться. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ей приобрести несколько скота и начать деятельность. Зулфия с большими надеждами обратилась к Вам за кредитом.
texts.en:
Zulfiya is 51 years old and she comes from the Shahrituz district of Tajikistan where she lives with her children and her husband.  She is quiet, intelligent, dynamic, and responsible.  As someone who is always looking for something new to get involved in, she has decided to start a new business.  She is used to working hard and cannot stay at home with nothing to do.

Zulfiya wants to get involved in animal husbandry, an activity which she has learned from one of her neighbors.  She is taking this loan to buy a few head of livestock.  She is confident that she will succeed.  Thanks to the loan that she has requested, she will be able to buy a few head of livestock and to start her new business.  With high hopes, Zulfiya is turning to you for support.

loans.use: to buy some livestock and start a new business.

loans.name: Dunia

texts.en:
Dunia is a 21-year-old single young lady from Tubas in Jenin City. Her father works as a stone crusher where he gets a low and unstable income. His income barely covers all the family's needs.

Dunia is a student in the local university where she studies law. She wants to earn a BA degree and find a job in the future to support her family.

Dunia took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay her university fees for this semester. By taking this loan, Dunia will be able to register in the university and pay part of the urgent expenses she has.

Dunia appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay her university fees for this semester.

loans.name: Aya

texts.en:
Aya is a 20-year-old single young lady from Nablus city. Her father provides the sole source of income, but his income is low and unstable. His income barely covers all the family's needs.

Aya is a student in the local university where she studies Educational Science. She wants to earn her BA degree and find a job in the future to support her family.

Aya took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university fees for this semester. By taking this loan, Aya will be able to register at the university and pay part of the urgent expenses she has.

Aya appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university fees for this semester.

loans.name: Umsunai

texts.ru: Умсунай, 62 года, замужем, есть 4 детей. У Умсунай- среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Умсунай, на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 коровы. На 1,0 Га земли выращивает кукурузу для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 7,000 сом (KGS). Умсунай все накопленные средства вкладывает в развитие бизнеса. Она решила сделать ремонт дома, поэтому обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку строительных материалов. Доходы от бизнеса, Умсунай планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины и улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en:
Umsunai is 62, married, and the mother of four children.  She has a secondary education and she is involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, two activities which constitute her family's main source of income.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently owns three cows and she grows corn for resale on one hectare of land.  She makes a monthly income of about 7,000 som (KGS) and uses all her savings to grow her business.

Having decided to perform some repairs in her house, Umsunai has turned to Bai Tushum Bank and requested a loan of 40,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy construction supplies.
