She is planning to use the earnings from her farming activity to increase her livestock headcount and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to perform home improvements in her house.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a youth man live in Deir Al-balah Gaza strip He also works in the public sector, where the salary is very low and unstable. As a result of the high cost of living, he decided to open a new business. His business idea is to transport the goods and inventory between traders in his rickshaw.

A few years ago Ahmad bought a new rickshaw and become well known and has a loyal customer base. Ahmad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to do some maintenance for his rickshaw. By taking this loan Ahmad can working more efficiently and increase his sales, also his profit.

loans.use: to do some maintenance for his rickshaw,.

loans.name: Basiru

texts.en:
Basiru is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Basiru is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. Traditionally, Basiru would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Basiru will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Basiru now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Yahaya Bachanes

texts.en:
Yahaya is maize farmer from Sarki village. As a member of Babban Gona, Yahaya is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the oppotrtunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. Before joining Babban Gona, Yahaya would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Yahaya is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Kursantkan

texts.ru: Курсанткан, 46 лет, замужем, мать 6 детей, самому младшему 17 лет. У Курсанткан среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 25 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду, Курсанткан на сегодняшний день имеет 2 коровы, 2 лошади и 5 овец. Также у нее есть 0,81 Га арендованной и 1,84 Га собственной земли, на которой она выращивает подсолнечник, клевер, кукурузу. Курсанткан в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Курсанткан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, что позволит направить средства на свадьбу и постройку дома для старшего сына.
texts.en:
Kursantkan is 46, married, and the mother of six children.  Her youngest child is 17 years old.  Kursantkan has a secondary education and, for the past 25 years, she has been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, two activities which constitute a source of income for her family.  Thanks to her very hard work, she has come to the point where she now has two cows, two horses, and five sheep.  She also grows sunflowers, clover, and corn on 0.81 hectares of leased land and 1.84 hectares of her own land.

Eager to further grow her farming business, Kursantkan has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum Bank, and requested a loan of 80,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy a few cows in order to increase her cattle headcount.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further grow her farming business, which will allow her to save enough money to pay for her oldest son's wedding and to build him a house.

loans.use: to buy some cows and increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Ameed

texts.en:
Ameed is a 20-year-old young man from Qabatia near Jenin city. His father is an employee where he gets a low and unstable income. This income barely covers all the family needs.

Ameed is a student in the university where he studies finance and banking. He wants to take the B.A. degree and find a job in the future to support his family.

Ameed took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university fees for the final semester. By taking this loan, Ameed will be able to register in the university and pay part of the urgent expenses he has.

Ameed appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university fees for the final semester.

loans.name: Maria Martha

texts.es:
María con 58 años de edad,de estado civil casada, vive en casa propia, junto a su cónyuge, en el distrito de Nueva Arica,provincia Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú, en una zona rural. María cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.

María se dedica a la Crianza y venta de animales de corral , aproximadamente con una experiencia en el rubro hace 10 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio.Solicita préstamo para la compra animales como patos, pavos y cuyes, dicho préstamo le ayudará para tener una mayor inversión, esto con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio.

María es socio reactivado en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Maria, 58, is married and lives with her husband in her own home, located in the Nueva Arica district of Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque department of Peru.  This is a rural area.  Maria has very good work and personal references from residents of the area.

Maria has a business raising and selling barnyard animals.  She has 10 years of experience in this line of work.  Her business is located on her property.  She is requesting a loan to buy animals such as ducks, turkeys, and guinea pigs.  This loan will help her to make a greater investment in her business, as her goal is to expand the business.

Maria is a reactivated member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise

loans.name: Yakubu Dan Yautai

texts.en:
Yakubu is a maize farmer from Sarki village. As a Babban Gona member, Yakubu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Yakubu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs.

Yakubu will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Yakubu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Yakubu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Jafaru Black

texts.en:
Jafaru is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Jafaru has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Jafaru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Jafaru can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Jafaru will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Jafaru is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en:
Khalid is a 32-year-old single man from a city that is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with his family in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Khalid took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Rossi

texts.es:
Rossi es una mujer de 29 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 1 hijo de 6 años y una hija de 8 años, y su negocio es la venta de teléfonos celulares.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora y muy independiente. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Max paredes’ caracterizada por el comercio en todas las áreas.
Rossi es de piel morena, baja estatura y físico delgado, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como maestro albañil y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la venta de teléfonos celulares, empezó su negocio hace 2 años, trabaja sola, “vendo teléfono y algunos artículos como audífonos y carcasas…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que todos utilizan teléfono y las ventas son constantes, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar un mostrador dónde exponer sus productos. Su sueño es importar celulares y repartir por mayor, ella desea comprar un mostrador para exponer su mercadería. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Rossi solicita un préstamo para comprar un mostrador para exponer celulares a la venta.
texts.en:
Rossi is a 29 year old woman. She lives with her partner and she has a 6 year old son and an 8 year old daughter. Her business is selling cellphones.

She is a good mother, enterprising and very independent. Her business takes place in the ‘Max paredes’ neighborhood which is an area filled with businesses.

Rossi is dark-skinned, thin and short. Her mother tongue is Aymará and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her partner who works as a master bricklayer and her children who study in school. They live in house that belongs to the family, constructed of bricks with all the basic services.

Her business is selling cellphones. She started her business two years ago and she works alone. "I sell telephones and some articles like earphones and cases", she commented. The advantage of her business is that everyone uses a phone and her sales are constant. The disadvantage is the lack of money to buy a new display case to exhibit her products. Her dream is to import cell phones and distribute them wholesale. She wants to buy a display case to exhibit her products. This is her first loan with the institution in the two years she has run this business.

It is for these reasons that Rossi is requesting a loan to buy a new display case to exhibit her products for sale.

loans.use: to buy a display case to exhibit cellphones for sale.

loans.name: Rutendo Group

texts.en:
The birth of a new child is a happy moment but it comes with responsibilities. The time before the birth of the baby is the time to purchase the baby’s clothing, bedding and other items that the new mother might need during her stay in hospital after the birth. Jane as a mother knows that this is a market which does not go dry as people are giving birth and adding on to their families on a daily basis. There is always a need for babywear and maternity products.

In Budiriro 2, a high density suburb in Harare, there is a busy shopping centre. This is where Jane plies her trade. She is a cross-border trader who specialises in buying and selling babywear and children’s clothing. Jane started her business a long time ago in a bid to earn a living and help her husband in purchasing a family home for their family. She has crossed to Mozambique, South Africa, Botswana and Zambia to get a variety of clothing for her happy and expectant clients.

The dictionary describes hardworking as industrious, zealous - this description is a perfect fit for Jane. Fifty-three year old Jane has no school-going dependents as all her children are grown up. She is now a doting grandmother to two grandchildren. She found out about Thrive from other borrowers after admiring their progress in business and teamed up with her friends who are also in business to form the Rutendo group. They attended training offered at Thrive and learned how to keep daily business records in which they record income and expenditure for the day. Rutendo group members testify that impulse buying is a thing of the past after learning about the importance of budgets.

Through the course of her business, Jane has identified that people usually demand baby blankets and wrappers for covering their young babies. She is positive that with a Kiva loan of $350, she will be able to increase her products. She wants to buy different baby blankets that cater for every season so as to remain competitive in the market where other ladies are selling products similar to hers.

loans.use: to buy baby blankets to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 29-year-old single man from a city that is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with his family in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Ali took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Vision Group

texts.en:
Don't underestimate the power of your vision to change the world, whether that world is your office, your community or an industry, you need to have a core belief that what you contribute can fundamentally change the way of thinking. The women of the group Vision are determined to change their communities and families. These women are dedicated to making their businesses succeed. They know that they are not where they want to be but they are on a journey. One member of this group is Ngonidzashe, she is the chairperson of the group.

Ngonidzashe is in the poultry business, she also specialises in selling second-hand clothes. She is a widow and is the sole breadwinner of her family of 8. Most of her children and dependents are still school-going and whether they graduate or not depends on Ngonidzashe’s income earning capacity.

Ngonidzashe has realised that in order to provide for her family she needs to persevere and work extra hard. Although her poultry business has been growing fairly, she has been finding it hard to keep going. Her batch sizes are small and each poultry cycle produces minimal profits at completion. From the proceeds she has to retain enough working capital to fund growth but she also has to make drawings to sustain her family’s livelihood. Given all this, her growth has been stunted and in many instances she has been threatened by total capital depletion. She knows how to turn it around though, “if only I can increase my poultry batches from 100 to 200 birds and start a new batch after every 3 weeks, I would be fine.”

A defiant Ngonidzashe, with her vision and passion, is not afraid to try. Instead, she aims at defeating any barrier that would likely prevent her from providing for her family. This was the reason why she invited three of her friends to join Thrive Microfinance. With a loan from Thrive and financial training, the ladies are certain they will see their vision turn into reality.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Eye Opener Group

texts.en:
Life was not easy for Susan after the tragic loss of her husband. As a single mother of two, Susan had to make sure that her kids are well taken care of and assure school fees payments. She went to South Africa to look for employment and spent few years working as a waitress in a restaurant where she was seriously underpaid, as she did not have the requisite papers. She decided to come back to Zimbabwe and stay with her family in 2010, but she took back with her the experience she had acquired and used it to start a canteen business. She even registered her small venture at the company registrar’s office.

Due to financial constraints Susan is still operating from home in Chitungwiza where she cooks and sells fresh chips, Russian sausages and roasted chicken. Fortunately for her, her dwelling is along a busy road for commuter omnibus operators. Her delicious and generously sized food portions have enabled her over the past four years to attract attention to her home-based canteen. Every lunch hour is peak time for her, men and women from all walks of life are becoming addicted to her cooking and service. She now has big pots, gas stoves and solar energy for her microwave oven and fryers.

To improve her profitability Chitungwiza has also integrated chicken production. She now serves her own chicken without having to buy it from elsewhere. Her next move is to find a suitable location at a busier shopping centre where she intends to open up a Susie’s Eats outlet. She and her group recently completed training at Thrive. Susan will use her loan to improve her chicken production and buy more chicks.

loans.use: to buy poultry chicks.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a bakery owner from Matag-ob, Leyte. She has been making breads to sell in the community for five years. She is asking a loan from CEVI to buy flour. Her business supports four children ages seven to sixteen.

Elizabeth is hoping that she would be able to let her children finish their schooling through her business. Her goal is to keep her business sustainable and profitable for her family.

loans.use: to buy flour.

loans.name: Maoresa Group

texts.en:
Moline gracefully carries the dishes on her head, with her right hand holding the plates for balance while her left carries smaller buckets and dishes. A small sling bag where she keeps her money peeks from under her blouse from where it is hidden around her waist for security. Her feet are covered in dust from walking around the neighbourhood of Highfields selling her wares. She calls out in her loud melodious voice “Ma dish auya”, translated "the dishes are here" so that people in the neighbourhood know that she is passing through. Some stop her asking the cost of the things she sells and some stop her to buy some small meals on plastic dishes from her. After walking around the neighbourhood Moline goes to the busy hub of Gazaland shopping centre and industrial area. She then wholesales to shop owners or retailers who have stalls around Gazaland complex.

This has been fifty-eight-year-old Moline's life for the past three years. She is married with three school-going children. Her husband is unemployed, making Moline the only breadwinner in the family. The family resides in her deceased in-law’s residence, making them the default homeowners.

Maoresa group was formed when Moline and three ladies who are into small businesses came together formally as a group so as to access loans from Thrive. The ladies are neighbours who have a history that spans over ten years. It is this shared history and understanding that made the women trust each other enough to apply for a loan on a group guarantee basis. The women attended lessons from Thrive Microfinance and the group was successful in being advanced a loan.

Moline is planning to use her loan to grow her business. She wants to restock rope tubs, kitchen dishes and washing tub dishes in bulk, to sell wholesale to retailers in town and in the Gazaland complex. She also wants to buy other small everyday plastic items like snack boxes, pegs and storage tins to sell around her neighbourhood so that she can capture many segments in the market.

loans.use: buy tubs & dishes in bulk.

loans.name: Patismedina Group

texts.en:
If you are a parent, your most important roles are to provide a home for the child and to protect, educate and maintain the child. These are duties and responsibilities that Diana takes to heart. She is married to Innocent and they are working tirelessly to take care of their three children, two of whom are in school, with the youngest still at home. Diana’s husband is a self-employed driver who specialises in collecting cars for local buyers from sea ports like in Dar es Salaam Tanzania.

After graduating with a diploma in marketing, Diana was looking forward to a well-paying white collar job. After posting and emailing countless application letters with no success she decided to be her own boss. She decided to utilise her backyard and started a poultry business. She started off with a batch of 100 chickens. After stumbling in the beginning she finally found her feet and mastered the art of rearing healthy marketable chickens. Now she is able to keep two batches of 200 broilers every month, selling about 400 broilers each month. She sells her chickens to people in her neighbourhood, church and to caterers. The business has helped her to meet the daily household expenses and help her husband take care of the family.

Diana has experienced delays in payment from her customers as she sells mostly on credit. The delays in cash movement were affecting her business activity, necessitating her to seek additional cash injection in form of a loan. Together with 3 of her friends with small businesses she started the Patismedina Group and approached Thrive Microfinance for funding. She added new skills like book-keeping, savings and how to grow her business through borrowing on top of the marketing knowledge she had from her training.

Diana, together with her group members, received a total group loan of $1350 to finance their businesses. Diana wants to use her loan buy feed, broilers chicks and medicine so she can have no interruption in growing her chickens, even if her customers delay their payments.

loans.use: to buy chicks, chicken feed & medicine.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Fifty-two-year old Lucresia owns a sari-sari store business in the municipality of Matag-ob, Leyte. She sells basic merchandise that is needed by people on a daily basis like vinegar, soy sauce, corn starch, sugar, milk, Milo sachets, powdered detergent, coffee, matches, canned corned beef, beef loaf, sardines, creamer and shampoo.

Lucresia is asking a loan to increase her inventory and in the process increase her sales. She will utilize her loan to buy salt, seasoning, canned food, biscuits, chips, candies, eggs, noodles, shampoo, toothpaste and milk.

Any income generated from her business will be ised for family consumption, savings and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to restock her store.

loans.name: Khetam

texts.en:
Khetam is 41 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for ‎them.
‎
Khetam runs a small business selling blankets at her home. She has requested a loan to buy ‎blankets and clothes to sell to be ready for the winter season.

In the future, Khetam would like to save money to expand her business, and open an ‎independent shop to increase her profit.‎

loans.use: to buy ‎blankets and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rabee'

texts.en:
Greetings from Palestine! This is 22-year-old Rabee' from Tulkarem city. He is single with no kids.

Rabee' runs a car wash shop where he washes cars manually and automatically by using a car wash machine. He has been running this business for three years. He started his business by renting the current shop and equipping it with needed equipment. Rabee' says that the main challenge to his business is the competition in his area, as there are several car wash shops in his neighborhood.

Rabee' required this loan in order to buy a new automatic car wash machine for his shop. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to expand and improve his business. In the future, Rabee' plans to buy his current shop and increase his project capital. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy an automatic car wash machine.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en: For three decades, Celestina has been operating a Sari-sari (general store) business in Matag-ob, Leyte. This keeps her occupied and she really enjoys managing her business. Celestina is asking for a loan to buy items in bulk like detergent, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, chips, noodles, canned goods, and bananas.  She hope that in the future, she will be able to expand her store so she can better provide for her family, provide a healthy diet for herself and her husband, and save for old age.

loans.use: to buy detergent, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, chips, noodles, canned goods, and bananas.

loans.name: Janece

texts.en:
Janece is a wife and a mother to a 4-year-old daughter. She lives with her family in Matag-ob, Leyte. While her husband works in construction, Janece helps out by managing their motorized tricycle business which transports passengers to nearby villages. She also sells cosmetics to friends in her neighborhood.

Janece is requesting a loan so that she can buy a new side car for her tricycle business. She is on the lookout for more business opportunities so she can send her child to school someday.

loans.use: to buy a sidecar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Evert Lito

texts.es:
Evert con 36 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico junto a su cónyuge y su menor hijo de 8 años de edad, en el distrito de Pucará,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Evert cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.

Evert se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de piña, ubicado en el caserío de Cabra Chica - Pucará, con una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años.El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.

Evert es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa, a trabajado con dos créditos, campaña pasada se le otorgó S/ 2000,2500,4000 del cual a pagado bien. Evert firma sólo.
texts.en:
Evert, 36, lives in his own house of rustic materials along with his wife and his young son, 8, in the district of Pucara, Jaen province, department of Cajamarca, in Peru. Evert has very good personal as well as occupational references from the local residents.

Evert makes a living from agriculture, specifically growing pineapples, located in the hamlet of Cabra Chica, Pucara, with ten years of experience in this line of work. The loan which will be awarded to him will be used in agricultural work such as applications and incorporations of plant health products; fertilizers; and payment for the labor for his harvest. In this way, it will help to improve his crop physiologically, morphologically and productively. Thus he will have an opportune harvest and similarly he will have greater production, a better quality of product, because of which he will have no problem selling his product.

Evert is a return member of Edpyme Alternativa. He has worked with two loans. In the last campaign, he was awarded 2000, 2500, and 3000 soles which he has paid well. Evert signs alone.

loans.use: with agricultural work such as applications and incorporations of plant health products; fertilizers; and payment for the labor for his harvest.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
For ten years Justina has operated her small business in the municipality of Garcia Hernandez in Bohol. She grows rice and corn to sell to customers in her community.

Justina has asked for a loan from CEVI to maintain her farm. She would like to buy rice seedlings and fertilizer for her rice field. This will improve her crops and help her earn more money to support her family. Justina is determined to make a success of her farming so that she can save for old age. Justina is 59 years old.

loans.use: to buy rice seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Zoila Alicia

texts.es: Zoila vive en casa propia con su madre, ella se dedica a la venta de carteras y joyas de enchape desde hace 3 años vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias y ya tiene muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos de los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas prodcutos por mayor pra poder seguir con sus ventas y si tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Zoila lives in her own house with her mother. She has been making a living from the sale of handbags and costume jewelry for three years. She sells itinerantly in the different neighborhoods and she already has lots of customers. With the earnings she gets from her sales, she is able to cover some of the expenses that come up at home.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy more products wholesale so as to be able to continue her sales and thus have more economic income.

loans.use: to buy handbags and costume jewelry wholesale.

loans.name: Servillana

texts.en: Servillana is 35 years old. She is a married woman with two children ages two and five. She works hard for her family. She is determined to give her children the education that they need someday. Since her husband is a farmer she is engaged in raising hogs and native chickens and farming rice too. She is asking for a loan to buy piglets, chicks, feed and fertilizer. They would like to expand their farming business so that they can provide for their children's education.

loans.use: to buy piglets, chicks, feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Emprendedoras De Chinche Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal EMPRENDEDORAS DE CHINCHE, él banco está ubicado en el distritito de Maranura, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Bernardina continua dedicándose a la  agricultura, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua cultivando frutas como plátanos, naranjas entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abono entre otros.
Los socios en general se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This is one of the members of the Emprendedoras de Chinche communal bank, located in the Maranura district, La Convención province, Cusco department.

Bernardina, one of the members, continues to work in agriculture. She is a responsible and persistent person. She continues to grow fruits such as bananas and oranges, demanded by her customers. She would like to continue working in order to support her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy organic and chemical fertilizers, among other things.

All the members are grateful for the loan they received and promise to pay the loan according to plan.

loans.use: to buy organic and chemical fertilizers, among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Walaa

texts.en:
Walaa is a single woman who lives in Al-Yamon near Jenin with her parents. She is 19 years old and she has owned a beauty salon in her home for two years to help with her family expenses.


Walaa works very hard to earn a satisfactory income and to gain her loyal customers. She hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and stay capable of providing her family with decent living conditions.

She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner Alibdaa to achieve her goal and expand her business. She wants to buy products for her beauty salon, such as shampoo, scissors, hairpins, mirrors and chairs.

loans.use: to buy products for her beauty salon, such as shampoo, scissors, hairpins, mirrors and chairs

loans.name: Diana Nathaly

texts.es:
En el Cantón Pto. Quito Recinto Sta. Marianita con un clima cálido húmedo ubicado al Noroccidente de Pichincha con varios lugares turísticos para disfrutar en familia vive la señora Diana una mujer luchadora de 20 años tiene una sólida relación en unión libre de la misma tienen tres hijos.
Ella y su familia viven en una finca de este sector, su esposo trabaja en la misma en labores de campo, los fines de semana ella y su familia viajan a Pedro Vicente Maldonado en este lugar tienen su negocio que es la venta de pinchos de pollo, salchipapas etc. Aprendió de esta actividad por iniciativa propia ya que necesitaba ayudar a su esposo  porque el mensual de él no les alcanzaba, le dedican un promedio de 9 horas, Venden en el parque central o en las afueras de las discotecas desde las 6pm hasta las 3 de la mañana, sus hijitos se quedan solos y dormidos  en casa de una hermana que también se dedica a esta actividad.   
La señora Diana solicita este crédito para comprar un asadero ya que el anterior se encuentra en mal estado y también desea comprar una lavadora para su hogar, con esta inversión mejoraran sus ingresos económicos y podrá seguir ayudando en la preparación de sus hijos. 
La señora Diana agradece a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada
texts.en:
The Sta. Marianita village, in Pto. Quito canton, North Eastern Pichincha, has warm and humid weather. There are several touristic attractions where people can enjoy with their families. This is where Diana lives. She is a fighter, a 20-year-old woman that lives in a common-law marriage and has three children.

She and her family own a farm. Her husband works their land. During the weekends, she and her family travel to Pedro Vicente Maldonado, where they sell chicken on sticks, sausage with potatoes, etc. She learned this activity on her own. She needed to help her husband because what he earned was not enough to support the family. They work around nine hours. They sell at the main square or outside the night clubs, from 6 pm until 3 am. Her small children stay at her sister's, where they sleep. She does the same thing for a living.

Diana is requesting this loan to buy a griddle; the one she has is in bad shape. She also wants to buy a washing machine for her home. With this investment, their income will improve, and she will be able to continue paying her children's education.

Diana wants to thank Kiva for their support and the opportunity she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy a new griddle to increase her income and continue helping her children.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is a piggery owner from the municipality of Garcia Hernandez in Bohol. The town of Garcia Hernandez is an hour by bus from the capital of Bohol. Marilou is 31 years old and has been raising hogs for the past 2 years. She usually earn 5,000 PHP every four months when it is time to sell her fattened hogs.  She is requesting a loan to buy feed, piglets, and supplements. Marilou hopes that the loan will make her business expansion possible. In the future, she hope to make her business more successful so she can pay for school for her three children, ages 10, 11, and 12.

loans.use: to buy feed, piglets, and supplements.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana hails from Duero in Bohol. She is 37 years old and married with children aged 9 and 11.

Together with her husband, she has been farming vegetables and ginger to provide for her family’s needs. She wanted to increase her income for her family’s benefit. She applied for a loan to be used to buy seeds and fertilizer. Any additional income will go to her family’s daily consumption and her child’s education.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anaclita

texts.en:
Anaclita is into rice farming to support her family. This has been her business for 10 years now. Even with her children already grown, she still works hard so she can earn for her own needs.

She and her family live in Garcia Hernandez, a town in Bohol. She and her husband help each other in tilling the land, hoping for a good harvest.

She applied for a loan knowing that this could help them. The money that they will get will be used to acquire fertilizer and seedlings. They are expecting a better yield on their crops for having the means now to buy the needed farming maintenance.

Any income derived from this business will be spent on her family’s daily consumption and future business investment.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
At 24, Caren has embraced the reality of hard work in farming. With two children ages 2 and 5, Caren grows vegetables and spring onions in the town of Jagna, Bohol. As a mother she dreams of a good life for her children.

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides, seedlings and spring onions. Caren aims at making her business successful so that she can provide for her family well and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, seedlings and spring onions.

loans.name: Petronilo

texts.en: Petronilo is a resident of Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. He is 48 years old. He owns a barn where he raises hogs for a living and he is also a rice farmer. Petronilo would like to earn more money because he has five children, ages 14-21. He is requesting a loan to buy piglets, fertilizer, and seedlings. It will be a relief for him to expand his business and add more piglets to raise. Petronilo is motivated to work hard for his family. He will use the loan to pay for healthy meals, contribute to his savings, and reinvest in his business. In the future, he plans to make his barn bigger.

loans.use: to buy piglets, fertilizer, and seedlings.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is a 55-year-old, married woman and a mother of five children from Trinidad, Bohol. She has been engaged in the clothing and fashion accessory sales business for many years now.

Anecita is asking for a loan to buy more clothes from GTY brand. Through this loan, she will be able to sell more and augment her profit and sales.

In the future, Anecita hopes to make her business a success so she can support the education of her youngest child, who is 15 years old.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth earns a living through her rice farming business. She is a married woman, and has three children who are still school-aged. Elizabeth has been in the business of farming for many years now; this is the source of her income.

Elizabeth is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer to maintain her crops. This will help her expand her farm and provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca manages a rice farm and a sari-sari (variety) store in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with children who are mostly adults. Her youngest is 19.

Rebecca's goal is to make her farming business more profitable. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer to make her crops grow healthy.

An increase in her income will mean nutritious food for her family, savings and a thriving business.

Any additional profit will be used for reinvestment in the same business and to pay the school fees of her child.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra has operated a food business in San Miguel, Bohol, for many years now. She is married with two adult children.

Alejandra is currently engaged in food vending, and she sells ice candy (popsicles), rice cakes (sweetened sticky rice) and pancakes. This is the source of her income.

Alejandra wants to expand her business but lacks the financial resources to do so. So, she is requesting a loan with CEVI to buy cooking oil, bananas and sugar Through this loan, Alejandra will have all the ingredients she needs for her food vending business, which will allow her to cook and sell more.

In the future, Alejandra hopes to increase her business profits for healthy meals and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, bananas and sugar.

loans.name: Ma. Lorena

texts.en:
Ma. Lorena is 40 years old and from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married with five children ages 8-17.

Ma. Lorena and her husband work together to raise their family well. She is engaged in fishing and catching crabs.

She is asking for a loan to buy a new fishnet. She plans to make improvements in their fishing to increase the profit and provide better for their children's schooling.

loans.use: to  buy fishing nets

loans.name: Robereta

texts.en:
Robereta is 37 years old and from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with four children, ages 2 to 17. She and her family are engaged in fishing and farming. Her business has been in existence for many years now.

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seedlings.

She is determined to make sure that her children have a good education out of her income. She would like to continue her business so she can provide well for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seedlings.

loans.name: Marciano

texts.en:
Marciano is a 60-year-old farmer and fisherman from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. He is married with four children. Most are adults, and the youngest is 12.

He has been fishing for a long time now and would like to further invest in his livelihood. He is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets and and a new fishing boat.

His fishing business affords him healthy meals and school fees for his child. In the future, he hopes for an increase in his income from fishing by continued hard work and improvement on his livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and a fishing boat.

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.en: Anastacio lives in Badian, Cebu with his wife. He is 55 years old. He raises cattle and goats to earn an income. Most of the time, he just lets his animals feed on pasture. However, Anastacio would like to buy feed so his animals will grow fat and healthy more quickly. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy feed. Anastacio hopes to expand his business someday and buy more animals to raise on his farm. His income will allow him to pay his bills and buy healthy meals for himself and his wife.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina lives in Badian, Cebu. She is 59 years old and married. Like most residents of Cebu, Josefina runs a hog-raising business in a barn near her house. This has been her livelihood for many years. Josefina enjoys taking care of her animals, even giving them baths using a water hose. Josefina usually earns a profit of 10,000 PHP every time she sells her fattened hogs. She is asking for a loan from CEVI to buy more piglets, which she hopes will increase her income. She dreams of expanding her business in the next year to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy more piglets.

loans.name: Rudy Yonatan

texts.es:
Rudy es un hombre de 25 años de edad, es casado con una linda familia de un hijo, esta familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Rudy para obtener un buen ingreso desde hace 1 año trabaja para una institución privada que se ubica en una aldea circunvecina. Para Rudy estudiar y cuidar de su familia ha sido un gran reto, sin embargo con el apoyo de su familia ha logrado avanzar con sus estudios universitarios, pero en esta ocasión él tiene la necesidad de acudir a un préstamo para solventar algunos gastos que ya no están dentro de sus posibilidades cubrir, Rudy solicita un préstamo de Q 4,000.00 para pagar colegiaturas. Rudy pagara su crédito con los ingresos que obtiene de su trabajo y con el apoyo de su esposa.
Su esperanza de vida  es  tener su propia casa y obtener su titulo universitario.
texts.en:
Rudy is a 25 year old man. He is married and has a beauty family with one son. His family lives in a community called Sololá.

In order to earn a good income, Rudy started working at a private institution in a nearby town a year ago. It has been a great challenge for Rudy to study and care for his family. Nevertheless, with the support of his family, he was able to continue his college education. However, he is currently requesting a loan to pay some costs that he has not been able to cover. Rudy request a loan of Q 4,000 to pay tuition fees. Rudy will repay his loan with the income he receives from his job and with the support of his wife.

His life dream is to have his own home and to earn his college degree.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina runs a small business growing rice and raising hogs in Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. She has been in this business for the past ten years.

Saturnina has requested a loan from CEVI to expand her business. She would like to buy feed, piglets, and fertilizer. This will help Saturnina grow and sell more rice which will increase her overall income at harvest time. The feed will help fatten her hogs. The additional income will help her to support her two dependents.

loans.use: to buy feed, piglets, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Julito

texts.en: Julito is a 46-year-old married man and father of three school-aged children. They live in Bien Unido, Bohol, Philippines. Julito has been engaged in the fishing business for many years now. This is the only source of his daily income. Julito has hopes of improving his fishing vend nture but lacks the capital to do so. Because of this challenge, he is asking for a loan to pay for boat repair and buy plywood, adhesive, paint and nails. Through this, Julito will be able to enhance his daily catch, thus allowing him to sell more fish in the market. Julito dreams of a better life together with his family.

loans.use: to pay for boat repair and buy plywood, adhesive, paint and nails.

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Seven years ago Genelyn started farming vegetables to provide for her family. She grows spring onions right now to provide for the needs of her three children aged 5 to 8 years old. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, seedlings and pesticides.

With the loan she will be able to expand her business and provide the much needed farming necessities. The additional income will go to her family's daily consumption, school fees and savings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings and pesticides

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en: Forty-nine-year-old Rolando from Jagna, Bohol earns a living through growing spring onions. With the demand for this, he had his share of profits from his hard work from the previous harvest season. With the money that he requested from the loan, he plans to buy fertilizer, pesticides, seedlings and more spring onions. He plans to work harder on his farm so he can expect a good harvest and increase his profitability. The additional income will go to his family's daily consumption, future savings and school fees for his five school-aged children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, seedlings and more spring onions

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en: Alfredo is from Garcia Hernandez.  He is 42 years old, married and has three children. His eldest is 19 and the youngest is 15.  He supports his family through farming rice.  He has great dreams for his children, which is the reason why he works hard tilling the land. He is asking for a loan to help finance his farm inputs like fertilizer, and seeds and pay for labor. The additional income he will have from this business will go to his children’s education, family consumption and savings for the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds and pay for labor.

loans.name: Amonvi

texts.ru: Эту женщину зовут Амонви. Ей 46 лет. Амонви работает воспитательницей в садике. Она просто обожает маленьких детей, по этой причине выбрала ту деятельность. Она еще у себя  занимается швеей у себя дома. Амонви работает и зарабатывает и помогает семье. Она замужем и мать троих детей. У нее две дочери и один сын. Старшая дочка занимается шитьем женской одежды. Младшая дочка учится в средней школе. Скоро старшая дочь Амонви выходит замуж, и Амонви хочет взять кредит и помочь мужу в проведении свадебного мероприятия старшей дочери. Таджики очень дружелюбная нация старавшаяся сохранять родственные связи, за счет этого приглашаются столь большое количество гостей, и соответственно свадебное мероприятие требует больших расходов. Из-за нехватки денег Амонви спрашивает кредит. Амонви очень надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
This woman is called Amonvi. She is 46 years old. Amonvi works as a kindergarden teacher. She just loves small children, and for this reason she chose this job. She also works with sewing from her home.

Amonvi works and earns money to help her family. She is married and the mother of three children. She has two daughter and one son. The eldest daughter works wtih sewing women's clothing. The youngest daughter goes to high school.

Soon Amonvi's eldest daughter will get married, and Amonvi would like to take a loan and help her husband to hold a wedding party. The Tajiks are very friendly people and they strive to keep family ties. Due to this, the number of guests invited is large, and the wedding becomes accordingly expensive. Due to a lack of money, Amonvi requests a loan. Amonvi hopes very much for your support.

loans.use: to pay for her eldest daughter's wedding

loans.name: Ikrom

texts.ru: 53 летный умный, серьезный человек Икром. Он из района Шахритус. Икром женат и у него один единственный сын. Его жена в лицее работает уборщицей. Сам Икром работает учителем в техническом лицее. После окончания университета Икром начал работать учителем. Икром хорошо учить, и воспитывает своих школьников. Он начал отремонтировать свой дом, он долго ждал этого момента. Икром просит кредит для купли стройматериалы. Ему не хватает денег, по этой причине он просит кредит. Вы можете поддержать его сейчас!
texts.en:
This 53 years old, smart and earnest man is Ikrom. He is from the Shahrituz region. Ikrom is married and has one son. His wife works as a teacher at the Lyceum (secondary school). Ikrom works as a teacher at the technical Lyceum. After finishing university, Ikrom started working as a teacher. He teachers well, educating his students.

Ikrom started renovating his house, which he has been waiting for for a long time. He requests a loan to purchase building materials. He does not have enough money, and for this reason he requests a loan. You can help him now!

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Badalbi

texts.ru: Бадалби 38 летняя мастер швея. Она 3 года занимается швеей. У нее 3 летный стаж, но она опытная и хорошо справляется своей работой. Бадалби шьет разные одежды. Она замужем и мать одного ребенка. У нее один 12 летный сын. Бадалби хочет улучшить жилищные условия, и жить уютно и комфортно. Она собирается отремонтировать дом, освежить комнаты. Для купли стройматериалы ей требуется денег. По этой причине Бадалби просит Вас дать кредит. Бадалби заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en:
Badalbi is a 38 year old seamstress. She has worked with sewing for three years. She only has three years of experience, but she is experienced and copes well with her work. Badalbi sews different types of clothing. She is married and the mother of a child; she has a 12 years old son.

Badalbi would like to improve their living conditions, to stay cozy and comfortable. She has decided to renovate her house, and freshen up the bedrooms. To purchase building materials, she needs money. For this reason she requests you to give her a loan. Badalbi extends her gratitude in advance.

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina lives in Garcia Hernandez in Bohol. She is married with a dependent aged 16. With the help of her motorcycle, Gina sells fresh fish, chicken meat and vegetables. She is asking for a loan to buy more fish, chicken and vegetables so she can increase her profits. Gina is hopeful that with her goal in life and determination to send her children to school, they will have a better life than hers has been. Gina is 49 years old.

loans.use: to buy fish, chicken and vegetables

loans.name: Godofreda

texts.en:
For the last 10 years, Godofreda has operated her small business in Jagna, Bohol. She sells cooking oil, spices, biscuits, canned goods and toiletries to customers in her community.

Godofreda has asked for a loan from CEVI to expand her business. She would like to buy canned sardines, beef loaf, shampoo, bath soap, milk, coffee, sugar, matches, biscuits and liquor to fill her shelves.

Godofreda is 43 years old and the mother of three children ages 3, 8 and 18.

loans.use: to buy canned sardines,  beef loaf, shampoo, bath soap, milk, coffee, sugar,  matches,  biscuits and liquor.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is 42 years old and comes from the community of Garcia Hernandez in Bohol. She is engaged in a sari-sari store and in raising hogs. She requests a loan to buy feed, toothpaste, shampoo, insect repellent, canned sardines, seasoning, detergent powder, soy sauce, vinegar, and bath soap. Her income will pay for the needs of her four children, aged 10, 12, 14, and 17. She dreams of sending her children to college for a better life.

loans.use: to buy feed, toothpaste, shampoo, insect repellent, canned sardines, seasoning, detergent powder, soy sauce, vinegar, and bath soap.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, vende de manera ambulante por las diferetes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de las ganancias es como puede salir adelante con los gastos de su hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas frutas y verduras por mayor para tener mas producto y asi mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
This young man's face is pixeled because he is 25 years old and lives in a high risk area. He works as a street vendor selling fruit and vegetables in different communities near his home. With his earnings he is able to get ahead and cover household expenses.

This youth lives in his own home with his family. The loan he is requesting is to buy more fruit and vegetables, wholesale, to have more stock and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables, wholesale.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José con 66 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y nietos, en el distrito de San Felipe,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

José se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, variedad Catimor de 04,05 y 06 años de edad, cuenta con fincas fruteras de café en buen estado, dichos cultivos se encuentran ubicados a unos metros de su domicilio. Adicionalmente se dedica a cultivo de frutas, cuenta con fincas fruteras de lima, granadillas,etc, con más de 25 años de experiencia en el rubro, así mismo se desempeña como peón agrícola en su caserío.Solicita préstamo para invertir en la compra de abono y en el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café. De esta manera podrá adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida de él y la de su familia.

José es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa. José es socio no bancarizado.
texts.en:
Jose, 66, lives with his common-law wife and grandchildren in the district of San Felipe, province of Jaen, in the department of Cajamarca, Peru. The local people work mainly in agriculture, commerce and livestock farming.

Jose works in agriculture, mainly in coffee growing, of the Catimor variety, ages 4, 5 and 6 years. He has coffee plantations in good condition which are located a few meters from his house. He also grows fruit such as limes, passionflower, etc. with over 25 years' experience in the sector. He also works as a farmhand in the community.

The loan he is requesting is to buy fertilizer and provide maintenance for his coffee crop. This will allow him to earn a decent profit to improve his family's quality of life.

Jose is new, non-bank customer of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and provide maintenance for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Ana Alicia

texts.es: Ana de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijas, ella se dedica a la venta de pan dulce de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias de donde ella reside ya tiene muchos clientes y con su trabajo y ayuda de su esposo es como pueden salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas pan dulce por mayor y asi continuar con sus ventas para tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Ana is 42 and lives in her own home with her husband and their three daughters.  She sells sweet bread door to door in the different neighborhoods where she lives.  She has a lot of customers and with her work she helps her husband, which is how they are able to get by.  She is requesting a loan to buy more sweet bread wholesale and thereby continue with her sales so she can make better income.

loans.use: to buy more sweet bread wholesale.

loans.name: Doris Miladis

texts.es: Doris de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su esposo, ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de pan dulce y pupusas, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 10 años de la cual ha podido salir adelante y que le genera buenas ganancias con las que puede salir adelante, la clienta esta solicitando un credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion del pan dulce como: harina, azucar, jalea, entre otras cosas y asi poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Doris, 42, lives in her own house with her two children and husband. She makes and sells pastry and pupusas (stuffed tortillas), and has been in business for ten years. Through her work she has been able to get ahead and earn a good profit.

The loan she is requesting is to buy raw materials to make pastry such as flour, sugar, jelly, and other goods. This will allow her to continue her work and generate a good income.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, jelly and other goods.

loans.name: Bella Maranura Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal BELLA MARANURA, él banco está ubicado en el distritito de Maranura, provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Margarita tiene 54 años de edad  y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias  dedicándose a la  agricultura, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia cultiva frutas como plátanos, naranjas entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abono entre otros.
Los socios en general se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
texts.en:
The customer belongs to the community bank BELLA MARANURA which is located in the district of Maranura, province of La Convencion, department of Cusco.

Margarita, the customer, is 54 years old and married. She alternates her daily activities with her work in agriculture. She is a responsible, enterprising person who grows fruits such as bananas and oranges for anyone who requests them. She wants to continue working to support her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, manure and other supplies.

In general, the group members are grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

The person whose face is covered is not a member of the group.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, manure and other supplies.

loans.name: Los Retamales Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LOS RETAMALES, él banco está ubicado en el distritito de Challabamba, provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Zoraida  tiene 28  años de edad  es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias  dedicándose al negocio de cultivo de cereales, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abono entre otros.
Los socios en general se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This is a member of the LOS RETAMALES Communal Bank. The bank is located in the district of Challabamba in Paucartambo Province, Cusco Department.

Zoraida is 28 years old. She is in a relationship and has two children. She alternates her daily chores with her business growing grains. She is a responsible and entrepreneurial woman. She has had her business for a good while and it is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. She wants to keep working so she can keep supporting her family.

She is requesting this loan to buy fertilizers, manure, and other items.

The bank members are all thankful for the loans they have received and they promise to make their payments.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, and other items.

loans.name: Wilman Omero

texts.es:
Wilman con 40 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa familiar con su cónyuge e hijos, en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú. Wilman cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Wilman se dedica al comercio,principalmente a la venta de pescado como zuco, cachema,etc, con una experiencia de 02 años en el rubro. Solicita préstamo para invertir en la compra de una mayor cantidad de pescado para su negocio, ofreciendo de esta manera una mayor cantidad de productos, lo que le generará un incremento en sus ingresos, mejorando su calidad de vida el y la de su familia.

Wilman es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa, si a contado con un historial crediticio en otras entidades financieras.
texts.en:
Wilman is 40 years old. He is in a relationship and lives in the family home with his partner and children in the district of Cayaltí in Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Region, in the country of Peru. Wilman has very good personal and professional references among the people who live in the area. The residents of this town mostly work in farming, commerce, and ranching.

Wilman works in commerce, mainly selling fish such as sea bass, croakers, etc., and he has two years of experience in this profession. He is requesting this loan to buy a larger quantity of fish for his business. This will allow him to offer a larger quantity of products, which will create an increase in sales and improve his quality of life and that of his family.

Wilman is a returning member of Edpyme Alternativa and he has credit history with other financial organizations.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of fish for his business.

loans.name: Yolanda Del Carmen

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santo Domingo vive Yolanda, una señora de 53 años. Vive en casa de familiares ya que su casita propia le dio a un hijo para que emprenda en su propio negocio al mismo que le va muy bien.
Hace más de un año Yolanda volvió a su país natal Ecuador ya que vivía en España por falta de trabajo, allá se dedicaba a cocinar en restaurantes donde adquirió mucha experiencia; vivía sola y enviaba todos los meses dinero a sus hijos para que vayan mejorando la casita. Aun así Yolanda al igual seguía ahorrando porque tenía la esperanza de volver a su país natal y ponerse su propio negocio de comida. Ya hace más de un año pudo hacer parte de su sueño en realidad, ahora vive junto a su familia, y ha comenzado a adquirir unas cocinas para empezar con el negocio.
Acudió a Fundación Alternativa ya que le hace falta capital para poder iniciar con su local de comida, ya ha adecuado el espacio, ha comprado un mostrador y una cocina, pero necesita para mesas, materia prima y demás utensillos, con este crédito Yolanda podrá hace su sueño realidad. Está feliz porque ya podrá comprar todo lo necesario y así ser una microempresaria.
Agradece mucho a KIVA por el apoyo que brindan a las personas que no tienen el dinero para emprender el negocio pero si tienen un gran sueño y las ganas necesarias para iniciar.
texts.en:
Santo Domingo is where Yolanda, 53, now lives with relatives after giving her home to a son to start his own business which is going very well.

More than a year ago Yolanda returned to her native country, Ecuador, after living in Spain because of the labor market. There she cooked in restaurants and acquired a lot of experience. She lived alone and sent money back to her children to fix up the house. But she also kept saving because she wanted to return home and start her own food business. Over a year ago she started realizing her dream and now lives with family. She already has bought a range to start her business.

She approached Fundacion Alternativa because she lacks capital to start her restaurant. She has the location and has bought a counter and range but she needs tables, raw materials and other utensils. With the loan, Yolanda can achieve her goal. She is happy because she can buy everything she needs to become a small business owner.

She is grateful to KIVA for the support given to people who do not have the money to start a business although they have a large dream and the determination to get started.

loans.use: To open a restaurant and buy tables, raw materials and the utensils she needs to grow her small business.

loans.name: Minasmayo De Garavito Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MINASMAYO DE GARAVITO”; Este banco se ubica en el sector de Garavito, distrito de Santa Ana, provincia de La Convención, departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Adela, la socia continua con su  negocio de cultivo de frutas,  la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua cultivando frutas como plátanos entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y abono.
Los socios en general  agradecen a quienes forman parte de este sueño  y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members are part of the "MInasmayo de Garavito" communal bank, located in Garavito, in the Santa Ana district in the La Convencion province of Cusco.

One member of the group is Adela. Adela continues to work at her business growing fruits. Adela is responsible and persevering. She has had the business for some time, and it is going well thanks to her determination. Adela continues to grow fruits, including plantains. She wants to continue working in order to keep on supporting her family.

Adela is applying for this loan in order to buy seeds and manure.

The group's members are grateful to those who are part of this dream of a loan, and promise to make their repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El socio Felix sigue dedicándose a la agricultura y la ganadería, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, él socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio continua  cultivando trigo, cebada, papa, tubérculos, hortalizas entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio pertenece al  banco comunal “Apu Asangani”.
El socio  requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas, fertilizantes entre otros.
texts.en:
Felix continues to work at his farming and cattle-raising business. Felix is responsible and persevering. He has had his business for quite some time and it is going well thanks to his determination.

Felix continues to grow wheat, barley, potatoes, and other tubers and vegetables for customers who want these products. Felix wants to continue working in order to keep on supporting his family.

Felix is a member of the "Apu Asangani" communal bank.

He is applying for this loan in order to buy seeds, fertilisers and other products.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilisers and other products.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
El socio  pertenece al  banco comunal “Apu Asangani”.
El socio Nicolas continua dedicándose a la agricultura y venta de cereales, el socio agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad, el socio continua vendiendo los cereales a sus clientes que le solicitan, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio  solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas entre otros.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank 'Apu Asangani'. His name is Nicolas, and he continues to work in agriculture and the sale of cereals.

He is very grateful to the loan system, it is important to him, and he promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

He is still selling his cereals to his customers. He will use the loan to carry on in this business so he can support his family. He will invest the money in seeds and other supplies.

loans.use: to buy seeds and other supplies.

loans.name: Shelita Janeth

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Salud y Vida.  Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.
En este lugar vive a la señora Shelita tiene 44  años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 22, 18 y 12 años de edad, los dos menores estudian en universidad y colegio. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Shelita es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para ganar sus propios recursos para colaborar con los gastos del  hogar y el estudio de sus hijos, ella se dedica al comercio,  vende de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale dos o tres días por semana y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho o quince días. Lleva más de 10 años con este negocio el cual le permite ganar lo suyo por el bien de su familia, ella está muy agradecida con la institución y con las personas que le ayudan con los créditos pues es así como ella financia su negocio que le permite mejorar su vida.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que es así como financia su negocio, con este crédito espera también vender zapatos pues son muchos sus clientes que le han pedido y espera utilizar parte de este crédito para invertir en zapatos y el resto en ropa. Lleva más de 10 años  en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su vida.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, the credit group 'Salud y Vida' get together in Charapoto. This town is well-known for its traditional culture, as well as it being very close to two of the best beaches in the province: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

This is where Shelita, 44, lives and works. She is married and has three children aged 22, 18 and 12. The younger two are still in education. Her husband is a driver.

Shelita enjoys working so she can earn her own income and help with the household expenses and study fees. She sells all types of clothes door-to-door. She goes out two to three times a week, but also sells from her home too. Her most loyal customers usually go to her home.

She sells on credit and collects the money every eight or 15 days. She has been in this business for more than ten years. This has allowed her to make a living and help her family.

She is very grateful to the financial institution who helps her with loans. She will use the money to buy shoes so she can sell them to her customers - a product they have been asking for. She will use the remainder of the loan to buy other clothes.

She has been with the credit group for more than ten years and she is grateful to the system because it allowed her to start up her own business. Her future aims are to continue improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel con 45 años de edad,de estado civil casado, vive junto a su esposa y sus 4 hijos,en el distrito de Oyotún,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú, en una zona rural.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Miguel se dedica a brindar los servicios agrícolas de jornalería, contando con herramientas propias, como moto lineal, mochila de fumigar, palana, pico y oz; con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio.Solicita préstamo para arreglos para mantenimiento de moto lineal, equipos y herramientas, dicha inversión le servirá para facilitar su traslado diario a su trabajo, con gran influencia en el negocio; cliente piensa mejorar productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona.

Miguel es socio recurrente en Edpyme Alternativa. Ha tenido dos créditos de 1200,00 y 1000,00 los cuáles los a cancelado de manera puntual. Desde que se convirtió en socio de nosotros su negocio ha mejorado y su calidad de vida de igual forma.
texts.en:
Miguel, 45 and married, lives with his wife and four children in Oyotun, Chiclayo, Peru. This area comes under the Lambayeque office. It is a rural area, where most of the people work in agriculture, commerce or livestock.

Miguel works as a farm hand. He uses his own tools and equipment, such as his motorcycle, knapsack sprayer, shovel, pickaxe and sickle. He has more than five years' experience in this field.

He is asking for a loan to repair his motorcycle, which he uses to get to work every day. He will also buy tools and equipment. All of this will help him work better and be more productive, thus satisfying the greater demand of his customers.

He is a repeat borrower with Edpyme Alternativa. He has had previous loans worth 1200 and 1000 PEN, which he paid off on time. Since he became a member, his business and quality of life have improved together.

loans.use: to repair a motorcycle and buy equipment and tools.

loans.name: Inés Margarita

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito San Cristóbal, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Inés, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos mayores  de edad e independientes. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Inés es una mujer que le gusta a base de esfuerzo ganarse la vida y así  ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, ella  se dedica al comercio, tiene un pequeño local en su casa donde vende lácteos, ella compra la leche y el queso a ganaderos de la zona los mismos que le venden a muy buen precio para luego en su local vender  por libras  el queso y la leche por litros, de esta forma  ella se gana algo que le sirve para salir adelante. Lleva más de 20  años con este negocio el cual financia a los créditos que recibe por lo cual está muy agradecida.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar  leche y queso para la venta. Es fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los  crédito salen adelante. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, the credit group "San Cristóbal" meets every 15 days. This region is known for being very dynamic, where the majority of the population is engaged in agriculture and raising animals, for it is an area of lush vegetation.

In this place lives Inés, a woman of 55 years old. She is married and together with her husband they have 6 older children who are independent. Her husband is a driver.

Inés is a woman who likes to put forth effort to earn a living and help her husband with the household expenses. She is engaged in commerce. She has a small local shop in her home where she sells dairy products. She purchases milk and cheese from local farmers who sell it for a very good price, and later in her shop sells cheese per pound and milk per liter. In this way, she can earn some money that will help them to succeed. She's had more than 20 years work in this business, which re-pays the loans she receives, for which she is very grateful.

This loan will be used to purchase milk and cheese. She is the founder of her credit group and she likes it because with the loans they can be successful. Her dreams are to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase milk and cheese.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario con 29 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge e hijo,en el distrito de Oyotún,provincia de Chiclayo, país Perú. en una zona rural.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Mario se dedica a brindar los servicios agrícolas de jornalería, contando con herramientas propias, como palana, pico, oz y mochila de fumigar, con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio.Solicita préstamo para arreglos de vivienda y para mantenimiento de equipos y herramientas, dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas, con gran influencia en el negocio.Mario piensa mejorar productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona.

Mario es socio nuevo en Edpyme Alternativa.
