texts.en:
Mario, 29, is married and lives with his wife and son in Oyotun, Chiclayo, Peru. In this rural area, the majority of the population work in agriculture, commerce and livestock.

Mario works as a farm hand. He has his own tools such as a spade, pickaxe, sickle and knapsack sprayer. He has more than five years' experience in this work.

He is asking for a loan to carry out house repairs and also to maintain his equipment and tools. This will help him keep them in good condition so he can work as efficiently as possible.

He would like to improve his productivity so he can satisfy the different needs of his customers in the area.

He is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to carry out house repairs and maintain his equipment and tools.

loans.name: Leonor Magdalena

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Salud y Vida.  Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.
En este lugar vive la señora Leonor, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 3 hijas, 2 gemelas de 12 y otra de  5 años de edad, todas estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Leonor es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta valerse por sí misma y con sus recursos ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica al comercio tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa donde vende  leche, queso, yogurt y otros productos, todas las mañanas ella recibe los productos en su local los mismos que luego se encarga de vender al público en general, trabaja todos los días y su marido le ayuda en su negocio, ya son más de 4 años dedicada a este negocio el cual les permite salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar leche, queso, yogurt y todo lo que ella vende en su local. Lleva 3 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Every 15 days, the credit group 'Salud y Vida' get together in Charapoto. This area is well-known for its traditional culture, as well as being very close to two of the best beaches in the area: San Jacinto and San Clemente.

This is where Leonor, 34, lives with her husband and three daughters. Two of them are twins aged 12 and the other is five. They are all in full-time education. Her husband works in sales.

Leonor is hard-working and likes to make her own living so she can help her husband with the household expenses.

She has a small store which she runs from home. She sells milk, cheese, yoghurt and other products. She gets her products delivered to her store every morning and later sells them to the general public.

She works every day and her husband helps her when he can. She has been in this business for more than four years.

She will use the loan to buy milk, cheese, yoghurt and other products she sells in her store. She has been three loan cycles with this credit group and she is grateful to the system because it helps her business.

She hopes to continue to grow in the future.

loans.use: to buy dairy products.

loans.name: Pedrito

texts.en:
Pedrito is from Duero, Bohol. He is 57 years old. He has been engaged in a tailoring business for three years now. His children are already grown but Pedrito is dreaming of expanding his business to put up a garments business. At the moment he is asking for a loan to buy more cloth. His income provides for his food needs and household bills.

In the future, he hopes to make his planned expansion possible.

loans.use: to buy cloth

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.en: Anastacio is from Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. He is a hardworking and responsible man. He lives in his own home with his wife and five dependents, aged seven to eighteen. Every morning, Anastacio leaves early to work in his field. He knows that he has to make every effort to make his land more fertile so that he can obtain a good harvest. During harvest season, his products are sold in the town proper, the place where there are many buyers. What he enjoys most about his work is cultivating his land, since it requires much patience. He is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides. These will protect his crops from pests that can impact production. Within time, he hopes to give his children a better life by sending them to school.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides

loans.name: Noong Luong 33 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoi, 45, is an ethnic Thai lady who has been a single mom of an adult son. Her husband passed away several years ago and currently she lives with her in-laws and her son in an old, Thai, ethnic traditional house in a remote village. She has to work very hard to provide for her family with plenty of activities such as cultivating rice and corn, raising buffalo, pigs, chicken, and duck. She has been a farmer since she was a little girl, so she has good experience in farming and breeding. She is complimented by her neighbors because of her diligence and great effort to earn for a living. 

This is the fourth time she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program and she will use the loan to buy baby fish to develop fish farming. She hopes that her investment will go well, especially with the technical support of the Program, including training and counselling. Mrs. Thoi dreams that her family will soon escape from poverty. In the picture, she stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy baby fish to develop fish farming

loans.name: Manzurahan

texts.ru: Манзурахан, 55 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи, она занимается сельским хозяйством. В собственность есть 0,45 Га земли, где Манзурахан выращивает экологически чистый картофель, зелень и чеснок для реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль от бизнеса - 8,000 сом (KGS). Манзурахан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян картофеля. Доходы от бизнеса она планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Manzurahan is 55, married, and the mother of five children.  She has a secondary education and, in order to provide an income for her family, she is involved in agriculture.  She owns 0.45 hectares of land on which she grows organic potatoes, herbs and garlic for resale.  She makes a monthly income of 8,000 som (KGS) from her activity.

Manzurahan has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum Bank, and requested a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy seed potatoes.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further grow her farming business and to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy seed potatoes in order to grow organic vegetables.

loans.name: Bashiru

texts.en:
Bashiru is a Babban Gona farmer. Bashiru is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday. Traditionally, Bashiru would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With this loan Bashiru can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Bashiru has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Bashiru is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to purchase better inputs to improve his yield and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Yau

texts.en:
Yau is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Yau has the opportunity to attain yields of up to8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Yau would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Yau can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Yau will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Yau is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Salihu Isyaka

texts.en:
Salihu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Salihu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Salihu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Salihu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Salihu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Salihu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Eteuini

texts.en: Eteuini is a 41 year old mother with 8 children. She runs a business of providing a services to people by transportation(taxi). She has been doing this for a year. Eteuini requested for a loan to buy seat cover, painting, new windows, new wheels, air conditioning, to help her maintain the good services. She will use her profit to buy another taxi. She joined SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy seat cover, painting, new windows, new wheels, air conditioning

loans.name: Rafat

texts.en:
Rafat is a 41-year-old married man from Rafah city, located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs. However, he wants to improve his family standard of living help them live more comfortably.
 
Rafat took a USD loan from FATEN in order to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Rafat will be able heat water more efficiently, enable the family to take warm showers, while also decreasing the electricity expenses.
 
Rafat appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 29-year-old single man from Deir Al-Balah city, located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs. However, he wants to improve his family standard of living help them live more comfortably.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN in order to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able heat water more efficiently, enable the family to take warm showers, while also decreasing the electricity expenses.

Mohammad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita is 55 years old, widowed with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc..

Melita has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from fish vending and rice retailing.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Sani

texts.en:
Sani is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Sani has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Sani would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Sani can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Sani will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Sani is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is a woman eager to get ahead. She is a 28-year-old mother who lives with her family in the Nkubu area of Kenya, and is blessed with a lovely family which is her greatest motivation in life to persevere because she wants to provide them a better future. Fridah was unable to study to get a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and has been practicing farming for the past 10 years. She is an early riser who goes to her farm to earn a living, and has space there to increase her dairy farming.

In 2010, Fridah started farming on her husband's 1.2 acre piece of land in mathene village in Kenya. Today, the farm is home to two large dairy cows. One way in which Fridah has chosen to increase her income is through improving milk production on her farm. To achieve a state where her two dairy cows are in perfect health, Fridah is seeking a loan investment from Kiva lenders to buy a chaff cutter to cut hay into small even pieces that the cows will enjoy. With more to chew, they will need more to drink and this will lead to more milk for Fridah's family to consume and sell.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana is a agriculture and she is planting vegetables, and after the vegetables were growing up,  she will bring to the market for sell. She  started to planting vegetables a few year ago with her own working capital. Now she is requesting a loan of $700 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants used to improve her business. Everyday her life  is planting vegetables because she  is earning a good income from it. She taking  the loan from Tuba Rai Metin to increase her business and she is taking the loan to buy more tomato seeds, bean seeds, fertilizers. She is planting vegetable, but she just planting tomato and beans.

loans.use: to buy tomato seeds, bean seeds, fertilizers.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
It's a normal thing to have cereals in Kenya, but to start selling the cereals is something else entirely. Rose is a smallholder mixed-farmer based in Githo village in Nkubu. She is the mother of three, who has been practicing mixed farming for the last ten years. To earn a decent living, she makes income selling milk, poultry, greens and engaging in numerous small personal businesses. She wants to sell cereals to the ready market that is in her region. However, her biggest challenge today is limited funds to expand.

Rose is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase cereal for resale. Future proceeds from the commercialization of her cereal selling business are already committed to pay for her children's education. In the long run, she is confident her efforts will translate into her family having a better quality of life.
Rose greatest desire is to be able to give her family greater financial stability. She knows that with a hand from Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders, she will accomplish it.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Loimata

texts.en: A loan amount of $2000 will help Loimata to buy a  seat cover, painting, new windows, new wheels, to help her maintain the good services. Loimata is 62 years old with 6 children and had a business of providing a transportation for people. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy a  seat cover, painting, new windows, new wheels,.

loans.name: Nancy Yajaira

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Salud y Vida.  Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.
En este lugar vive la señora Nancy, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada pero aun no tiene hijos. Su esposo es empleado público.
Doña Nancy es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado trabajar, ella trabaja en una institución en la ciudad y también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, ella sale a vender en sus ratos libres pero la mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza en el trabajo ya que sus compañeros son sus mejores clientes porque les deja a buen precio y a crédito. A ella le encanta el comercio y lo viene realizando mucho antes de ingresar a trabajar ya que así se gana algo extra sin mucho esfuerzo.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas, ropa de niños, entre otras prendas. Ella lleva 3 años en el Grupo De Crédito le gusta por la puntualidad de los créditos. Sus sueños son tener algún día un bebé.
texts.en:
The ‘Salud y Vida’ credit group meets every fortnight in the town of Charapoto. This area is well known for its traditional culture and also for being a few minutes away from two of the best beaches in the province, namely San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Nancy, 36, lives in Charapoto. She is married but has no children yet, and her husband is a civil servant. 

Nancy has always liked working; she works in an institution in the city and she also makes a living in trade. She sells a wide range of clothing; she goes out to sell in her spare time but the majority of her sales are carried out at her workplace since her colleagues are her best clients because she offers them good prices and credit. Nancy loves selling and had been doing so long before she began to work, since this way she can earn so much more without much extra effort.

This loan will be used to buy trousers, blouses and children’s clothing among other items. Nancy has been part of the credit group for 3 years which she likes thanks to the reliability of the loans. Her dream is to have a baby one day.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses and children’s clothing among other items.

loans.name: Rofel

texts.en:
Rofel is 38 years old and married with three children, who are in school, Rofel works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Rofel has been in this business for 6 years.

In the future Rofel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Zilyadaini

texts.en:
Zilyadaini is maize farmer from Sarki village. As a member of Babban Gona, Zilyadaini is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer.

With Babban Gona’s support he has the oppotrtunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. Before joining Babban Gona, Zilyadaini would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Zilyadaini can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Zilyadaini is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is going to use the requested loan to buy building materials like sand, concrete and others to construct his house. He is a gentleman of ages thirty five married with 3 children all living in Kasese district. To get incomes, Moses owns a a retail shop, is a radio agent where he earns a salary and also does farming to make ends meet. The main reason for starting business was personal development. He is very honest that with the little earnings he gets he has to save, educate his children plus providing for his family. The main challenge he faces is in adequate capital to run his project well given the fact that he dreams of constructing a good permanent house for the family.

loans.use: to buy building materials like sand, concrete and others to construct his house.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is maize farmer from Makwalla village. As a member of Babban Gona, Ahmed is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the oppotrtunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ahmed would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ahmed can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Ahmed is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nasiru

texts.en:
Nasiru is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Nasiru has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Nasiru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Nasiru can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Nasiru will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Nasiru is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Shuáibu

texts.en:
Shuáibu is a maize farmer from Makwalla village. As a Babban Gona member, Shuáibu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Shuáibu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Shuáibu will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Shuáibu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Shuáibu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Baraka Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising hand in the photo is Joyce, a member of Baraka women group. She is thirty four years old, married and a mother of six. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014.
She does maize, potatoes, poultry and beans farming as her main business. She is grateful for Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s training on enterprise and records keeping that has enabled her to manage the business perfectly. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy quality seeds, pesticides and fertilizer so that she can increase her output and in return increase her profits from improved sales. This will assist her cater for school fees and general upkeep for the family
She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy quality seeds, pesticides and fertilizer to increase output and  profits to enable her pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Ndengelika Small Bussines Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is called Samuel. He is 64 years old, married and blessed with 5 children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from the training especially enterprise development.

He practices mixed farming; i.e dairy and vegetable/crop farming. He is borrowing Kiva loan so as to buy dairy feeds and certified vegetable seeds to boost production of both vegetables and milk. This will enable him get earn more profits which he plans to use by buying a water harvesting tank and also provide better food to his family.

Samuel is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. He promises to repay the loans well.

loans.use: to buy dairy feeds and certified vegetables seeds hence boost production and use increased profits to buy a water harvesting tank.

loans.name: Waka

texts.en:
Waka is a maize farmer from Makwalla village. As a Babban Gona member, Waka is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Waka would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Waka will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Waka no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Waka hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Baraka Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising hand in the photo is Hannah, a member of Baraka women group. She is fifty five years old, married and a mother of seven. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014.
She does maize and beans farming as her main business. She is grateful to Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s training on enterprise and financial management that has enabled her to manage the business well. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy quality fertilizer so that she can increase her output and in return increase her profits from improved sales. This will assist her cater for her upkeep.
She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy quality fertilizer so that she can increase her output and in return increase her profits

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is a 24 years old with 2 children, she runs a small business of selling ice cake in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this last year. Theresa requested for a loan to buy a sack of sugar, plastic bags, ice bag, coolio, to help her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business in her community. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sack of sugar, plastic bags, ice bag, coolio,

loans.name: Vaelua

texts.en: Vaelua is a 37 year old woman with 4 children. She owns and operates a small business of selling elei printing materials at the market to earn a living. Vaelua requested for a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, elei design, containers, printing machine, to assist her run the business. She will expand her business using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, elei design, containers, printing machine,

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
The woman in the picture is Agnes. She operates her own sari-sari store (a Filipino-coined term for a small variety store) for a living. The store is occupying a small space of their humble house in Iloilo. Operating for many years now, she has managed to keep the business running and growing.

At some point, she experiences lack in needed capital to buy her products because she would have to compromise her fund to pay their bills. Instead of buying groceries, she would have to consider the household needs first, what they have to eat for the day, the payment for the electricity and water, etc. There are also instances when neighbors would not pay their credits on time causing her business to suffer.

Agnes has been faithful in her responsibilities and once again she is knocking on the hearts of the ever supportive lenders. By borrowing a supporting capital, she believes this could resolve her inadequacies in business. She hopes to improve her inventory by adding more grocery items like assorted biscuits, sacks of rice, beverages, cooking oil and other common commodities. She is applying for a loan amount of Php 10,000 and praying that her request will be granted. She promised to use the amount for the said purpose and pay it back to the best of her ability.

She wanted to increase more her sales and expand her store in the next few years. She is a faithful member of Center for Community Transformation. Microentrepreneurs, like Agnes, are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 members. They meet on weekly basis to share the goodness of God in their lives and their experiences on the very unique work of transformation that CCT offers.

loans.use: to buy more supplies to enhance her variety store

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a married woman, 59 years old with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Delia has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines. Delia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear like dress, t-shirts, shorts and other ready-to-wear items to sell.

Delia has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready-to-wear like dress, t-shirts, shorts and other items to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like buy and sell fruits and vegetables.

Marites dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: With the previous loan that Robert acquired, he used it to buy more shoes to sell. He is still in the same business of shoe selling and at the same time growing bananas on a large scale. He started these businesses since 2008 with a hope of creating an income for his family. In future he hopes of increasing on his sources of income though he is challenged by less capital and competition. Robert has asked for a loan to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela is 38 years old, married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Shiela has borrowed and paid back 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for 11 years and also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Fe works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Fe is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna is from Masis village with her mother-in-law, husband (in the photo) and two children both of which attending school. 
Ruzanna and her husband have been involved in farming for many years. They cultivate pepper and tomato which they sell at the local market. 
Farming business is vital for this nice family's living and they work hard to manage covering family's increasing costs. 
Ruzanna requested this loan to purchase  fertilizer and seeds for land cultivation and cover greenhouse renovation costs, purchase polyethylene cover for it. 
This family hopes to receive your support and develop their farming business.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and seeds for land cultivation and cover greenhouse renovation costs, purchase polyethylene cover for it

loans.name: Umar

texts.en:
Umar is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Umar has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Umar would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Umar can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Umar will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Umar is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is 29 years old, she is married and she a business women. She is applying for a loan of $ 1.000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop of her business. Leonisa has been involving in business activities a few years ago, she started with her own working capital. She is earning a good income from selling her business because she live near many people, so they come to buy in her every day. So she is still happy to do her business.

She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more additional supplies to keep in her store including candies, shampoo, nuts, eggs, candle, salts, coffee, cooking oils, milks, sugar including soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.use: To buy candies, shampoo, nuts, eggs, candle, salts, coffee, cooking oils, milks, sugar including soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Thanh Yen 13 Group

texts.en: Mrs. Hong is 50-year-old Thai ethnic lady who lives with her husband and her son in an old house at a remote village where she works at agricultural production to earn a living. Indeed, Mrs. Hong and her husband work very hard with plenty of activities of farming and breeding such as cultivating rice, corn, raising cow, pig, chicken, and duck. This is the fourth time that she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program and she will use the loan to buy piglets and food for the pigs. She hopes that the pigs will grow fast and healthily, then help her reap good income. Mrs. Hong dreams that her family will have a more abundant and stable life. In the picture, she stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy piglets and food for the pigs

loans.name: Hamisu

texts.en:
Hamisu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Hamisu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Hamisu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Hamisu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Hamisu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Hamisu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets for her fishing business.

Nenita has been in this business for 11 years. Nenita earns additional income from buying and selling fish.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Henilyn

texts.en:
Henilyn is 20 years old and single with two children. With one child in school, Henilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Henilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell including canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, snack foods, soap, shampoo and other personal care products.

Henilyn has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future Henilyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell including canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, snack foods, soap, shampoo and other personal care products.

loans.name: Danila

texts.en:
Danila is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Danila is 48 years old and has one child still in school.

Danila has a business buying and selling crabs in the Philippines. Danila requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more crabs and shrimp to sell to her customers.

Danila has been in this business for 12 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more crabs and shrimp to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina lives in Luquisa. She is married and she has one child.

A $700 loan is offered to Cristina to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as eggs, aqua, biscuits, detergents, soaps, noodles, sardines, candies, lighters, soft drinks and other things to sell.

She has been involving herself in business activities for a few years, with her own working capital. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Cristina independent because she can be responsible for family.

She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy eggs, aqua, biscuits, detergents, soaps, noodles, sardines, candies, lighters, soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio lives in Liquica and most of his daily income is from selling chickens. He is now applying for a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve his business.

Antonio started his business a few years ago with his own working capital. He will use this loan to add to his principal amount to buy more chickens, because it has become his activity. When he finishes selling his chickens, he will go to another place to buy more chickens, after that he will bring them back to resell in the market.

He is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for his business because it can support him to keep up his spirits.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Didier Sebastian

texts.es:
Didier es un joven empresario de 22 años de edad que persigue un sueño desde hace un tiempo el cual es, la libertad financiera, siempre ha sido muy independiente y lo poco que tiene lo ha luchado y trabajado, pero cree que es el momento de forjar un camino en solitario y para ello necesita tu ayuda pus quiere iniciar un negocio de taller de mecánica automotriz.
El monto de dinero es equivalente a la cantidad de equipo y maquinaria que necesita para prestar un excelente servicio, su propósito final es conseguir sus propios activos como lo son; casa, carro, etc.
texts.en:
Didier is a young 22 year old businessman who is pursuing a dream which will provide financial freedom. He has always been very independent and the little that he has he has fought for and worked for. But, he believes that it is time to forge a solo career and to accomplish this he needs your help because he wants to begin an auto mechanic business.

The amount of money is equivalent to the quantity of equipment and machinery that he needs to provide excellent services. His end goal is to obtain his own assets such as a house, a car, etc.

loans.use: to start a workshop for an auto mechanic business.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is 50 years old, married with six children, four of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, coffee, milk, etc.

Diana has borrowed and paid back 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from tailoring.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, coffee, milk.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a married woman, 56 years old with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Gemma has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Gemma requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish, salt, fish nets, bamboo and other materials for her business.

Gemma has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish, salt, fish nets, bamboo and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Nelson De Jesus

texts.es:
A sus 58 años de edad el señor Nelson continuo con sus ganas de trabajar y su espíritu intacto, él siempre se ha caracterizado por ser un hombre independiente que busca su propio camino y a lo largo de su vida ha obtenido buenos logros tales su vivienda y sigue trabajando para llevar el alimento diario a su hogar, donde lo espera su pareja e hijos.
Hablando un poco de la profesión, es un hombre que se dedica a podar campos, su principal herramienta es la guadañadora y este el motivo que lo lleva a solicitar un préstamo ya que la suya está averiada y quiere comprar una más potente para mejorar su operatividad.
Su objetivo es tener el capital para pagar la educación de sus muchachos y salud para trabajar.
texts.en:
At 58 years old, Nelson continues with his desire to work and his spirit intact. He has always been characterized as an independent man who seeks his own path and throughout his life he has gotten good results, such as a house, and he continues working to bring daily food to his household, where his partner and children await him.

Speaking a bit about his profession, he is a man who works mowing grass, his primary tool is a weed trimmer and this is the reason that he comes to ask for a loan since his is broken down and he wants to purchase a stronger one to improve his effectiveness.

His objective is to have the capital to pay for his children's education and the health to work.

loans.use: to purchase a stronger weed trimmer.

loans.name: Leidy Patricia

texts.es:
Leidy es una persona responsable, luchadora, una mujer que no tiene límites para alcanzar sus sueños, ella inicio hace un tiempo un negocio de venta de mercancía, principalmente ropa, lo hizo por necesidad económica,
Leidy es madre de un pequeño de 10 años de edad, toda su vida gira en torno a él, quien es su motivación, su motor de vida y por su niño es que quiere superarse y convertirse en una gran empresaria, tener buenas utilidades y en un futuro comprar una vivienda propia.
Leidy actualmente se encuentra buscando una ayuda monetaria para la compra de ropa femenina, principalmente blusas y pantalones ya que quiere diversificar su oferta y ofrecer a la comunidad ropa ejecutiva y acorde a un trabajo de oficina.
texts.en:
Leidy is a responsible person and a hard worker. She is a woman who is limitless in accomplishing her dreams. A while ago, Leidy began a business selling merchandise, primarily clothing. She did this out of economic necessity.

Leidy is the mother of a little boy who is 10 years old. All of her life revolves around him. He is her motivation and her life's engine. It is because of her son that she wants to get ahead and become a great businesswoman, to obtain great profits, and in the future, to purchase her own home.

Currently, Leidy is looking for monetary support to purchase women's clothing, primarily blouses and pants, because she wants to diversify her offerings and to offer executive clothing to the community consistent with an office job.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothing, primarily blouses and pants.

loans.name: William Ernesto

texts.es:
Él es William un empresario forjado en el campo, persona luchadora y pujante que se levanta a primer hora del día a ordeñar sus vacas y sacar el líquido con el que elabora productos lácteos, gracias a esta actividad genera el sustento para su familia, es el pilar económico de su hogar, por él es que comen y pueden pagar los servicios básicos.
William se caracteriza por ser una persona honrada y honesta, es muy correcto y seria en su trabajo.
Actualmente el empresario está en etapa de crecimiento y necita algunos activos que apoyen dicho crecimiento, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de un congelador y utensilios, buscando principalmente almacenar mayor cantidad de alimentos.
texts.en:
William is a businessman forged in the fields. He is a feisty and forceful person who gets up at the first hour of the day to milk his cows and to take the liquid to make milk products. Thanks to this activity, he generates sustenance for his family. It is the economic pillar of his household. It is because of him that they eat and can pay for basic services.

William is characterized by being an honorable and honest person. He is very exact and serious in his work. Currently, this businessman is in a period of growth and he needs certain assets to support this growth. Because of this he wants to obtain a loan to purchase a freezer and tools, seeking primarily to stock up on a larger quantity of foods.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer and tools, he is primarily seeking to stock up on a larger quantity of food.

loans.name: Andres Felipe

texts.es:
A pesar de su juventud Andrés ha mostrado mucha madurez al asumir el roll de hombre de la casa, tiene 24 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, es un gran trabajador que está levantado a primera hora del día, ordeña y alimenta a sus vacas, un hombre en verdad trabajador que tiene trazado su camino y espera que al final pueda cumplir su sueño de comprar una vivienda propia y compartir todos sus logros con su amada familia.
Andrés busca un apoyo económico para la compra de vacas para la producción de leche, quiere aprovechar de mejor manera su terreno y aumentar su producción tanto como le sea posible,
texts.en:
Despite his youth, Andrés has shown a lot of maturity in taking on the roll of the man of the house. He is 24 years old, single, and doesn't have children. He is a hard worker who is getting up at the first light of day, milking and feeding his cows, a true working man who has established a path and hopes that at the end he will be able to achieve his dream of purchasing his own house and sharing all his successes with his beloved family.

Andrés looks for economic support to purchase cows to produce milk. He wants to take best advantage of his land and expand his production as much as possible.

loans.use: to purchase cows to expand his production.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic, 53, is a married woman with six children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marivic has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years.

Marivic requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish net, bamboo, and gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish net, bamboo and gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Hylene

texts.en:
Hylene, 32, is a married woman with three children who are all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Hylene has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years

Hylene requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish to sell in her stall.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Miss Van is 27 years old. There are five people in her family. She also has a daily income from her garden from things such as chickens, ducks and vegetables.

With this loan, she can build a hygienic latrine to improve the living conditions and health of her family. She is able to repay the loan monthly with support from her husband.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Corazones Felices (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
El Grupo de Crédito Corazones Felices está formado por 11 señoras y 1 señor que decidieron unirse tiempo atrás  y formar este grupo con el cual les ha servido para mejorar  sus negocios y su calidad de vida, ellos se dedican a diversas actividades.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Martha, tiene 35 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 12  y 4 años de edad, ambos estudian en  colegio y escuela. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Matha  es una mujer que le gusta trabajar por el bien de su familia, ella tiene un pequeño deposito en su casa donde vende colas, aguas, cervezas, hielos y otras bebidas, su marido le ayuda cuando está desocupado de sus actividades, él entrega  a domicilio cuando sus clientes lo requieren, lleva 9 años dedicada a esta actividad la cual ha podido mejorar gracias a la ayuda de los créditos, ella  está muy agradecida con la institución.
Este crédito es para surtir mas su depósito va a comprar colas, jugos, aguas y cervezas para brindar una buena atención a sus clientes. Lleva 9 años en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda para ella. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The ‘Corazones Felices’ credit group comprises 11 ladies and 1 gentleman who, long ago, decided to form this group which has helped them to improve their businesses and their quality of life. They all work in different areas of business.

One member of this group is Martha, 35, who is in a civil partnership. Her husband is a chauffeur, and together they have two children aged 12 and 4 years, both study at college and school.

Martha is a woman who likes to work for the good of her family. She has a small store in her house where she sells cola, water, beer, ice and other drinks. Her husband helps her out when he isn’t busy with work and he delivers the goods to customer’s homes when they need it. Martha has been doing this job for 9 years and has been able to improve thanks to the help of loans, she is very grateful to the Field Partner.

This loan will be used to stock her store; she will buy cola, juice, water, and beer to provide her customers with good choice. She has been a member of the credit group for 9 years and likes it because the loans really help her. Martha’s dream is to get ahead and provide her children with the best.

loans.use: to buy cola, juice, water, and beer.

loans.name: Ánh

texts.en:
Mrs Ánh is 19 years old and she is married. She has been operating a food stall selling fish for 5 years. Ánh lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her household was recognized by local government as poor, moreover the market need is low in this region. And the income from this business is not high enough to do what she really needs to add comfort to her life.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet.

This is Ánh first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could make her little dream come true. In the future, Ánh hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Phương

texts.en:
Mrs Phương is 27 years old and she is married. She has been operating a food stall selling fish for 5 years. Phương lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her household was recognized by local government as poor, moreover the market need is low in this region. And the income from this business is not high enough to do what she really needs to add comfort to her life.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet.

In 2013, Phương joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Phương has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. In the future, Phương hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda, 46, is a widowed woman with two children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Imelda has a dried-fish business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years.

Imelda requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma works hard to support her family. Norma is married and sells shell crafts in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 29 years now.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional shell crafts to sell.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional shell crafts to sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Myrna is 41 years old and has one child still in school.

Myrna has a fishing business in the Philippines. Myrna requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Myrna has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Nilly

texts.en:
Nilly is 58 years old and widowed with four children. Nilly works very hard to provide for them.

Nilly runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, snack foods, soap, shampoo and other personal care products.

Nilly has been in this business for 6 years.

In the future Nilly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, snack foods, soap, shampoo and other personal care products.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 52 years old and married with three children. Two children are currently in school and Rosalie works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell including canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, snack foods, soap, shampoo and other personal care products.

Rosalie has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future Rosalie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell including canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, snack foods, soap, shampoo and other personal care products.

loans.name: Luduvina

texts.en:
Luduvina is married and she is a businesswoman.

She started with a small kiosk, because she wanted try to get income so that she could help her husband to be responsible for her family. She has been involved in business activities since 2015, with her own working capital, and she is doing her best.

She started with a small store so she is requesting a loan of $ 1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her working capital to buy additional items to keep in her store including sugar, salts, cooking oils, cigarettes, noodles, balm, pens and other things to sell. She will improve her business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salts, cooking oils, cigarettes, noodles, balm, pens and other things to sell.

loans.name: Madalena

texts.en:
Madalena is a business women and she has a small kiosk, so she is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business.

She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as rice, sugar, noodles, cooking oils, candies, glue and other things to sell. Madalena started her kiosk a few years ago, with her own working capital of $100.

She is happy with the loan that is offered by Tuba Rai Metin allowing her to have more working capital to buy more goods. She will keep the spirit to run her business with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, noodles, cooking oils, candies, glue and other things to sell.

loans.name: Metropolitana (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Grupo de Crédito Metropolitana. Este es un grupo de 10 mujeres y 2 hombres que decidieron unirse tiempo atrás y formar este Grupo que les ha servido de mucho ya que con los créditos han podido mejorar sus pequeños negocios. Ellos se dedican a diversas actividades tales como agricultura, comercio en general, servicios, entre otras actividades.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Zumilda, tiene 55 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció  y de esta relación tiene 8 hijos mayores de edad, dos  de ellos aun viven con ella.
Doña Zumilda es una mujer que le ha tocado trabajar para salir adelante, ella se dedica a la venta de artesanías, se desplaza por la ciudad y otras parroquias donde tiene muchos clientes  que siempre le compran sus productos, ella compra a un sitio que se llama la Pila lugar en el cual muchos artesanos se dedican a elaborar todo tipo de  artesanías en muchos tamaños y diseños,  ella  lleva más de 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual le permite ganarse la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar artesanías en muchos modelos. Esta desde el inicio  en  el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y gozar de buena salud.
La foto pequeña es de un socio y una socia que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Metropolitana credit group meets every fortnight in the town of Portoviejo. The group comprises 10 women and 2 men who formed this group which has helped them to improve their small businesses thanks to the loans. They all work in different areas of business such as agriculture, general commerce, services and other activities.

One member of this group is Zumilda, 55, who is a widow and mother to 8 adult children, 2 of whom still live with her. Zumilda is a woman who has had to work in order to get ahead. She makes a living selling handicrafts, and travels around the city and other areas where she has many customers who buy her products. She bought a space called La Pila where many craftsmen produce a variety of handicrafts in all shapes and sizes. Zumilda has been making a living doing this for over 2 years now.

This loan will be used to buy various handicrafts. Zumilda has been a member of the credit group since the beginning and she likes it because the loans allow her to finance her business. Her dream is to get ahead and to remain healthy.

The small photo is of two members who could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts.

loans.name: Vicitacion

texts.en:
Vicitacion is 66 years old and widowed with two children. With one child still in school, Vicitacion works very hard to provide for them.

Vicitacion runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, snack foods, soap, shampoo and other personal care products.

Vicitacion has been in this business for 30 years.

In the future Vicitacion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell including canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, snack foods, soap, shampoo and other personal care products.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa, 37, is a married woman with three children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jesusa has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Jesusa requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish net, bamboo and gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish net, bamboo and gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Gulhermina

texts.en:
Gulhermina is requesting a loan of $1,500 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional supplies to keep in her store, including rice, aqua, cooking oils, cigarettes, biscuits, candles, salts, sugar, sardines, milks, detergents, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell.

She has been doing business since 2010 with her own working capital of $500. She is earning a good income, but she is taking this loan because she wants to open a big store in the future so she wants to manage it well to improve her business.

She is happy with the loan offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy rice, aqua, cooking oils, cigarettes, biscuits, candles, salts, sugar, sardines, milks, detergents, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Mrs. Hanh is a hardworking woman. She is 33 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in a small house and without a hygienic latrine.

Her family’s income is mainly from husbandry and business. She would like to borrow a loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family members.

With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Hongbing

texts.en:
Hongbing is a 46-year-old woman, who was suffering from incompatibility with her husband. She divorced her husband two years ago. Now she raises her daughter alone.

Hongbing has been involved in a garment processing business for almost 21 years. The payment is meager, and so she can only just make ends meet in her domestic life. She lives with her older sister at present in order to save the house rent. Last year, her daughter went to college; the tuition has come out of their savings. She has had a very hard life.

Hongbing requested 12,000 CNY from Microcred because her daughter needs a large amount of money to pay the tuition fees. She wants to use part of the money to support her daughter to finish her school. And the rest of the money will be used to stock materials for her business.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees and to stock materials.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Marissa earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, coffee, etc. for her general store business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Linde

texts.en:
Linde is 44 years old and married. She has one child who is still in school. Linde works very hard to provide for her family.

Linde runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Linde requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, snack foods, soap, shampoo and personal care products.

Linde would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, snack foods, soap, shampoo and personal care products.

loans.name: Tukad Kemiri Group

texts.en:
Ni Nyoman was able to repay the previous loans on time. During six months of raising pigs, Ni Nyoman enjoyed satisfactory results. Ni Nyoman used the net gain from pig sales for the children's education and for her family.

The group hopes to continue their loan, and they say thank you to lenders, Kiva and MUK for supporting their businesses.

Now, besides being a farmer, Ni Nyoman has a new activity of raising pigs. In this way, Ni Nyoman has a higher income than the time before she raised pigs. The breeding process goes well without any obstacles. The advantage of raising pigs is that they can be used to pay for everyday family needs.

To increase the population of pigs, the Tukad Kemiri group decided to have another loan from MUK. This loan will be used to buy superior or local piglets and feed and also to renovate the cage.

Ni Nyoman will use her loan to purchase the local type piglets used for pig barbeque. She will keep the pigs for six months until they reach the maximum weight. Now the price for 1kg of pig is between 15,000 IDR and 18,000 IDR, depending on the quality of the meat. Ni Nyoman hopes that in this period she will earn enough profit. This time she will save all the profit.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets to raise and sell.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is 50 years old, married with nine children, two of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional canned goods, eggs, soft drinks, chips, etc. to sell.

Esperanza has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 24 years and also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables, fruits and charcoal.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, eggs, soft drinks and chips, etc, to sell.

loans.name: April Joy

texts.en:
April Joy, 29 years of age, is a resident from the town of Tolosa, Leyte. She is a hard working woman.
She is married and has three young children.

She engages in a rice retailing business. She caters to customers, mostly neighbors, in her place.
Her partner, who is a laborer, has income that would be a great help to defray the family's daily expenses.

She needs funds to improve her business. She would like to buy more sacks of rice. With these, she could able to have an adequate supply to avoid a shortage.

Slowly, April Joy would start to settle her obligations and continue to provide for the needs of her children.

In the future, she is looking forward to have a stable source of income to support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Amy is 38 years old and has one child still in school.

Amy has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 4,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy assorted fish to sell.

Amy has been in this business for two years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted fish to sell

loans.name: Oniver Enrique

texts.es:
Oniver es un hombre muy organizado, centrado en sus propósitos, en su familia y en su trabajo, se dedica a la cría de ganado porcino, tiene sus porquerizas muy bien organizadas, en excelente estado de salubridad y bien distribuidas.
Trabaja todos los días, sus metas son expandirse, tener sostenibilidad, aumentar su cantidad de inventario y obtener mejores recursos para mejorar su negocio y su vivienda.
Oniver es consciente que la temporada navideña está próxima y quiere tener su negocio bien abastecido para atender la demanda, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar alimento de engorde de cerdos, cerdos y un producto para realizar inseminación artificial.
texts.en:
Oniver is a very organised man who is focused on his goals, his family and his work. He makes a living raising pigs and has very organised and well-distributed pigpens that are in excellent sanitary conditions. He works every day; his goals are to expand his business, to have sustainability and to increase his inventory and acquire better resources to improve his business and home.

Oniver is aware that the Christmas season is coming and he wants to have his business well stocked to meet demand. It is for this reason that he is requesting a loan to buy food for fattening pigs, pigs, and a product for artificial insemination.

loans.use: to buy food for fattening pigs, pigs, and a product for artificial insemination.

loans.name: Aurina Rosa

texts.es:
Las personas del campo y las zonas de postconflicto son sectores en ocasiones muy descuidados incluso por el gobierno, son sectores  a los que trata de llegar la corporación Interactuar a ofrecer sus servicios y extenderle la mano a estas personas que con trabajo honesto quiere cambiar la imagen de su municipio, una de ellas es Rosa, una mujer luchadora que se dedica a la cría de ganado porcino, con la cual junto con su esposo ha sacado adelante a su familia conformada por ellos y sus 5 hijos.
Buscando tener sostenibilidad de su negocio, seguir con su tradicional venta de animales y mejorar sus ingresos la señora Rosa quiere solicitar un préstamo, para la compra de cerdos, alimento y vacunas.
texts.en:
The countryside and areas previously affected by the conflict in Colombia are often neglected, even by the government. Interactuar tries to get to these areas in order to offer its services and to lend a hand to those who do honest work and who want to change the image of their municipalities.

One such person is Rosa, a plucky woman who makes a living raising pigs. Working together with her husband, this business has helped Rosa's family - made up of the couple and their five children - to move forward.

Looking to make her business more sustainable, to continue with the sale of animals, and to increase her income, Rosa is applying for a loan in order to buy pigs, feed and vaccinations.

loans.use: to buy pigs, feed and vaccinations and to continue with her business.

loans.name: Aizhan

texts.ru: Айжан, 45 лет, в разводе, есть сын. У Айжан высшее образование, она преподаватель. На протяжении 10 лет Айжан занимается животноводством. Сегодня в хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 27 овец. Ежемесячный доход Айжан составляет в среднем 21,000 сомов (KGS). Айжан очень трудолюбива и ответственна. Она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS), на который она купит бычков для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита позволят Айжан увеличить ее хозяйство и дать достойное образование сыну.
texts.en: Aizhan is 45 years old, divorced, and has a son. Aizhan has a higher education. She is a teacher. Aizhan has been rearing animals for 10 years. Today she has four cows and 27 sheep. Aizhan's monthly income averages 21,000 som (KGS). Aizhan is very hard-working and responsible. She has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) with which she will buy some steers for fattening and resale. The proceeds of the loan will permit Aizhan to increase her farm and give her son a decent education.

loans.use: to purchase some steers for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Emilia Maria

texts.es:
Emilia es una mujer de 67 años de edad, una persona cariñosa, respetuosa y luchadora, se separó de su esposo quien era el pilar económico del hogar, quedando sola, aunque sus hijos le ayudan mucho, ella no se podía quedar atrás y así monto un negocio de venta de alimentos usando los implementos de su cocina.
Ahora Emilia para generar mayores recursos necesita producir mayor cantidad de alimentos por ello quiere solicitar un dinero para la compra de una olla grande, vajilla, mesa, vitrina, surtido de refrescos, agua entre otros.
texts.en:
Emilia is 67 years old. She is a loving, respectful, and hardworking person. She is separated from her husband, who was the economic pillar of their household. She was left on her own, and although her children have helped her a lot, she didn't want to fall behind, so she opened a business selling food that she prepares using the tools she has in her kitchen.

Now Emilia needs to produce a greater quantity of food in order to generate more income. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy a large pot, utensils, a table, a display case, an assortment of soft drinks and water, among other things.

loans.use: to buy a large pot, utensils, a table, a display case, an assortment of soft drinks and water, among other things.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is a 48-year-old married woman with three children; two children are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Annabelle has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines. Annabelle requested a PHP 6500 loan amount through NWTF to buy assorted dried fish to sell to her customers.

Annabelle has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted dried fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Maria Petrona

texts.es:
Ella es María es una mujer sonriente que disfruta su vida, la cual se dedica a trabajar como empleada doméstica, pero quiere iniciar una vida como independiente sin descuidar su empleo, pues busca recursos para mejorar su condición de vida y comprar una vivienda.
Ella nació en una familia pobre, pero esto no quiere decir que este destinada a una vida de bajos recursos y considera que tiene todas las facultades para salir adelante y ser exitosa, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de productos de uso personal, cosméticos, aseo domésticos, ropa y toda la venderá por encargos.
texts.en:
María is a smiling woman who enjoys her life. She works as a domestic employee, but wishes to start an independent life without ignoring her job. She is looking for resources to improve her living conditions and purchase a home.

She was born to a poor family, but this does not mean that she was destined for a life with scarce resources. She believes that she has what it takes to move forward and be successful, so she is requesting a loan to purchase personal care products, cosmetics, toiletries, and clothing, which she will sell as ordered by her customers.

loans.use: to purchase personal care products, cosmetics, toiletries, and clothing, which she sells per order.

loans.name: Sreymul

texts.en: Sreymul is a 25-year-old married factory worker with a young child in her care. She has worked in the factory since 2012. Her husband is a 27-year-old construction foreman. They live in Kampong Chhnang Province of Cambodia. Both Sreymul and her husband can earn around USD 15 each day. She lacks the finances to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work and family use, therefore is requesting a loan. With the motorcycle from the loan, her family will be able to have better traveling condition and reduce traveling expanses. For her future plans, she is going to save money to build a new proper house and send her child to school.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work and family use

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional spare parts for the maintenance for her motorcycle transport business.

Marilyn has been in this business for 10 years. Marilyn earns more income from buy and sell rice.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of five children, Belen works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. She is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy assorted dried fish to sell.
