Belen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted dried fish to sell

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
Thy’s Group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia.

Thy makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as a tailor to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses, and to save time by not having to collect fuel and boil water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is applying for a loan of $600.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a big store, so she is taking this loan to improving her management for her business. She started to do this business a few year ago, with her own working capital of $500.00. Juliana is earning a good income from her business because many people come to buy in her store. She is taking a loan because she wants use to buy more items such as hand/body cream, candies, eggs, biscuits, toothpaste,  cigarettes, noodles, milk, sugar, coffee, soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Maria Balvanera

texts.es:
Mejorar sus ventas incrementar su utilidad, mejorar sus ventas, tener sostenibilidad en su negocio, mejorar su infraestructura son los objetivos que la señora María se trazó en su finca, donde ofrece varios empleos y se dedica a la cría de pollos, cerdos, ganado, tiene caballos, campos de cultivos, todo ello lo forjó con su familia, trabajando arduas jornadas laborales y ahora ve los frutos de su trabajo, se siente feliz, orgullosa de todo lo que ha logrado, es un verdadero ejemplo de superación personal y es muy humilde, acepta que necesito de mucha ayuda para llegar donde está.
Este es uno de esos momentos donde ella necesita de todos ustedes para seguir por su buen rumbo y hacer crecer mucho más su terreno.
Necesita comprar alimento para sus animales en grandes cantidades, tiene una buena oportunidad de negocio, los puede obtener por un excelente precio, considerando que el precio del dólar actualmente está muy elevado, por ello será fundamental para su economía cerrar este negocio, el resto del capital será destinado a la compra de una cerda de cría para aumentar la producción de cerdos, siendo acordes con la temporada navideña que se aproxima.
texts.en:
Maria's goals are to increase her sales, increase her income, make her business sustainable, and improve her equipment. Maria's farm provides various jobs and is where she raises chickens, pigs, and cattle. She has horses and fields, and created it all with her family. She worked difficult shifts and is now seeing the fruits of her labor. She is proud of all that she has accomplished. It is a true example of personal improvement. Maria is very humble and recognizes that she needed a lot of help to get to where she is.

This is one of those moments where she needs help to continue on her path and grow her business. She needs to purchase food in large quantities for her animals. She has a good business opportunity and can purchase it at an excellent price, considering that the price of the dollar is currently very high. Closing this deal is fundamental for her business. She will use the rest of the capital to purchase a new pig to raise so that she can increase her pork production in preparation for the upcoming Christmas season.

loans.use: to purchase food for all of her animals and to purchase a pig to raise.

loans.name: Baby Jean

texts.en:
Baby Jean is 20 years old and married with three children, two children are presently in school, Baby Jean works very hard to provide for them.

Baby Jean runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, spices, juice and etc.

Baby Jean has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future Baby Jean would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, spices, and juice.

loans.name: Nellie

texts.en:
Nellie is 56 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like can goods, egg, soap, shampoo, etc.

Nellie has been in this business for 11 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like can goods, egg, soap, and shampoo.

loans.name: Xiaobing

texts.en:
Xiaobing is a 27-year-old man who opened a haircut shop more than ten years ago. He is very smart and hardworking so that he uses his time well and learns more professional skills.

This year, his second child was born, so he is dealing with the financial pressure of raising two children and also they finished the house upgrade which cost a large amount of money. The market environment is not very good, the cloth store he opened four months ago didn’t earn much money to support his domestic needs.

Xiaobing requested ￥20,000RMB in MicroCred. He has prepaid his first loan and requested again. He needs the money to purchase barbershop materials including shampoos and skincare products.

He believes that they could have a better life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase materials including shampoos and skincare products for his barbershop.

loans.name: Chres's Group

texts.en: Chres’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Chres works as farmer and he also does extra work as factory laborer and house maker to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en: Srey’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Srey works as farmer and she also does extra work as factory laborer construction worker and driver to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Shithan's Group

texts.en: Shithan’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Shithan makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Carmenza

texts.es:
Ella es Carmenza una persona alegre y simpática de 53 años de edad, es casada y madre de 3 muchachos todos ellos mayores de edad, se dedica a la elaboración de un alimento típico en la región Antioqueña la cual es la arepa, un producto hecho de maíz.
Carmenza siempre ha realizado su profesión de una manera tradicional, moliendo con su propio esfuerzo el maíz, siempre había querido un molino eléctrico para reducir esfuerzo y mejorar su operatividad pero no contaba con los recursos necesarios, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo que tiene como principal objetivo facilitar su vida.
El dinero será para la compra de un molino eléctrico y maíz en grandes cantidades, ella espera que con el aumento de producción pueda tener mejores ingresos para aportar en su hogar y ayudar a sus hijos en lo que necesiten.
texts.en:
Carmenza is a happy, kind woman who is 53 years old. She is married and has three adult children. She makes a living by making arepas, a food made from corn that is typical to the Antioquia region of Colombia. Carmenza has always prepared her food traditionally, grinding the corn by hand, but she has always wanted an electric mill to reduce the effort required and increase productivity. However, she hasn't had enough money to purchase one.

She requests a loan, which will primarily be used to make her life easier. She will use the loan to purchase an electric mill and large quantities of corn. She hopes to increase her production and, in turn, earn more money to support her family and children.

loans.use: to purchase an electric mill and large quantities of corn.

loans.name: Sophos's Group

texts.en:
Sophos’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Sophos makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Sireen

texts.en:
Sireen is 31-year-old woman from Jabalia City, married and mother to one little son.
Sireen was living with her family in a small humble house, but during the latest war on Gaza her house destroyed completely, so then she had to rent a small apartment in the same area.

Recently Sireen took a USD loan from Palestine for credit and Development (FATEN) in order to rebuild her old house. The loan will allow Sireen to finalize the needed construction in a short time and return her family to their normal life.
Sireen appears in the photo.

loans.use: rebuild her old house which was destroyed by war

loans.name: Carolyn Rose

texts.en:
Carolyn Rose is a married woman with five children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Carolyn Rose is 34 years old.

Carolyn Rose has a business making dried fish in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 3,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of salt, fish, bamboo, fish net and other materials for her business.

Carolyn Rose has been in this business for two years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of salt, fish, bamboo, fish net and other materials for her business

loans.name: Nestan

texts.en:
Nestan is 33 years old married woman. She lives in Khelvachauri district with her husband and 3 children. Her husband is a driver and generates small monthly income. Nestan works at local bakery and has a monthly wage of 200 GEL.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 3000 GEL. With the received credit Nestan will renovate a flat and will rent it out. After that she will generate stable income and will be able to improve the living conditions for her 3 children.
Nestan hopes that the business will be profitable and awaits your support.

loans.use: to renovate a flat and rent it out in order to increase family income

loans.name: Wada

texts.en:
Wada is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Wada has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Wada would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Wada can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Wada will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Wada is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Hussaini

texts.en:
Hussaini is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Hussaini has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Hussaini would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Hussaini can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

a Babban Gona member, Hussaini will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Hussaini is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Ahmad Alhaji

texts.en:
Ahmad is maize farmer from Sabon Gari village. As a member of Babban Gona, Ahmad is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the oppotrtunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ahmad would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ahmad can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Ahmad is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Savuth's Group

texts.en:
Savuth’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Savuth makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a tailor to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Namirembe Hill School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Fred. He is the Head teacher of Namirembe Hill School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Namirembe in Kampala with 300 students. Namirembe Hill School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Namirembe Hill School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Fred ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.pt: O Senhor  Manuel é casado vive na casa propria,ainda não tem filhos mas cuida de um irmão mais novo e este estuda,trabalha num centro infantil como professor ja a bastante tempo mas este afirma que sua vida não muda para o melhor apesar de estar a trabalhar, isto porque o salario não cobre com as despesas.Tentou iniciar  uma obra de raiz mais teve que parar porque não tinha mais recursos  para cotinuar foi então que aproximou se da Hluvuku e solicitou o emprestimo para compra de barotes,portas e janelas para dar continuidade com a sua obra.O seu maior sonho é manter como professor mas crescer profissionalmente.O seu maior desafio é a formação academica.
texts.en: Manuel is married and lives in his own house. He doesn’t have children yet but he takes care of a younger brother who is in school. He has worked for a long time as a teacher at a daycare center but he says that his life doesn’t change for the better despite this work because his salary doesn’t cover his expenses. He tried to start a construction project but had to stop because he didn’t have the resources to continue. That was when he approached Hluvuku to request a loan to purchase beams, doors, and windows to continue the construction. His biggest dream is to keep working as a teacher but grow professionally. His biggest challenge is to get academic training.

loans.use: to purchase beams, doors, and windows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron bars, and stone.

loans.name: Arlinda

texts.pt: A Senhora Arlinda vive maritalmente com o seu esposo,  é  mãe de 1 filha menor,ainda  vai a escola,cuida tambem de duas sobrinhas orfãos de pai e mãe que tambem vão a escola .Ela trabalha como motorista de um dos  hospitais da Cidade de Maputo,o esposo tambem trabalha como professor e eles ganham pouco. O salario não tem sido suficiente para cobrir com as despesas da obra da reabilitação da sua casa,sendo assim viu a necessidade de solicitar um emprestimo na Hluvuku para comprar  cimento,pedra,areia e varrões de ferro.O seu maior sonho  é adequerir uma viatura pessoal.
texts.en: Arlinda and her partner are not married but live together. She has one young daughter and also takes care of two nieces whose parents are dead. All three children go to school. She works as a driver for one of the hospitals in the city of Maputo. Her husband works as a teacher. They earn very little money. Her salary has not been enough to cover the costs of refurbishing their house, so she has turned to Hluvuku for a loan to buy cement, stone, sand, and iron bars. Her biggest dream is to acquire a personal vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase cement, stone, sand, and iron bars.

loans.name: Joaquina

texts.en:
Joaquina is 31 years old, she is married and she has two children. She is applying for a loan of $ 1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a second-hand clothes shop, and she also sells in the market.

Joaquina became involved in business activities a year ago, starting with her own working capital of $ 300. She earns a good income from selling her second-hand clothes because many people like to buy them, they are cheap and unique compared to new clothes. So she is still happy with her business. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more clothes: trousers, shorts, jackets, shirts, turtleneck shirts, skirts, nightgowns, etc. She also has animals like cows, pigs, chickens and dogs.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shorts, jackets, shirts, turtleneck shirts, skirts, nightgowns, and other clothing.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim of ages 46  is a very hard working married man charged with the responsibility of taking care of 6 children and all attend school in Hoima, Uganda. He operates a bar primarily buying and selling sodas and beers on a small scale around Hoima town, as his main business he has fetched average incomes to support his family. In order to supplement his incomes, he carries out faming predominantly growing beans, soya bean and gnuts among other items. He desires to grow and expand his business so as to improve on the standards of living of his family only to be limited by inadequate capital and high rental fees. He is seeking for the loan facility to buy more sodas and beers for selling

loans.use: to buy more sodas and beers for selling .

loans.name: Olga Lucia

texts.es:
Ella es Olga, una sonriente mujer de 48 años de edad, que se dedica a la venta de mercancía, negocio que inicio en el año 2014, por necesidad económica, puesto que no tenía empleo y no tiene pareja que le ayude monetariamente, depende únicamente de ella misma, siempre lo ha hecho y a pesar de las adversidades que se le han presentado ha sabido superarlas y salir adelante.
Olga siempre vende producto por temporada, prepara sus ventas con uno o dos meses de anticipación, hace un trabajo de pre-venta y luego de tener los pedidos, comprar la mercancía y entregar dicha mercancía a los clientes, optó por esta medida para evitar tener mercancía reprimida guardada en alguna bodega.
Ya que se aproxima la temporada de diciembre la señora Olga quiere solicitar un préstamo para cubrir un pedido, dicho dinero será para la compra de: ropa, juguetes, accesorios en acero y un cajón para la moto donde se desplaza para entregar los pedidos.
texts.en:
This is Olga, a 48 year old woman who is full of smiles, who works selling goods. She started this work in 2014 due to financial needs, as she was unemployed and had no partner to give her financial support. She is independent and always has been, and has been able to overcome any obstacles that have appeared and move forward despite them.

Olga always sells products on a seasonal basis. She prepares her sales one or two months in advance, does pre-sales work and, after receiving the orders, buys the goods and delivers them to her customers. She chose this method to avoid having to store unused goods.

As the December season is approaching, Olga wants to request a loan to cover an order. The money will be used to buy clothes, toys, steel accessories and a crate for the motorbike she uses to deliver orders.

loans.use: to buy clothes, toys, steel accessories and a crate for the motorbike she uses to deliver orders.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is married and she has two children. Every day, she sees all the women are always dependent on their husbands, so one day she thought to help her husband, so that her husband could feel lighter about the responsibilities in the household. She began to open her small business.

She has been involved in business activities since 2014, with her own working capital of $400, and she does her best on it. She started with a small store, so she is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to add with her working capital to buy additional items to keep in her store, including detergents, candies, cooking oils, sugar, hand and body soaps and other things to sell.

She will improve her business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy detergents, candies, cooking oils, sugar, hand and body soaps and other things to sell.

loans.name: Basel

texts.en:
Basel is a 25-years-old single young man from Rafah city. His father is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low and unstable income. This income is barely cover all the family needs.

Basel is a student in the university where he studies Business Administration. He wants to take the BA degree and find a job to help his family in part of their expenses.

Basel took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Basel will be able to do his home works and reports easily. Basel appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop to help his studies leading to a BA in Business Administration

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is married aged 45 living in Hoima-Uganda. He operates a retail shop mostly selling of cooking oil, salt, soap, general merchandise among other items on retail basis. In order to supplement his incomes he ventured into farming of beans and maize so as to raise more incomes for his family and to have more of food security in his village and areas surrounding him.

Emmanuel started business in 2005 on realizing a need to supplement his incomes. His dream is to develop and expand his business so as to improve the standards of living of his family. He is seeking for loan facility to buy more soap, salt cooking oil for sell. However, high rental fees and stiff competition affect his business returns.

loans.use: to buy more soap, salt cooking oil for sell

loans.name: Daissy Isabel

texts.es:
Daissy es una mujer de 36 años de edad que diariamente sueña ver su casa construida en material (concreto, ladrillo), es una persona humilde, pero que trabaja todos los días para alcanzar su sueño, vive en unión libre con su pareja con la que tiene dos hijos la mayor de 7 años y el menor de tan solo un añito, ellos lo son todo para ella, su fortaleza e inspiración.
Daissy pensando en sus hijos, en su futuro, en todo, quiere solicitar un préstamo para sacar adelante su negocio de cría de cerdos,  su propósito es a final de este año iniciar la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Daissy is a 36-year-old woman who dreams daily of having a house built with sturdy materials (concrete, brick). She is a humble person, and works every day to achieve her dream. She lives with her partner with whom she has two children who are 7 and 1 year old. They are everything to her: her strength and inspiration.

Daissy thinks of her children, and their future, and thus she wants a loan to increase her business of breeding pigs. She would then begin to build her house at the end of this year.

loans.use: to boost her pig breeding business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 28 year old lady who lives in the out skirts of main town. She deals in sale of second hand shoes,a business she has done for the last 4 years.
She has applied for 5 million to help her boost her working capital.
She has dreams of educating her only daughter she has since she is a single mother.
She says she faces a problem of high taxes when importing goods and also high rent in main town.
However she is greatful to Ugafode for the persistent help they have rendered her business.

loans.use: to boost her shoes trade business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more cocoa to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a maize farmer from Makwalla village. As a Babban Gona member, Musa is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Musa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs.

Musa will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Musa no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Musa hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Dayyabu

texts.en:
Dayyabu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Dayyabu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Dayyabu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Dayyabu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Dayyabu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Dayyabu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Asu

texts.en:
Asu is a 46-year-old mother with eight children. She has had a small business of selling vegetables (cabbage, eggplant, cucumber) in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for over two years.

Asu requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, and hand gloves to assist her in running the business. She will expand her business by using her profit.

She became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, and hand gloves.

loans.name: Acila

texts.en:
Acila owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sold merchandise like cooking oil, seasonings, coffee, powdered milk, pouch vinegar, soap, shampoo, eggs, and toiletries.
She is married and has a 14-year old daughter. Most of her expenses comes from food and school  fees.
Her husband earns a living by being a laborer.

For the past 5 years, Acila caters mostly locals and neighbors in the community where she lives. She decided to join CEVI to access loans to boost her business. 

She would like to improve her earnings by purchasing  additional supplies like beverages, condiments  and assorted canned goods. These will keep the inventory of her store causing more buyers to come.

Acila is hoping  that she could make it sustainable for the welfare of her growing child.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies like beverages, condiments  and assorted canned goods

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
Cecile is 31 years old and has five children.  Cecile is married and has three children are presently in school.

Cecile is in the agricultural business, farming corn in the Philippines. Cecile requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Cecile has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cecile would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Phat's Group

texts.en: Phat’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Phat works as farmer and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
Cleofe works hard to support her family. Cleofe is single and has a buy and sell mineral water business in the Philippines.

Cleofe requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy bottled water to sell.

Cleofe has been in this business for 1 year.

In the future, Cleofe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bottled water to sell

loans.name: Gabriel Antonio

texts.es:
Palabras de admiración sobran para este gran hombre llamado Gabriel, un hombre que a pesar de tener problemas de movilidad, sale todos los días con su guitarra a enamorar peatones, recaudando dinero para ayudar en su casa, es una persona admirable que no espera generar lastima, solo admiración, respeto y orgullo para sus familiares.
Gabriel hoy necesita tu ayuda, solo un préstamo que lo devolverá en su totalidad, necesita adecuar su silla de ruedas, instalarle un sistema para que pueda movilizarse por él mismo, sería de gran ayuda y podrá llegar a diferentes sitios a compartir su música.
texts.en:
Words of admiration abound for this great man named Gabriel; a man who, despite having mobility problems, rises every day with his guitar to sing to pedestrians, raising money to help at home. He is a wonderful person who hoped to generate not pity, but admiration, respect and pride for his family.

Gabriel now needs your help with a loan that will be repaid in full, which he needs to adapt his wheelchair, installing a system that will allow him to move by himself. This would be very helpful and would allow him to travel to different areas to share his music.

loans.use: install a motor in his wheelchair to move more easily.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica lives in Liquisa and she is a businesswoman. She has been involved in business activities since a few year ago with her own working capital, and she does her best on it. She has very high interest in doing business.

She has a small store, and she hopes to open a bigger store, but her capital is not enough, so she is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She will use this loan to buy additional items to keep in her store, including detergents, coffee, sugar, noodles, milk, sardines, biscuits and other things to sell.

She is taking this loan because she also wants to improve her management for her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy detergents, coffee, sugar, noodles, milk, sardines, biscuits and other things to sell.

loans.name: Erne

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Erne works hard to support her family.

She has a butcher shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig raising. Erne is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional meat to sell for her butcher shop business.

Erne has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional meat to sell.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
A $1,500.00 loan is offered to Florentina to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day, because she lives near many people.

She will buy some additional supplies with this loan, including detergents, cooking oils, sardines, milks, Aqua, slippers, biscuits, noodles, hair oil, hand and body balm, soft drinks and other things to sell.

Florentina has been involving herself in business activities since a few years ago, with her own working capital. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can be helping her husband to be responsible for her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future, with the loan that are offered from Tuba Rai Metin.

loans.use: to buy detergents, cooking oils, sardines, milk, Aqua, slippers, biscuits, noodles, hair oil, hand and body balm, soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en: For the last four years, Aileen has earned a living through food (snacks) selling business while her husband works hard as a driver.  Aileen is 43 years old and lives with her husband and five children; one adult and four-school-aged children in Baybay, Leyte. Her goal for the future is to increase her income to have enough money to send her children to school and become professionals someday. To do this, she wants to lend bigger amount of money to buy food ingredients such as fruits, sugar, flour and cooking oil. In this way, she would possibly increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients such as fruits, sugar, flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent lives in Hoima Uganda. He is aged 63 married with 9 children and all attend school. He ventured into the business of selling general merchandise, cooking oil, salt and sugar on a retail basis. He has another business of renting out his houses in order to raise incomes to support his family. He has always wanted to diversify his business as well as to develop and grow his business however, in adequate capital hinders his desires. He is seeking for credit to buy more stock items like salt, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock items like salt, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon aged 40 is every hard working Man charged with the responsibility of taking care of 2 children and all attend school in Hoima Uganda. He ventured into selling of cooking oil, salt, sugar, and soap among other items on a retail basis. In turn he carries out crop production mostly maize in order to supplement his incomes. He intends to grow and expand his business the more only to be limited by inadequate capital. He is seeking for credit to buy more salt and sugar for sell.

loans.use: to buy more salt and sugar for selling.

loans.name: Trinity Junior School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Geoffrey. He is the Head teacher of Trinity Junior School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Kyengera in Wakiso with 320 students. Trinity Junior School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Trinity Junior School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Geoffrey ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en: Mrs. Hai, 28 years old, is married and has two children. With support from her husband, she has worked with grazing cattle. She chose this line of work of her own initiative and to obtain extra income. She also works in agriculture. Before, she only worked as a domestic employee. This allowed her to raise her children and provide them with education. The place where she keeps her cattle is 6 blocks away from her home. She needs the loan to buy grazing cattle, in order to take care of them, fatten them, and later sell them at a better price.

loans.use: to buy grazing cattle, in order to take care of them, fatten them, and later sell them at a better price.

loans.name: Yaser

texts.en:
Yaser is a 26-year-old, single man from Jabalia city, which is located in the Gaza Strip, next to the Refugee Camp with the same name. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.
 
So, Yaser took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Yaser will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas).  Yaser’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes.  Yaser appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Lamarana's Group

texts.fr:
Créé en Décembre 2010, ce groupe de 20 femmes compte actuellement 09 cycles dans le programme des bancs villageois presque 05 années de compagnonnage. Elles sont toutes issues du même village et partageant des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Lamarana (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants : 03 garçons et 02 filles. Elle s’active dans la vente de produits alimentaires (boutique)

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte acheter  03 sacs de riz à 13000f le sac, du sucre à 16000f , 03 bidons de 20 litre d'huile raffinée à 60000f. 

Avec les bénéfices,elle compte appuyer son mari dans la gestion des charges familiales  dans la  scolarisation de ses enfants,les soins médicaux et la dépense quotidienne.
.
texts.en:
Created in December 2010, this group of 20 women has participated in 9 cycles of the 'bancs villageois' program, nearly 5 years of mentoring. They are all from the same village and share very strong connections of solidarity and support. They are all small businesswomen.

Lamarana (standing at the far right of the picture with a raised hand), is the star borrower of the group. She is married and the mother of five children: three boys and two girls. She sells groceries in a shop.

With her new loan, she intends to buy three bags of rice (at 13,000 francs a bag), sugar (at 16,000 francs), three 20-liter containers of refined oil (at 60,000 francs).

With the profits, she hopes to assist her husband with managing the family's expenses to pay for their children's schooling, medical, and daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy three bags of rice (at 13,000 francs a bag), sugar (for 16,000 francs), three 20-liter containers of refined oil (for 60,000 francs).

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
Ermelinda is 57-year-old woman from Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has two children: one adult and one school-aged child.

Ermelinda has been working alone since the day that her husband became disabled. So to earn a living and to provide for the needs of her family, she does a hog raising business, and she also sells “tuba” (Filipino word for coconut wine). She has been doing this business for three years and earns about PHP 2,400 per month.

She is asking for a loan to buy feed for her pigs and “tuba” to sell. In the future, Ermelinda wishes to improve her business because it is her main source of income to sustain each day.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs and “tuba” (coconut wine) to sell.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana is a woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Feliciana is 59 years old now.

Feliciana has a seaweed vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more seaweed to sell in the market.

Feliciana has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more seaweed to sell in the market.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 53 years old and widowed with six children. With one child still in school, Elisa works very hard to provide for the family.

Elisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, spices, juice, etc.

Elisa has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Elisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, spices, juice, etc.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 49 years old and married with four children. With one child still in school, Emelita works very hard to provide for the family.

Emelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, spices, juice, etc.

Emelita has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Emelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, spices, juice, etc.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a married woman. She is 63 years old with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Eva has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Eva requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy assorted fish to sell.

Eva has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy assorted fish to sell.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan sells charcoal in Hoima, Uganda. She  rents out her houses alongside her charcoal business. 

Joan is a widow with three children and is charged with the responsibility of taking care of her family. Three of them are still going to school. She started this business so as to educate her children as a loving mother. She intends to expand her business. However, limited capital and high transportation costs to bring charcoal to her store.

Joan intends to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is maize farmer from Dandoka village. As a member of Babban Gona, Ibrahim is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the oppotrtunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. Before joining Babban Gona, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Ibrahim is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Luz Marelys

texts.es:
Trabajar por sus hijos, por su familia, por mejorar su hogar, por lograr una mejor calidad de vida, una independencia económica, una vida más digna, es la consigna de Luz, una morena de 33 años de edad la cual vive en unión libre con su pareja con la que tiene dos hijos, la mayor de 13 y el menor de 7 años.
Siempre se ha caracterizado por criar cerdos, pero la economía está muy cambiante y los ingresos que tiene ahora no alcanza para pagar sus deudas, por ello quiere hacer lo posible por tener otro negocio paralelo a su cría de cerdos que será la cría de pollos para lo que necesita un apoyo monetario que usara en la compra de; materiales para la construcción de un galpón, pollos, alimento y vitaminas. 
La empresaria tiene una mentalidad ganadora, triunfante, ella realizara el mayor esfuerzo posible por sacar a su familia adelante y gozar en un futuro de una excelente calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz believes in working for her children and her family to improve their home, obtain a higher quality of life, economic independence, and a more dignified life. She is a 33-year-old dark skinned woman, who is in a civil union with her partner with whom she has two children, the oldest is 13, and the youngest is 7 years old.

She has always worked breeding pigs, but because the economy has been volatile, her income no longer manages to cover her costs. For this reason, she is doing what she can to have another business in addition to pig breeding. This business will be a chicken breeding business, for which she will need financial support to buy construction materials to build a shed, chickens, feed, and vitamins.

This entrepreneur has the mindset of a successful winner. She will put forth the maximum effort possible to get her family ahead, and in the future, enjoy an excellent quality of life.

loans.use: to set up a chicken breeding business in addition to breeding pigs.

loans.name: Aliyu

texts.en:
Aliyu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Aliyu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Aliyu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Aliyu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Aliyu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Aliyu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Moussouba

texts.fr:
Membre depuis 2013,  cette brave femme a une expérience dans le programme des Bancs Villageois et a comme activité principale l’élevage.

Madame Moussouba est mariée, âgée de 37 ans et mère de 04 enfants dont 03 filles et 01 garçon.Elle s'active dans l’élevage de volailles et de moutons

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 20 poulets à 3000f l'un et des moutons d'un montant de 135000f et acheter des aliments d'un montant de d'un montant de 50000f pour le revendre en détails.

 Les bénéfices lui serviront  de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants et d’aider son mari dans la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
A member since 2013, this good woman has an experience in the 'banc villageois' program and raises livestock as her main business.

Moussouba is a married, 37-year-old woman and the mother of four children, three of whom are girls and one who is a boy. She raises poultry and sheep.

With this loan, she intends to purchase 20 chicks (at 3,000 francs apiece), sheep (for a total of 135,000 francs) and to buy food (for a total of 50,000 francs) to resell at retail.

The profits will help her to meet her children's needs and help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy 20 chicks (at 3,000 francs apiece) and sheep (for a total of 135,000 francs) and to buy food (for a total of 50,000 francs) to resell at retail.

loans.name: Kairinsahan

texts.ru: Кайринсахан, 51 год, замужем, мать 4 детей. У Кайринсахан - средне-специальное образование, вот уже 10 лет она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Кайринсахан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 коровы. На собственном участке, мерою 2,0 ГА, она выращивает кукурузу и табак для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 25,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кайринсахан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита помогут Кайринсахан улучшить ее материальные и жилищные условия.
texts.en:
Kairinsahan is 51 and married with four children. She has a specialist high school education and has been working in animal husbandry and agriculture for 10 years. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has three cows on her farm as well as 2 hectares of her own land where she grows corn and tobacco for sale. Her monthly income is 25,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her farm, Kairinsahan has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 80,000 KGS to purchase cows to increase her head count of livestock. Profits from the loan will allow her to improve her material and living conditions.

loans.use: to buy some cows in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Nancy Del Rosario

texts.es: Nancy tiene 51 años de edad, es madre soltera, ella tiene tres hijos, todos ellos estudian, se dedica a la venta de comidas, para sacarlos adelante. Nancy por este motivo solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlos en la compra de mas productos para poder ofrecer nuevos platos, la aspiración de Nancy es seguir apoyándoles con el estudio  y también seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Nancy is 51 years old, a single mother, and has three kids, all of whom go to school. She works selling food in order provide for her kids.

For this reason, Nancy is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of more products in order to offer more dishes. Nancy hopes to continue supporting her children's studies and also grow her business.

loans.use: to implement her business.

loans.name: Gelpud Masinsoy

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 39 años de edad, de estado civil soltera y es muy responsable  se dedica a la producción y venta de leche, ella es madre de tres hijos, todos ellos estudian,gracias a su trabajo y dedicación les puede brindar una buena educación.
Rosa necesita de este crédito para invertir en más vacas, así podrá aumentar su negocio de producción de leche, espera subir su tasa de ganancias para  sustentar  las  necesidades básicas de ella y de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 39 years old, single, and very responsible. She works in the production and sale of milk. She is the mother of three children, all of whom go to school. Thanks to her hard work and dedication, she can provide them with a good education.

Rosa needs this loan to invest in more cows. This way she can increase her business and the amount of milk produced. She hopes to increase her income to provide for her and her children's basic necessities.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Pisei's Group

texts.en: Pisei’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Pisei makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Lorenza Yesenia

texts.es:
Lorenza es una mujer de 20 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 6 años, y su negocio es la panadería.
Ella es buena madre, divertida y muy honesta. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por el comercio manufacturero, artesanía y producción industrial se reúnen en toda el área.
Lorenza es de cabello corto hasta los hombros, baja estatura y ojos pardos. Su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja en construcción y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la panadería, ella compra harina, huevo, leche, azúcar y otros ingredientes para hornear en su casa pan de diferentes tipos, la venta la realiza todos los días ambulantemente, “tengo clientes fijos y busco nuevos clientes…” comenta. la ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas diarias, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar insumos de panadería. Su sueño es tener una tienda donde vive, ella desea comprar insumos de panadería, canastas y gavetas para almacenar el pan. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Lorenza solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos de panadería, canastas y gavetas para pan.
texts.en:
Lorenza, age 20, lives with her life partner. She has two children, ages four and six. Her business is a bakery. She is a good mother, fun, and very honest. She conducts her business in the area south of the city. It is know for its manufacturing commerce, handicrafts, and industrial production that comes together in the entire area.

Lorenza has short hair to her sholders, is short, and has brown eyes. Her native language is Guaraní, and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her life partner, who works in construcion, and with her childen, who go to school. They live in rented quarters, which are made of brick and have all of the basic services.

Her business is a bakery. She buys flour, eggs, milk, sugar, and other ingredients to bake different types of bread at her house. She sells every day in an itinerant manner. "I have fixed customers, and I am looking for new customers," she says. The advantage of her business is that she has daily sales. The disadvantage is the lack of money to buy bakery supplies.

Her dream is to have a store where she lives. She wishes to buy bakery supplies, baskets, and drawers to store the bread. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the five years that she has been engaged in this business activity. It is for these reasons that Lorenza is requesting a loan to buy bakery supplies, bread baskets, and drawers for the bread.

loans.use: to buy bakery supplies like bread baskets and drawers.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 39 years old, married, and has three children.

Juliet works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, spices, and juice.

Juliet has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Juliet aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, spices, and juice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy thread to make handicrafts, and to use the rest for agriculture.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is 57 years old and married. She is from Mahaplag, Leyte. She operates a sari-sari store (general store). She raises hogs to earn additional income. Her husband owns a farm.

There are times in their life that having no capital to run their businesses is a problem. Carmencita is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy grocery items such as noodles, canned goods, eggs, cooking oil, coffee, sugar, toiletries, candies, chips and biscuits. She will also use the money to buy feed for her pigs. In the future, she wants to expand for sustainability.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as noodles, canned goods, eggs, cooking oil, coffee, sugar, toiletries, candies, chips, and biscuits.

loans.name: Marie Dieula

texts.fr: Marie Dieula est celibataire. Elle a 52 ans. Elle gère un commerce où elle vend des bonbons et des sucreries depuis 10 ans. Dans le but de faire croître son commerce, elle demande un microcrédit. Dans un futur proche, elle espère développer son activité.
texts.en: Marie Dieula is single. She is 52 years old. She has been working as a vendor selling candy and sweets for 10 years. She is requesting a microloan in order to grow her business. She hopes to keep developing her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy boxes of sweets [for resale].

loans.name: Tacianita

texts.en:
Tacianita is 51 years old, single, and has four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Tacianita has a fish vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years.

Tacianita requested a loan from NWTF for 22,000 PHP, which she will use to buy a variety of fish to sell in the market. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Sokun's Group

texts.en: Sokun’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokun makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Celia works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Celia is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy assorted fish to sell to her customers.

Celia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is an amazing mother who lives in Nablus City. She has two children and she is working hard to ensure a good life for them and ensure that they do not need anything.

Nadia is a divorced woman , she face all life difficulties alone also she cover all the needs for her big family. She wants to help herself in anyway she can because she is a very productive and ambitious woman, she decided to open her own business.

Nadia started her business five years ago. She sews clothes to sell. After she felt that she had a good experience in this business, she decided to expand and develop her work. Therefore she applied for a loan to help her buy a new sewing machine and yarns and fabrics to increase her income.
She needs your support to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: buy a new sewing machine and yarns and fabrics to increase her income

loans.name: Noriza

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Noriza works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell ready to wear items. Noriza is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy paint, iron rod for the repair of her motorcycle and pays for labourers salaries for her motorcycle transport business.

Noriza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy paint, iron rod for the repair of her motorcycle and pays for labourers salaries.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 25 years old and married with two children, one child still in school, Jane works very hard to provide for them.

Jane runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, spices, juice and etc.

Jane has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future Jane would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, spices, juice and etc

loans.name: Lodinela

texts.en:
Lodinela is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lodinela is 41 years old and has two children who are in school.

Lodinela has a buy and sell personal product care business in the Philippines. Lodinela requested a PHP 25000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like lotion, perfume, roll on, etc..

Lodinela has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Lodinela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like lotion, perfume, roll on, etc.

loans.name: Jetrace

texts.en: Jetrace is married with children. She operates a retail shop, earns salary and deals in cattle keeping. Her family never lacks, because she works hard  to provide for them. Her greatest desire is to turn her shop into whole sale business. At the moment she has realized some lacking items that would increase her income levels. Jetrace will use the loan facility to buy items such as soft drinks, bakery products, cookies and others to sell.

loans.use: to buy items such as soft drinks, bakery products, cookies and others to sell.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, de 31 años de edad, es un hombre honrado, humilde y muy trabajador, no estudio porque su familia no tenía los suficientes recursos para apoyarlo; está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar y junto a ella tiene tres hijos, dos de ellos trabajan y solo uno está estudiando.

Luis, se dedica a trabajar en el mejoramiento de carreteras, limpiando y reparando algunos daños de las carreteras, este trabajo lo realiza desde hace más de 6 meses y es de este trabajo que obtiene los ingresos necesarios para suplir las necesidades de su familia.- Luis, se levanta muy temprano para ir a trabajar, su esposa también se levanta temprano para preparar los alimentos que él llevará a su trabajo, pues la distancia es bastante y no puede regresar a almorzar a su casa; Luis, además de trabajar para una empresa, también realiza trabajos agrícolas desde su niñez, para producir sus propios alimentos.

Luis, está solicitando un crédito para pagar mano de obra, comprar semilla de frijol, abono, pesticidas y fertilizantes, porque a alquilado una parcela de tierra en donde sembrará frijol y esta fácil de cultivarla, pero necesita darle el manejo adecuado para obtener una buena producción. 

Luis, sueña con ayudar a su hijo menor para que estudie en la universidad, pero también desea construir su casa de ladrillo, porque actualmente es de bahareque y en época lluviosa son afectados por vivir en una zona vulnerable.
texts.en:
Luis is 31 years old. He is an honest, humble, and very hardworking man. He didn't go to school because his family didn't have sufficient resources to support him. He is in a common law marriage. His partner takes care of the home, and they have three children together. Two of them work and one is in school. Luis works in road improvement, cleaning and repairing certain damage on the roads. He's had this job for more than 6 months, and from this job he obtains the income necessary to meet his family's needs.

Luis gets up very early to go to work. His wife also gets up early to prepare the food he will take to work, since it is far away and he can't return home for lunch. In addition to working for a company, Luis has also worked in agriculture ever since childhood, in order to produce his own food.

Luis is seeking a loan to pay for labor and to buy bean seeds, manure, pesticides and fertilizers, because he has rented a parcel of land where he will plant beans, and where it will be easy to grow them, but he needs adequate control to yield a good production. Luis dreams of helping his youngest child get a college education. He also dreams of building a house of brick, because his is currently woven with straw, mud and reeds, and in the rainy season they are affected by living in such a vulnerable area.

loans.use: to pay for labor and to buy bean seeds, manure, pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mirian Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza, de 26 años de edad, es madre soltera, estudio hasta cuarto grado, su situación económica era muy difícil en su familia, fue por esa razón que decidió dejar el estudio y dedicarse a trabajar para poder ayudar en su casa económicamente y poder tener su propio dinero; actualmente tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad y en vive con su abuelito y dos hermanos mayores de ella, pero la única persona que depende de ella económicamente es su hijo.

Esperanza, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a cuidar a su hijo y a su abuelito, pero además de eso también se dedica a vender lácteos como queso, cuajada y crema, esta si es una actividad que le genera ingresos económicos; el negocio que ella tiene es ambulante, pues tiene que cargar el producto y ofrecerlos a sus cliente casa por casa, ella hace rutas y ya tiene cliente que le compran mucho, este trabajo lo realiza junto a su hermano que le ayuda a vender y él carga la mercadería en su espalda hasta los lugares donde ella va.  

Esperanza, necesita el préstamo para comprar 15 libras de queso, 15 libras de cuajada y 5 litros de crema, para su negocio y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes  y también le generara mayores ingresos económicos para su familia. 

Esperanza, sueña con tener un local fijo para vender los lácteos y no tener que andar cargando el producto en la espalda; ella también sueña con seguir estudiando y poder ayudar a su hijo para que pueda estudiar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a 26-year-old woman who studied up to the fourth grade. Her family's economic situation was very difficult. For this reason, she decided to leave her studies and work in order to support her family economically and to have her own money. Currently, she has a 3-year-old son and lives with her grandpa and her two older brothers. However, her only economic dependent is her son.

Esperanza does domestic work and takes care of her son and her grandfather. In addition, she also works selling dairy products like cheese, curd, and creme. This business provides her with an income. She works as a street vendor and therefore has to carry her products and offer them to her clients door-to-door. She has set routes and already has clients who buy plenty from her. She works with her brother who helps her carry the merchandise on his back to the places where she sells it.

Esperanza needs a loan to buy 15 pounds of cheese, 15 pounds of curd, and 5 liters of creme for her business. This way, she can provide her clients with better service and also earn more income for her family.

Esperanza dreams with having her own shop to sell her dairy products, and not having to carry the products on her back. She also dreams with continuing her studies in order to support her son so that he can pursue a college degree.

loans.use: to buy 15 pounds of cheese, 15 pounds of curd, and 5 liters of creme.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is maize farmer from Dummuga village. As a member of Babban Gona, Muhammad is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the oppotrtunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. Before joining Babban Gona, Muhammad would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Muhammad can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Muhammad is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Kris

texts.en:
Kris is 32 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Kris runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, spices, juice, and other items.

Kris has been in this business for four years.

In the future Kris would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, spices, juice, and other items.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 39 years old with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Annabelle has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for one year and also earns an income from buying and selling dried fish.

Annabelle aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: That

texts.en:
That and husband are farmers with 2 little children living in Khnar Teymok village that is far from power grid. As a farmer, She wants to expand her business with 3 hectare big land and making her family living in comfortable condition. However, she is facing some problems related to home energy because of remote area.

Her house has no reliable energy source. She has to go to charge car battery every 2 or 3 days for daily usage. Sometime because of busyness She doesn’t have time to charge battery the whole family is in pitch black condition for the whole day. She is applying Kiva loan to buy high quality home solar energy. After using solar home energy, she believes her family condition would be better and safer. She also can save time and money on utilities.

loans.use: to pay for solar home system

location.town: Khnar Teymok Village, Kraing Lvea Commune, Samaki

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is 58 years old and married, with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ligaya runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, spices, and juice.

Ligaya has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, spices, and juice.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a married woman. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 49 years old.

Alma has a buy-and-sell personal products business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like lotion, perfume, face powder, etc.

Alma has been in this business for five years. In the future, Alma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like lotion, perfume, face powder, etc.

loans.name: Deogracia

texts.en:
Deogracia is 62 years old, married, and has six children, one of whom attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Deogracia operates a food vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years.

Deogracia requested a loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as vegetables, spices, fish, etc. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food vending business such as vegetables, spices, fish, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 50 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom attend school. She works hard to provide for them. Ma. Fe operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years.

Ma. Fe requested a loan from NWTF for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, spices, and juice. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, spices, and juice.

loans.name: Rudy Walter

texts.es: Rudy es un hombre trabajador de 29 años de edad que vive en la localidad de Coriri, que está ubicado en Arequipa. Él trabaja como controlador de buses, es decir que registra la hora a la que los buses de distintas líneas pasan por su zona de control, y también se dedica a la cría de cerdos orgánicos, poniendo mucha atención en el cuidado y la alimentación que les brinda. Rudy solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar cuatro cerdos orgánicos y para la alimentación orgánica de estos. En el futuro Rudy espera poder comprar su propia casa y fundar una familia.
texts.en: Rudy is a hardworking 29-year-old man who lives in the district of Coriri, which is in Arequipa. He works as a bus coordinator, meaning that he records the times that buses from different routes pass through his control zone. He also works breeding organic pigs and puts a lot of attention to the care and food he provides them. Rudy is requesting a micro-loan to buy four organic pigs and organic feed for them. In the future, Rudy hopes to buy his own home and start a family.

loans.use: to buy 4 organic pigs and feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Shelove

texts.fr: Shelove a 28 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle fait le commerce de son de blé et d’engrais dans un espace qu’elle a emménagé chez elle. Elle a beaucoup de clients. Son activité l’aide à prendre soin de sa famille. Shelove veut agrandir davantage son commerce et s’offrir de meilleures conditions de vie. Elle a fait une demande de microcrédit pour pouvoir augmenter son stock de marchandises.
texts.en:
Shelove, age 28, is a married mother to one child. She sells wheat bran and fertilizers out of a store that she set up in her own home. She has a lot of customers, and this activity helps her to look after her family.

Shelove would like to expand her business and improve her living conditions. To that end, she is seeking a loan to bolster her stock of merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Génia

texts.fr: Génia est âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mariée et a un enfant. Elle habite à Mais Gâté. Elle vend des vêtements et des chaussures d’occasion depuis une dizaine d’années. Elle a besoin du microcrédit pour éviter des ruptures de stock. Elle souhaite ainsi agrandir son activité pour augmenter son chiffre d’affaires. Son dernier prêt lui a permis de commander plus de produits que d’habitude.
texts.en: Genia is 38 years old. She is married and has one child. She lives in Mais Gate. She has been selling used clothing and shoes for a dozen years. She needs a microloan in order to avoid running out of stock. She would like to grow her business and increase her sales volume. Her previous loan allowed her to maintain a larger stock than usually.

loans.use: to buy boxes of shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a display case, shelving and cases, chairs, beauty products, a wax heater etc.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is a widowed woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jean is 51 years old and has three children are presently in school.

Jean has a fishing business in the Philippines. Jean requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for fishing like fish net, gasoline for her boat and other materials.

Jean has been in this business for 4 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for fishing like fish net, gasoline for her boat and other materials

loans.name: Jocel

texts.en:
