As a married parent of two children, Jocel works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Jocel is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Jocel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Marie Venance

texts.fr: Marie Venance, âgée de 37 ans, est mariée et n’a pas encore d’enfants. Elle vend des sucreries (bonbons, surettes…) en gros au marché de Croix-des-bouquets. Cela fait 5 ans déjà. Très connue dans ce commerce qu’elle exerce, les clients qui souhaitent s’acheter ces produits pour les revendre, viennent directement à elle. Marie Venance désire augmenter ses revenus et s’offrir de meilleures conditions de vie. Elle a sollicité un microcrédit pour pouvoir augmenter son stock de marchandises.
texts.en:
Marie Venance, aged 37, is married and does not yet have any children. She has been wholesaling sweets (candies, suckers, etc.) at a market in her town for five years now. Since she is well-known in her business, customers who want to buy her goods for resale come directly to her.

Marie Venance wishes to grow her income and be able to afford better living conditions. She is requesting this small loan so that she can grow her stock of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy a stock of candies for her wholesale business.

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
Marta is married and works hard to support her family. She operates a fishing business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 20 years.

Marta requested a loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional fishing net and gasoline. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net and gasoline.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion earns a living selling ready-to-wear clothing, like pants, t-shirts, blouses, jeans and shorts. She is married and has no dependents.

In addition to her shop selling clothing, she also owns a sari-sari (variety) store, selling commodities like sugar, edible oil, seasonings, noodles, bath soap, and soft drinks.

She is 49 years old and a resident of the town of Mayorga, Leyte.

She wants to continue improving her quality of life, which is why she is requesting a loan with CEVI to buy supplies of clothing and assorted groceries for her sari-sari (variety) store. Her shop will have an adequate supply of commodities, enabling her to slowly expand both of her sources of income.

Asuncion is very grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy supplies of clothing and assorted groceries for her sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en: Mary Jean is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mary Jean is 31 years old and has one child still in school. Mary Jean has a food vending business in the Philippines. Mary Jean requested a  4,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, hot dog, sausage, cooking oil, bamboo sticks, etc. Mary Jean has been in this business for three years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, hot dog, sausage, cooking oil, bamboo sticks, etc.

loans.name: Yollande Jacqueline

texts.fr:
37 ans, mariée à un chauffeur, Yollande est une femme travailleuse et débrouillarde. Elle est mère de trois enfants de 12,10, et 5 ans et ils sont tous scolarisés dans une école privée. 
Elle exerce une activité de vente de tissus. Elle a commencé cette activité juste après qu'elle a quitté l'école. Elle effectue une vente ambulante, elle rejoint le grand marché des villes. Elle voudrait développer et améliorer son commerce d'où le recours au crédit.
L'objectif est d'améliorer le niveau de la famille, pouvoir continuer à financer l'éducation des enfants et que ses derniers réussissent dans leurs études.
texts.en:
Yollande is 37 years old and married to a driver. She is a hard-working and resourceful woman, the mother of three children aged 12, 10, and 5. They are all enrolled in a private school. Yollande has a business selling cloth. She began this business just after she left school. She makes sales in an itinerant fashion and also at the main markets of towns.

Yollande would like to develop and improve her business and that is why she has turned to small loans. The goal is to improve the family's living standard and continue to pay for her children's education, hoping they will succeed in their studies.

loans.use: to buy cloth for undershirts and T-shirts.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en: Ermelinda is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working,  48-year-old entrepreneur. Ermelinda has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed in her business. Ermelinda has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Ermelinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is 48 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Teofila operates a bicycle transport business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for eight years.

Teofila requested a loan from NWTF for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to buy spare parts and other materials needed in her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth works hard to support her family. Lilibeth is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Lilibeth has been in this business for 9 years now. She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net.

In the future, Lilibeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Voahanginirina

texts.fr:
Agée de 49 ans, Voahanginirina est une femme courageuse et travailleuse. Elle est veuve et mère de cinq enfants. Deux de ses derniers sont déjà mariés et deux autres l'appuient dans l'exercice de son activité. Le dernier seulement qui a 13 ans va à l'école actuellement. 
Elle dirige un magasin général avec petite gargote (kafe sy mofo) depuis 2007 c'est à dire depuis le décés de son mari pour gagner sa vie. Elle était femme au foyer avant. Elle travaille dur avec l'appui des deux enfants, son objectif est d'ouvrir deux autres magasins pour eux.
texts.en:
Voahanginirina, aged 49, is a fearless and hard-working woman. She is a widow and mother of five children. Two of them are already married and two others help her in her business. The youngest, 13, is the only one who is presently in school.

She has been running a general store with a small snack bar (called in Malagasy "kafe sy mofo"--coffee and bread) since 2007, that is, since the death of her husband, in order to earn a living. She was a housewife before that.

Voahanginirina works hard, with the help of her two children, and her goal is to be able to open two other shops for them.

loans.use: to buy a used refrigerator, soft drinks, sacks of rice, sugar, and tins of cooking oil.

loans.name: Mariacina

texts.en:
Mariacina has been involved in business activities since 2004. She started her business with her own working capital of USD 40.

Mariacina has a shop. So, she is requesting a loan of USD 600 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy additional supplies, including shampoo, toothpaste, soap, lighters, noodles, biscuits, sugar, slippers, cigarettes, candles, milk, sardines, and other things to sell.

She is happy because, with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can further build her business in the future and her income can be increased.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, toothpaste, soap, lighters, noodles, biscuits, sugar, slippers, cigarettes, candles, milk, and sardines.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca, de 51 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado y por razones económicas sus padres no pudieron seguir ayudándole en el estudio; está casada y es madre de 6 hijos, 2 de ellos viven aparte y tienen sus propios hogares, otro está estudiando y tres se quedan en casa.

Francisca, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a cuidar de sus hijos, mientras que su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y trabajar en construcción en su tiempo libre.

Francisca, necesita el préstamo para comprar semilla de frijol, pesticidas, herbicidas e insecticidas para mantener la plantación libre de plagas y enfermedades, la otra parte del dinero será para pagar mano de obra que le ayuden a sembrar.

El sueño de Francisca, es obtener una buena producción para el consumo de su familia, mejorar su vivienda y ayudar a sus hijos en el estudio, para que puedan estudiar una carrera universitaria y que en un futuro puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Francisca is 51 years old. She studied up to Grade 6 and for economic reasons her parents couldn't continue to support her in her studies. She is married and the mother of six children. Two of them live apart and have their own homes. One is studying and the other three live at home.

Francisca works doing domestic work and caring for the children while her husband is a farmer and works in construction in his spare time.

Francisca needs the loan to buy bean seed, pesticides and insecticides to keep her plantation pest and disease free. The other part of the money will be used to pay for labor to help them to seed.

Francisca's dream is to have good production for the use of her family, improve her house and help her children study at university so that in the future they can have a higher quality of living.

loans.use: to buy bean seed, pesticides and insecticides to keep her plantation pest and disease free.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela is a 47-year-old woman from Mahaplag, Leyte. She is a widow and has six children. Four of these children are school-aged. Their ages are 15, 11, 8, and 5 years old. Her husband already passed away. That means that Marcela needs to work hard, alone, for her children.

To sustain herself, Marcela sells food snacks, like rice cakes. She has been doing this for two years. Thus, she is asking a loan to buy food ingredients, such as milled rice, coconut milk, sugar, and yeast.

In the future, Marcela wishes to expand her business and start other business opportunities, like owning a sari-sari store (general store).

loans.use: to buy milled rice, coconut milk, sugar, and yeast.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a single woman and lives a simple life with her family in Mahaplag, Leyte. She is 31 years old and is engaged in a hog raising business. She has been doing this for three years to help her parents in their day-to-day expenses like food consumption.

Marcelina loves her parents so much, that is why she wishes to improve her business and have a sustainable means of living in the future. Thus, she is asking for a loan to help her finance feed for her pigs in order to have a healthy growth and become profitable.

loans.use: to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Mitos

texts.en:
Mitos is engaged in a food selling business to earn a living. She sells food snacks like hot cakes, fish balls, popcorn, banana chips, candies and chips. She has been doing this for eight years, while her husband works hard as a farmer. They work together to provide for the needs of their five children, ages 14, 10, 7, and 1-month-old.

Mitos is a 34 year old woman who dreams to have enough capital to start a sari-sari store business. This dreams is for her family, for them to have a better life in the future. Mitos is asking a loan of PH16000 to help her buy ingredients such as flour, cooking oil, sugar, margarine, popcorn, banana fruits, chips and candies for the store.

loans.use: to inventory for her store.

loans.name: April

texts.en: April is 30 years old, and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. April has been in this business for four years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Nona is 45 years old and her three children are currently in school.

Nona has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 4000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, hot dogs, sausages, bamboo sticks, spices and other materials for her food production business.

Nona has been in this business for 4 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food for sale.

loans.name: Hermenegelda

texts.en:
Hermenegelda is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Hermenegelda is 53 years old and two of her children are in school.

Hermenegelda has a food processing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14000 loan amount through NWTF to buy pigs and spices for her business.

Hermenegelda has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy pigs and spices for her business.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a married woman with eleven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Norma is 55 years old and four of her children are still in school.

Norma has a buy-and-sell home products business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy assorted plastic ware to sell.

Norma has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy plastic ware to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Chona

texts.en:
Chona is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with seven children, five of whom are in school.

Chona earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She supplements this income with earnings from her food vending. Chona is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Chona dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 49 years old and has five children. Emelia is married and four of her children are in school.

Emelia is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Emelia requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

In the future, Emelia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Percelita

texts.en:
Percelita is 44 years old and married with ten children. She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines.

Percelita is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers, vegetable seeds and other farm supplies. Percelita has been in this business for 9 years and also earns additional income from farming corn.

Percelita is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, vegetable seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en: Miguel requests a loan of a $600 to repair his house. The house is old and so Miguel would like to request a loan to repair the old house. He would like to take out a loan to buy wood, stone, sand and also woven fiber. He is happy with this loan because it will improve his living condition in the future. He is a teacher.

loans.use: to buy wood, stone, sand and also woven fiber.

loans.name: Muttaka

texts.en:
Muttaka is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Muttaka has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Muttaka would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Muttaka can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Muttaka will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Muttaka is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula, de 52 años de edad, logro estudiar hasta tercer grado en el centro escolar de su comunidad, fue por eso que decidio ayudar a sus padres en los quehaceres del hogar, también su madre hacia comida tiíca para que ella saliera a venderla; está soltera y luego de la sepación con su pareja sus  hijos formaron sus propios hogares pero la visita con frecuencia.

Paula, trabaja como empleada doméstica en una casa que está a cinco minutos de su casa, ahí  cuida a una persona de la tercera edad, ya tiene más de 5 años de trabajar con esta familia; pero también cuando ella va de  visita a donde sus hijos, ella lleva productos lácteos y los vende  obteniendo una ganancia significativa. 

Paula, necesita el préstamo para comprar lácteos para vender, cuando va donde sus hijas con este  apoyo lograra mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de  vida.  

Paula, sueña con hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Paula, 52, attended school until the third grade in her community's school, and then she decided to help her parents out at home, and to go out and sell food that her mother prepared. She is single, after separating from her husband her children moved into their own homes, but they visit her often. Paula works as a domestic worker in a home just five minutes away from her house. She takes care of an elderly person there, she has worked for the family for five years. Also when she goes to visit her children, she brings dairy products with her to sell, and she earns a significant amount. Paula needs the loan to purchase dairy products for resale, when she can do this when she goes to visit her daughters she can increase her income and improve her standard of living. Paula aims to grow her business and boost her earnings.


Paula, trabaja como empleada doméstica en una casa que está a cinco minutos de su casa, ahí cuida a una persona de la tercera edad, ya tiene más de 5 años de trabajar con esta familia; pero también cuando ella va de visita a donde sus hijos, ella lleva productos lácteos y los vende obteniendo una ganancia significativa.



Paula, necesita el préstamo para comprar lácteos para vender, cuando va donde sus hijas con este apoyo lograra mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.



Paula, sueña con hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar sus ganancias.

loans.use: to buy dairy products for resale.

loans.name: Wilber Alejandro

texts.es:
Wilber, de 22 años de edad, que con mucho esfuerzo de sus padres empezó a estudiar primer grado, pero por razones económicas tubo que abandonar el estudio y dedicarse al trabajo del campo; está soltero y vive en casa con sus padres y 5 hermanos más.

Wilber, se dedica a cultivar hortalizas como pepino, frijol y pipianes desde hace algunos años, este trabajo lo aprendió de su padre, porque cuando era pequeño tuvo que dejar la escuela y ayudarlo en sus cultivos, fue así como logro experiencia y decidió independizarse y sembrar sus propias hortalizas y generar sus propios ingresos.

Wilber, necesita el préstamo para comprar insecticidas, plaguicidas y otros productos que le permitan dar un buen tratamiento a sus hortalizas y que estas generen mejores cosechas.

El sueño de Wilber, es que sus cultivos le generen buenos cosechas, seguir trabajando y en un futuro cumplir su sueño de tener casa propia y así brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Wilber is 22 years old. His parents worked hard to send him to school but even though he started first grade, for financial reasons he had to drop out and start working in the fields. He is single and lives at home with his parents and five other siblings.

Wilber works growing vegetables like cucumber, squash, and beans. He has been doing this for several years now and learned from his father because he had to help him with his crops from a very young age. This is how he gained experience and decided to start out on his own by growing his own vegetables and earning his own income.

Wilber needs this loan to by insecticides, pesticides, and other products to properly treat his vegetables. This will allow him to produce better crops.

Wilber's goals are for his crops to yield a good harvest and to keep working so that in the future he can make his dream of having his own house a reality and give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, pesticides, and other products to treat his vegetables.

loans.name: Winnie Grace

texts.en:
Winnie Grace is 34 years old, married and has two children. She has a happy family, because even though their income is small, they are helping each member of the family. Winnie Grace owns and manages a beauty parlor in the neighborhood to generate income to help her husband, who is an OFW (overseas Filipino worker), in providing her children's needs.

Winnie Grace is requesting a loan to buy more beauty products for her parlor shop so that she can provide good products and services to her customers. At the same time, she can increase her income, which will help a lot in her children's education.

Winnie Grace plans to improve her residence from her income to give her children a good living.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products for her parlor shop.

loans.name: Ella

texts.en:
Ella is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ella is 57 years old and three of her children are in school.

Ella has a buy-and-sell newspaper business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Ella requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more newspaper to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy newspaper to sell.

loans.name: Genith

texts.es: Genith de 33 años es una comerciante que habita en una urbanización del municipio de Barranquilla en compañía de su cónyuge y sus dos hijos menores de edad, ella encontró en las ventas por catálogos una oportunidad de negocio que le generaría bienestar a su familia.  Apoyada por una amiga que se dedicaba a la misma actividad, emprendió su proyecto, sin embargo con el pasar del tiempo logró captar el capital suficiente para incorporarse directamente a la agencia y  aprovechando su base de clientes amplió su gama de productos e inició a comercializar prendas de vestir a su oferta para obtener mayores ingresos. Con excelentes resultados, Genith lleva en el negocio tres años consecutivos con los que ha logrado fidelizar a su clientela a quienes les oferta una amplia gama de splash, cosméticos, cremas para el cuidado facial y corporal, blusas, pantalones, faldas y todo aquello que necesiten para su uso personal.  En la actualidad está aplicando una solicitud de crédito,  su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo que invertirá en una vitrina y surtido, que exhibirá en su vivienda para lograr incrementar sus ventas. Su sueño de prosperidad realizarle adecuaciones a su vivienda para contar con mejores posibilidades de habitabilidad para su familia.
texts.en:
Genith is 33 years old and works as a saleswoman. She lives in a development in Barranquilla, alongside her spouse and their two young children.

For her, selling by catalog was a great business opportunity to generate well-being for her family. With support from a girlfriend that was in that same business, she started her project. As time went on, she was able to acquire enough capital to join the agency directly and, making the most of her customer base, she expanded her range of products and started selling clothing items also, in order to make more income.

The results were excellent, and Genith has been running her business for three straight years now, during which she has earned her customers' loyalty. She offers a wide array of cosmetics, body mists, facial creams, body lotion, blouses, pants, skirts, and whatever her customers need for personal care.

She is currently applying for a loan, which will be her first through Kiva and Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will invest it in purchasing more merchandise and a display case to use at home to show her products and increase sales. Her financial goal is to make home improvements in order for her family to have better living standards.

loans.use: to buy a display case and merchandise.

loans.name: Khun's Group

texts.en: Khun’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Khun makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Medine

texts.en:
Medine is married and a mother of two. She has been making handicrafts for 15 years and making a contribution to the family budget. With the money she gained, she educated her children and enabled them to be professionals.

Medine is a very hardworking woman. With the help of the loan from MAYA she developed her handicrafts and increased her sales. She was able to start a networking business with the additional income she had. With the loan, she will buy braided rope to continue knitting and selling the knitted goods. Her dream is to open a knitting workplace on her own. (In the photo, both her knitted products and the products of the networking business can be seen.)

loans.use: to buy braided rope

loans.name: Sreytouch

texts.en:
Sreytouch is a 19-year-old single freshman who is from the Kandal Province of Cambodia. She is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in accounting at a university in the city.

Her father is a farmer and wedding-song musician and her mother is a farmer as well, which makes it very hard to pay for her tuition fees. Due to the fact that Sreytouch is short of the finances to pay her tuition fees from the first to the fourth year, she would like to request a loan.

With this loan, she will be able to have enough finances to cover her university fees and earn a bachelor’s degree successfully. For her dreams, she hopes to find a proper job with a decent salary, and she also wants to save money to build her own house.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees from the first to the fourth year, for her BA in Accountancy. Her parents are farmers.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina lives a simple life with her family in the city of Baybay, Leyte. She is a 47-year-old married woman with two children (sixteen and fifteen years old).

Cristina is eager to help her husband and started a general store three years ago. She has an additional business to buy and sell native chickens. Cristina asks for a loan to buy spices, eggs, noodles, cooking oil, canned goods, salt, sugar, coffee, powdered chocolate drink, candies, biscuits, and chips. She will also buy native chickens to sell.

She wants to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to buy spices, eggs, noodles, cooking oil, canned goods, salt, sugar, coffee, powdered chocolate drink, candies, biscuits, chips and native chickens.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Priscilla is 55 years old now.

Priscilla has a food vending business in the Philippines. Priscilla requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients such as, flour, sugr, fruits, etc..

Priscilla has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Priscilla would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as, flour, sugr, fruits, etc.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred had 4 children and works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transportation business and earns additional income operating a general store. Mildred is borrowing 23,000 PHP through NWTF to repair her motorcycle.

Mildred has sustained her business activities through 18 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to repair  her motorcycle.

loans.name: Wilmer Armando

texts.es:
Wilmer, de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado por razones de bajos recursos económicos, está acompañado y es padre de 2 hijos, una niña de 11 años que está estudiando quinto grado y un niño de 9 años de eda que estudia segundo grado.

Wilmer, trabaja en construcción desde hace 4 años, este trabajo lo aprendió de su padre, porque no le dieron la oportunidad de estudiar, pero le enseñaron a trabajar; él decidió dedicarse a este trabajo porque le genera buenos ingresos aunque esto implique desplazarse a diferentes lugares donde requieran de su trabajo.

Wilmer, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, abonos y pesticidas para darle el tratamiento adecuado a sus cultivos, para obtener una mejor cosecha que le genere mejores ingresos para los gastos del hogar.

El sueño de Wilmer, es que su cosecha sea muy buena, para no tener que comprarlos y que el dinero que pueda invertir en granos básicos, utilizarlo en otras necesidades para poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y que sus hijos puedan seguir estudiando y que tengan mejores oportunidades.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 33 years old and only studied up to Grade 4 due to low economic resources. He is in a relationship and is the father of two children, an 11 year old daughter who is studying in Grade 5 and a 9 year old son who is in Grade 2.

Wilmer has worked in construction for 4 years. He learned this work from his father as he didn't get the opportunity to study, but he was taught to work. He decided to do this work as it generates good income although it involves going to different places where his work is required.

Wilmer needs the loan to to buy agricultural inputs like fertilizer, manure and pesticides to adequately treat his crops to obtain a better harvest. This would generate better income for the expenses of the household.

Wilmer's dream is to have a very good harvest and not have to buy this food and he can use the money he would invest in basic grains for other needs. Then he would be able to provide his family with a higher quality of living, so his children can continue to study so they have better opportunities.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs like fertilizer, manure and pesticides to adequately treat his crops.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is a 59-year-old married woman with two children.

Tessie has raised pigs for 4 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies.

She has previously borrowed 5 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Tessie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy  feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 58 years old and married with six children. Wilma works very hard to provide for them.

Wilma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, spices, juice and other personal care products.

Wilma has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future Wilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, spices, juice and other personal care products

loans.name: Sandra Yamileth

texts.es:
Sandra, de 33 años de edad, no tuvo acceso a la educación, porque su familia no contaba con los  recursos económicos para enviarla  a la escuela, es por eso que les ayudaba a sus padres a hacer merienda para vender; está acompañada, su pareja se dedica  a hacer viajes en un pick up y es de esta actividad como han logrado salir  adelante  con su familia, pues tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad.

Sandra, se dedica a vender productos de revista, antes hacía meriendas para vender por las  tardes y los  domingos en los partidos de fútbol; su esposo le apoya con la principal fuente  de ingreso que es la de hacer viajes.

Sandra, necesita el préstamo para comprar repuestos y pagar la reparación del vehículo porque tuvieron un accidente y se dañó, pero aun así sigue trabajando,  pero  necesita repararlo ya que  es la principal fuente de ingreso de su familia. 

Sandra, sueña con poder ayudar a sus hijos para que estudien y enseñarle valores  para  que  sean  personas de bien y que puedan ser independientes  en el  futuro.
texts.en:
Sandra is 33 years old and never had access to an education because her family didn't have enough financial resources to send her to school. For this reason, she would help her parents prepare the food they would sell. Today, she lives with her partner, who works traveling in a pick-up truck. This business is how they provide for their family, since they have two children, ages five and three.

Sandra works selling products by catalog. She used to make food to sell in the afternoons and on Sundays at soccer games. Her husband is the main breadwinner, since their main source of income is his trips.

Sandra needs a loan to pay for parts and labor on the repair of their vehicle. They were in an accident and it suffered some damage. Even though it still runs, she needs to get it repaired because it is her family's main source of income.

Sandra's goal is to help her children go to school and teach them values, so they grow up to be upstanding people and can become independent in the future.

loans.use: to pay for parts and labor to repair her vehicle after an accident.

loans.name: Goma

texts.en:
Goma is a Babban Gona farmer. Goma is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday. Traditionally, Goma would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With this loan Goma can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Goma has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Goma is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to increase his farmland and looks forward to using his additional earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Kucup Mekar Group

texts.en:
The Kucup Mekar group make their full payment on their last loan. During the period, all the member sold their pigs and earned a satisfactory profit. With more knowledge from the training they had, now they can manage the pigs well.

Entering their new loan, most of the members of Kucup Mekar group have a sow and local pigs for pigs barbeque. The local pigs will sell every 2 month.

As one of the members, Ni Ketut become a good example to her friends. Now she plans to purchase super quality feeds for her pigs. She has a sow and will give birth soon. She will sell the piglets for fattening. She’s really happy and thankfull to Kiva, MUK and Lenders for supporting her business and also the group. Now she can support her husband’s income to fulfill their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase super quality feeds

loans.name: Taufao

texts.en:
Taufao is a 46 years old woman who is married with 7 children. She runs a business selling and sewing clothes in her community. She has 4 years of experience with this business.

Taufao has requested a loan to buy materials, needles, threads, a sewing machine etc. She plans to use her profits to support her family. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy needles, a sewing machine, materials, threads etc.

loans.name: Los Alamos De La Estacion Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS ALAMOS DE LA ESTACION”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Delia Marleny ella es conviviente y tiene 42 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de compra y venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y chompas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos, la socia es una mujer emprendedora, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la ropa. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pantalones, blusas y chompas.


Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de tortas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These borrowers belong to the communal bank Los Alamos de la Estacion, which is located in the district of Urcos in Quispicanchis province, department of Cusco.

One of them is Delia Marleny. She is 42 years old and lives in a common-law marriage. She works buying and selling clothing items. She sells pants, blouses, and sweaters, and wants her business to allow her to provide for her children. She is an enterprising woman, and her dream is to one day have a store where she could sell her clothing. She is requesting this loan to buy pants, blouses, and sweaters.

She is grateful to everyone who is a part of making these resources available, and promises to repay her loan in a timely fashion.

The rest of this group's members work selling clothing, selling cakes, running a grocery store, and running a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, and sweaters.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a 40-year-old married woman from Baybay, Leyte with five children between the ages of 20 and 7. Her husband is a construction worker and Gemma runs a sari-sari store (general store), raises pigs, and sells snacks.

Gemma describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient capital. She will use the loan to buy sugar, salt, flour, eggs, spices, noodles, canned goods, toiletries, chips, biscuits, candies, and feed.

Gemma’s main goal in life is to augment their livelihood for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, flour, eggs, spices, noodles, canned goods, toiletries, chips, biscuits, candies, and feed.

loans.name: Ra Sieng's Group

texts.en:
Ra Sieng is 21 years old and a resident in Battambang province. She is married with a son who is under the age of school. She is farmer growing rice for main source of income. Sometimes, she is working for others for a fee for supplemental income. About USD5 is earned every single day and Ra Sieng can manage to save about USD2 each day for future needs. Drought is the main challenge to her rice growing business. 
This is the first cycle loan for her and she will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer to improve crop productivity. She dreams of earning more income to upgrade the standard of living and send her son to school.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to improve crop productivity to upgrade the standard of living and to send her son to school. .

loans.name: Joanne

texts.en:
Joanne is a 38-year-old married woman with seven children, five attend school.

Joanne has raised pigs for 5 years and requests 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies.

She has previously borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Joanne would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Analiza is 39 years old now.

Analiza has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines. Analiza requested a PHP 14000 loan amount through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

Analiza has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Analiza would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en:
Yakubu is a maize farmer from Gogarma village. As a Babban Gona member, Yakubu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Yakubu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Yakubu will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. 

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Yakubu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Yakubu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a university  education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Irmiya

texts.en:
Irmiya is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Irmiya is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Irmiya would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Irmiya will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Irmiya now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Kimberly

texts.es: Kimberly es una joven que se dedica a la venta de artículos de uso doméstico, esto lo realiza desde su casa. Solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones ( ₡ 1 000 000), para la compra de mercadería, esto con el propósito de aumentar su nivel de inventario y poder ofrecer a sus clientes mayor diversidad de productos.
texts.en: Kimberly is a youth who works selling home use products which she does from her house. She is requesting a loan of one million colones (1,000,000 CRC) to buy merchandise. Her goal is to increase the level of her inventory and be able to offer her clients a greater diversity of products.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sales of home use products.

loans.name: Rosy

texts.en:
Rosy is 40 years old and married, with five children, four of whom are still in school. Rosy works very hard to provide for them.

Rosy runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 4,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, spices, and juice.

Rosy has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, spices, and juice.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 43 years old and has three children are currently in school.

Jocelyn has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 7500 loan amount through NWTF to buy assorted dried fish to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 4 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted dried fish to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elizabeth is 37 years old and has four children who are in school.

Elizabeth has a shell craft business in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more shells to use in her business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more shells to use in her business.

loans.name: Marcosa

texts.en:
Marcosa is 56 years old and married with six children. With one child in school, Marcosa works very hard to provide for them.

Marcosa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like coffee, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Marcosa has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Marcosa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like coffee, canned goods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en:
Sobia is a 26-year-old married woman who has four children. She lives in a populated area, and her husband knows about people's needs in this area. He is a market vendor who sells seasonal fruits from his place in a central bazaar and also from his home. He has a few years of experience in this field. He knows customers' needs and he has reliable providers.

Sobia's husband chose this business because it is profitable and brings in a stable income. People use fresh fruits every day and consider them healthy, and many national dishes are made of fruits. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he could sell the maximum amount of fruits till evening and get maximum reward for his efforts.

She applied for a loan so her husband can purchase more fruits and thus increase his monthly turnover. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stock of seasonal fruits for her husband and thus increase his monthly turnover.

loans.name: Micah

texts.en:
Micah is a maize farmer from Barau village. As a Babban Gona member, Micah is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Micah would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Micah can store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. 

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Micah no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Micah hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a Babban Gona farmer.  Daniel is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday. 

Traditionally, Daniel would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan Daniel can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Daniel has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. 

Daniel is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to repair his house or move into a bigger home and looks forward to using his additional earnings to purchase a motorbike and do business with.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en: Mrs. Loan is 33 years old, married, and has four children, all of whom attend school. She works very hard to feed and educate her children. She would like to improve her family’s living standards, especially for her children. However, she lacks money. The loan can help her to build a sanitary latrine. She is able to repay the loan from her salary.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Mrs. Hoa is a hardworking woman, 24 years old. She is married and has two children. The loan can help her to build a latrine to improve her family living standard. Her family’s income is mainly from husbandry. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en:
Iliya is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Iliya has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Iliya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Iliya can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Iliya will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Iliya is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en: Eseta is 35 years old and a single woman with 3 children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for 3 years. Eseta has requested a loan to buy cooking oil ,flour, sugar, a frying pan and shopping bags. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Eseta will use  her profit to extend her business and to support her family as well.

loans.use: to buy a frying pan, flour, cooking bags, shopping bags.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a resident of Baybay, Leyte. She is 49 years old and married. Four years ago, this woman started her own business to be able to help her husband in their financial stability. She owns a sari-sari store where she sells variety of goods. She works every day running this business. She also buys and sells copra (the dried kernel or meat of the coconut from which coconut oil is expressed). But the profits she earns from her sales aren't enough for this woman who dreams sustainability. She wants to improve their ways of living, as to have enough money for their daily needs such as food, personal care products and a variety of beverages. She even needs money for her children’s school payment. Thus, she has five children; three adult and two school aged children.

She is requesting a bigger amount of loan to buy variety of stocks such as chips, candies, biscuits, canned goods, noodles, eggs, cooking oil, toiletries, laundry soap, sugar, coffee, powdered milk, powdered chocolate drink and juice. She will also need the money to buy copra. By the help of loan we entrusted to this woman we can possibly help her in running her business for their future.

loans.use: to buy such as chips, candies, biscuits, canned goods, noodles, eggs, cooking oil, toiletries, laundry soap, sugar, coffee, powdered milk, powdered chocolate drink and juice; copra

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita has been selling grocery goods for many years. She has sustained the business and with her generated income, she was able to successfully repay her previous loan used for the business. Improving her business is easier with her access to GDMPC.

Recently, Tita took out a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to use the additional profit generated by the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Ma. Edwina

texts.en:
Ma. Edwina is 47 years old and married and works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell milk, sugar, can goods, soft drinks, etc.

Ma. Edwina has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Ma. Edwina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell milk, sugar, can goods, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
Hamza is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Hamza has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Hamza would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With the help of this loan, Hamza can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Hamza will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. 

Hamza is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a better house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Salisu

texts.en:
Salisu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Salisu is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Salisu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Salisu will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000/Ha, Salisu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream: to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Jean Fidèle

texts.fr:
Agé de 39 ans, Jean Fidèle est un artisan talentueux et polyvalent. Il est à la fois maçon et bijoutier. Il commençait l'activité de bijouterie en 2012 après quelques formation.  C'est sa femme qui vend les produits finis. Il voudrait investir davantage dans la bijouterie, il voudrait développer et améliorer cette activité qui lui passionne beaucoup. 
Le couple a trois enfants âgés de 6, 8, et 16 ans et ils sont tous scolarisés dans une école privée. La famille a déjà sa propre maison mais c'est petite donc, le couple envisage de construire une autre plus grande et un atelier suivant le norme exigé par le métier.
texts.en:
Jean Fidèle, age 39, is a talented and versatile craftsman. He is a mason and a jewelry-maker. He launched his jewelry business in 2012 after receiving some training. His wife handles the sale of the finished products. Jean Fidèle would like to further invest in his jewelry shop as he is passionate about this work and he plans to expand and improve his activity.

The couple has three children ages 6, 8 and 16 years old who all attend private school. The family already owns a house but since it is rather small, the couple is planning to build a larger home with a shop in compliance with the requirements of his trade.

loans.use: to purchase silver, gemstones, saltpeter, acids, alloys, etc.

loans.name: Arn's Group

texts.en: Arn’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Arn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sothea Group

texts.en:
Sothea is a 34-year-old, married, rice farmer, with two children in her care, residing in the Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice for over 17 years. One of her two children attends school and her husband is a 35-year-old rice farmer, as well. Sothea and her husband can earn approximately USD 4 per day.

Sothea is pictured first from the right. As a group leader, she would like to request a loan as part of a six-member group and she will use her portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing expenses. This loan will help her to have enough money to buy fertilizer for rice cultivation, so she will be able to gain better rice crops to support the family.

In the future, Sothea is going to buy more farmland, build a new, proper house, and support her two children in earning a higher education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing expenses.

loans.name: Aala

texts.en:
Aala is a 21-year-old, single lady from Nablus city. Her father is an old age man of 70 years. He is the sole source of income, where he gets a low and unstable income. This income barely covers all the family’s needs.

Aala is a student in the university where she studies economics. She wants to take the BA degree and find a job in the future to support the family. Aala took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university fees for this semester. By taking this loan, Aala will be able to register in the university and pay part of the urgent expenses she has. Aala appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university fees for this semester.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 26-year-old married woman from Jabalia City, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. She lives with her family in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, her husband earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because she is not able to save enough money, Amal took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, she will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. This will help Amal to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for her family's house.

loans.name: Roudayna

texts.en:
Roudayna is a 37-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and only child. She is a housewife who takes care of her child and her husband covers their needs. He is an employee and works also in the agriculture field.

Due to their difficult financial situation and the fact that the new school year is near, Roudayna needs to take a loan from Kiva Partner Vitas s.a.l to buy the school books . She said that she is very happy and always eager to take additional loans to help her child continue his education suitably.

loans.use: to buy the school stationary

loans.name: |Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle  for her motorcycle transport business.

Angelita has been in this business for 15 years. |Angelita earns more income from buy and sell charcoal.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Gitanjali

texts.en:
Gitanjali is a 30-year-old lady from Sambalpur district, Odisha, India. She lives with her husband and her two daughters. Gitanjali's husband is a food vendor by profession. The income of her husband is used to meet the daily household expenses. They have hardly any savings.Therefore, Gitanjali was never able to build a toilet in her house, for which she is suffering a lot. She has to go long distances and isolated places in order to relieve herself. She does not find this practice to be safe, as she understands the importance of having a toilet at home.Therefore, she is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR. Gitanjali will use the loan amount to build a toilet and incorporate water pipes to it. The loan amount will subsequently result in enhancing cleanliness, health, and hygiene.

Gitanjali is in dire need of your kind help.

loans.use: to build a toilet and incorporate water pipes.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is the age of 49, living with her husband.
Her husband is a catering services provider on wedding ceremonies; he provides the decoration lights, tents on weddings, birthday and engagement ceremonies. He does not consider it a profitable business because this is a seasonal business. Now the marriage season is going on at peak but many tents have become mouldy due to lack of usage till long time. He wants to buy new wedding tents to provide the better services to his customers.

Therefore, Kalsoom has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy new tents and decoration lights to provide the decoration services.
She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new wedding tents and decoration lights for her husband decoration services provider on weddings, birthday parties and engagement ceremonies.

loans.name: Man

texts.en: Mrs. Man is 50 years old, married and has one child. The loan can help her to build a latrine, which can contribute to improve the health for her family as well as environment protection. Farming is main income source of her family and she is able to pay the loan monthly from chicken raising activity.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Naoupu

texts.en: Naoupu is 29 years old and single with 2 children. She runs a small business selling popcorn in her community and has been doing this for 4 years. Naoupu has requested a loan to buy cooking oil, a frying pan, sugar, corn flour. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Naoupu will use her profit to extend her business and to support her family financially .

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, a frying pan, cooking pot, sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.es:
El Sr. Heriberto proviene de una familia muy humilde se casó muy  joven  con la señora Virginia, tuvieron dos hijos, ahora mayores que con sacrificio pudieron sacar adelante.
Para criar a sus hijos él tuvo que dedicarse con su esposa a la agricultura, cría de cerdos que venden un promedio de cada seis meses. 
Pide este préstamo para la compra de animales para la cría, y así seguir con su emprendimiento como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Heriberto comes from a very humble family. He got married very young to Virginia and they had two children who are now older and whom they were able to support with sacrifice.

In order to raise his children, Heriberto had to make a living with his wife in agriculture, raising pigs which they sell every six months on average.

He is asking for this loan to buy animals to raise and like that, continue with his entrepreneurship the way he has been.

loans.use: to buy animals to sell.

loans.name: Taualuga

texts.en: Taualuga is 64 years old and single with 5 children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for 3 years. Taualuga has requested a loan to buy flour, cooking oil, sugar and a frying pan. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Taualuga will use her profit to extend her business and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cooking oil, shopping bags, a frying pan etc.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 55 years old and has five children. Rebecca is married and has one child in school.

Rebecca is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Rebecca requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Rebecca has been in this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rebecca would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Murman

texts.en: Murman is 50 years old. He lives in Khelvachauri district with his wife and child. Murman is an artisan and works daily to generate income. He owns a flat which needs renovation. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 5000 GEL. With the received credit he will renovate a flat and will rent it out at a good price. This will give him a chance to get stable income and improve the living conditions of his family. Murman awaits your support.

loans.use: to renovate a flat and rent it out at a good price in order to generate stable income

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy is 24 years old and he is single. Living in Kampong Cham province, this man works as farmer growing rice to earn main source of income. He sometimes works as paid worker for his neighbor’s brick making business to add more income. He has been in his farming business for three years. He earns only about USD5 per day and can save approximately about USD1.5 each day for future needs. 
Chanthy is now applying for a loan support from VisionFund and he is a new client. He will use his loan to buy a motorcycle to ride to work. He hopes that this purchase will reduce cost of transportation and he believes that it will be convenient to have a motorcycle to travel.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to ride to work.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
The client Emmanuel is a first-time borrower to UGAFODE. He used the money to pay school fees for his children, and he is grateful for the support toward his children's education. His challenge is that the loan will only pay the current term, meaning next term he will have to come back for another loan in order to pay school fees for the next term.

He appreciates the support and looks toward paying well to qualify for more partnerships.

In the photograph is Emmanuel and the UGAFODE credit staff (from right to left).

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Lilliam

texts.es: Lilliam es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a la elaboración de mermeladas. Solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones (₡ 1 000 000), para la compra de equipo de cocina para la elaboración de dichos productos. De esta forma logrará incrementar los ingresos familiares provenientes de esta actividad.
texts.en: Lilliam is an entrepreneurial woman who earns a living making jams. She is asking for a loan of one million colones  (₡ 1.000.000) to purchase kitchen equipment for this business so that she can increase her household income.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for making jams.

loans.name: Soyen

texts.en:
Soyen is 42 years old. He lives at Takmoa district Kandal province, Cambodia. He married since 1994 and has four sons. They have studied at secondary and high school.

Soyen has been a constructor master and raised cattle for 10 years, while his wife is a worker and takes cares of the farm in the village for 3 years. Now he wants to increase his profit more, he applied for a loan to purchase the materials construction to build the house.

loans.use: to purchase the materials construction to build a house.

loans.name: Imee

texts.en:
Imee works hard to support her family. Imee is married and has a bakery business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, milk, sugar, yeast, cream, etc.

Imee has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Imee would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, milk, sugar, yeast, cream, etc

loans.name: Hoan

texts.en:
Hoan is 40 years old, married, and has two children. She is a hardworking woman. Her family’s income is mainly from small business.

Hoan requested a loan, which she will use to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family members. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Marys

texts.en: Marys has been running her grocery store business for many years.She's working very hard just to earn more profit to able to provide the family needs and for the educational needs of her 2 children. She were able to pay her previous loan.She want to expand her business to financially secure and improve the need of the entire family. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase  more grocery goods such as sugar, coffee, noodles and canned goods to boost her stock inventory and to have higher sales.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en:
Araceli is 54 years old, married and has three children.

Araceli is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Araceli requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccines, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Araceli has been in this business for 8 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Araceli would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza is 27 years old and has four children. Aiza is married and two of her children are still in school.

Aiza is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig. Aiza has been in this business for 4 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Aiza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky is 28 years old and married with two children; one child is in school, Jinky works very hard to provide for her family.

Jinky runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, shampoo, snack foods and personal-care products.

Jinky has been in this business for seven years. In the future she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, shampoo, snack foods and personal-care products.

loans.name: Nawun - Yiko  Pwalugu Group

texts.en: Esther is a 38-year-old widow and mother of two children. She lives in Pwalugu, a community in the upper east region of Ghana. She is the individual seated in the middle among colleagues with her hand raised in the photo. Esther is a member of a group called 'Nawun Yiko - Pwalugu'. She sells onions at a place called Tollbooth near the main road leading to the city of Bolga. Esther has been in this business for seven years. She aspires to add another line of business, but she is challenged with inadequate capital. Esther and her group have requested a loan of 22,400 GHC. Her share of the loan is 1000 GHC, which will be used to buy onions for resale. Esther depends on the loan to grow her business until she has adequate funds for her business needs. She wants to earn more income to repay this loan and support her children so they can live a dignified life. Esther is very grateful to her lenders for the support.

loans.use: To buy onions from farmers for resale.

loans.name: Lai

texts.en:
Mrs. Lai is 50 years old. She is a widow. There are four people in her family.

The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine, which can contribute to improving the health of her family as well as protecting the environment.

A small business is the main income source of her family, so she is able to pay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is 32 years old and married. Her husband, who is earning a very low income, provides services for sheltering for houses under construction. He builds a temporary roof to fill with concrete to make a concrete roof. His work depends upon contracts and most of the time he is unable to get any contracts for sheltering services.

Recently Shehnaz's husband has gotten a big contract but he does not have enough sheltering materials to provide proper services. Shehnaz requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which her husband will use to buy more sheltering materials to provide his best services.

loans.use: to purchase sheltering materials for her husband.

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
To earn a living, Annabel and her husband have operated a tricycle business for five years. Tricycles (motorcycles with a covered sidecar that seats anywhere from one passenger to as many as the driver will allow) are a common mode of public transportation in the Philippines. This has been their main source of income for the past five years.

Annabel and her husband work together to meet the needs of their family. Annabel is a mother of two children, ages 14 and 12.

Definitely, Annabel is asking for a loan to maintain and improve their tricycle, such as changing the oil and buying new tires and side cover. She wishes to improve her business and their standard of living.

loans.use: to maintain and improve her tricycle, such as changing the oil and buying new tires and side cover.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe and her family live a simple life in the city of Baybay, Leyte. She has earned a living by selling accessories for seven years while her husband works hard as a farmer. Ma. Fe is the mother of three school aged children ages 20, 17 and 14 years old. She is a 45-year-old woman who dreams of business sustainability to have enough money to finish their house.

As for now, Ma. Fe works hard for their family. She needs additional capital to continue running their business. She will use the money to buy accessories such as hair clips, headbands, mirrors and toys. She will also buy slippers and sandals and clothes. She also plans to buy piglets. Perhaps, she is thinking of other business opportunities just like raising pigs that will help her increase their earnings. With this loan, we could possibly help her enhance their livelihood through the money she is requesting.

loans.use: to buy accessories such as hair clips, headbands, mirrors and toys. She will also buy slippers and sandals, clothes and piglets.

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn is 34 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She sells charcoal and lumber in the Philippines and has requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal and lumber to sell.

Edelyn has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been this business for six years and also earns an income from fish vending and buying and selling vegetables. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal and lumber to sell.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 50 years old and has one child still in school.

Chona has a weaving business in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy silk, abaca and pineapple fiber and to pay for maintenance for her business.

Chona has been in this business for 17 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy silk, abaca and pineapple fiber and pay for maintenance for her business.
